THE NEW TESTAMENT OF OUR LORD AND SAVIOR JESUS CHRIST THE COMMON ENGLISH VERSION CORRECTED BY THE FINAL COMMITTEE OF THE AMERICAN BIBLE UNION Second Revision Willingham Memorial NEW YORK AMERICAN BIBLE UNION LONDON TRUBNER company sixty PATERNOSTER ROW eighteen sixty six twod Thousand Brevier eighteenmo Edition NOTE This Revised Testament has been prepared under the auspices of the American Bible Union by the most competent scholars of the day No expense has been spared to obtain the oldest translations of the Bible copies of the ancient manuscripts and other facilities to make the revision as perfect as possible The paragraph form has been adopted in preference to the division by verse which is a modern mode of division never used in the ancient scriptures But for convenience of reference the numbers of the verses are retained All quotations from the Old Testament are distinctly indicated and the poetic form is restored to those which appear as poetry in the original The revisers have been guided in their labors by the following rules prescribed by the Union RULES FOR THE REVISION OF THE ENGLISH NEW TESTAMENT The received Greek text critically edited with known errors corrected must be followed The common English version must be the basis of revision and only such alterations must be made as the exact meaning of the text and the existing state of the language may require The exact meaning of the inspired text as that text expressed it to those who understood the original Scriptures at the time they were first written must be given in corresponding words and phrases so far as they can be found in the English language with the least possible obscurity or indefiniteness Entered according to Act of Congress in the year eighteen sixty five by THE AMERICAN BIBLE UNION in the Clerk s Office of the District Court of the United States for the Southern District of New York Thomas Holman Printer Corner of Centre and White Sts New York Electrotyped by Smith Isaac begot Jacob and Jacob begot Judah and his brothers three and Judah begot Pharez and Zarah of Tamar and Pharez begot Hezron and Hezron begot Ram four and Ram begot Amminadab and Amminadab begot Nahshon and Nahshon begot Salmon five and Salmon begot Boaz of Rahab and Boaz begot Obed of Ruth and Obed begot Jesse six and Jesse begot David the king and David begot Solomon of the wife of Uriah seven and Solomon begot Rehoboam and Rehoboam begot Abijah and Abijah begot Asa eight and Asa begot Jehoshaphat and Jehoshaphat begot Joram and Joram begot Uzziah nine and Uzziah begot Jotham and Jotham begot Ahaz and Ahaz begot Hezekiah ten and Hezekiah begot Manasseh and Manasseh begot Amon and Amon begot Josiah eleven and Josiah begot Jeconiah and his brothers at the time of the removal to Babylon twelve And after the removal to Babylon Jeconiah begot Salathiel and Salathiel begot Zerubbabel thirteen and Zerubbabel begot Abiud and Abiud begot Eliakim and Eliakim begot Azor fourteen and Azor begot Zadock and Zadock begot Achim and Achim begot Eliud fifteen and Eliud begot Eleazar and Eleazar begot Matthan and Matthan begot Jacob sixteen and Jacob begot Joseph the husband of Mary of whom was born Jesus who is called Christ seventeen All the generations therefore from Abraham unto David are fourteen generations and from David unto the removal to Babylon fourteen generations and from the removal to Babylon unto the Christ fourteen generations eighteen Now the birth of Jesus Christ was after this manner His mother Mary having been betrothed to Joseph before they came together she was found with child by the Holy Spirit nineteen And Joseph her husband being just and not willing to expose her openly one nineteen desired to put her away privately twenty But while he thought on these things behold an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream saying Joseph son of David fear not to take to thee Mary thy wife for that which is begotten in her is of the Holy Spirit twenty one And she shall bring forth a son and thou shalt call his name Jesus for he shall save his people from their sins twenty two And all this has come to pass that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet saying twenty three Behold the virgin shall be with child And shall bring forth a son And they shall call his name Immanuel which is interpreted one twenty three God with us twenty four And Joseph awaking from sleep did as the angel of the Lord bade him and took to him his wife twenty five and he knew her not till she brought forth a son one twenty five and he called his name Jesus II AND Jesus having been born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king behold there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem two saying Where is he that is born King of the Jews For we saw his star in the east and came to do him homage three And the king Herod hearing it was troubled and all Jerusalem with him four And having assembled all the chief priests and scribes of the people he inquired of them where the Christ should be born five And they said to him In Bethlehem of Judaea for thus it is written by the prophet six And thou Bethlehem land of Judah Art by no means least among the princes of Judah For out of thee shall come forth a Governor Who shall rule my people Israel seven Then Herod having secretly called the wise men inquired of them exactly the time of the appearing of the star eight And he sent them to Bethlehem and said Go and inquire strictly concerning the child and when ye have found him bring me word again that I also may come and do him homage nine And they having heard the king departed and lo the star which they saw in the east went before them till it came and stood over where the child was ten And seeing the star they rejoiced with exceeding great joy eleven And coming into the house they saw the child with Mary his mother and fell down and did homage to him and opening their treasures they presented to him gifts gold and frankincense and myrrh twelve And being warned by God in a dream not to return to Herod they departed into their own country by another way thirteen And when they had departed behold an angel of the Lord appears to Joseph in a dream saying Arise and take the child and his mother and flee into Egypt and be there until I bring thee word for Herod is about to seek the child to destroy him fourteen And he arose and took the child and his mother by night and departed into Egypt fifteen and was there until the death of Herod that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet saying Out of Egypt I called my son sixteen Then Herod seeing that he was mocked by the wise men was exceedingly enraged and he sent forth and slew all the male children that were in Bethlehem and in all its borders from two years old and under according to the time which he had exactly learned from the wise men seventeen Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet saying eighteen A voice was heard in Ramah Weeping and great mourning two eighteen Rachel weeping for her children And would not be comforted because they are not nineteen But when Herod was dead behold an angel of the Lord appears in a dream to Joseph in Egypt twenty saying Arise and take the child and his mother and go into the land of Israel for they are dead who sought the child s life twenty one And he arose and took the child and his mother and came into the land of Israel twenty two But hearing that Archelaus reigned in Judaea instead of Herod his father he was afraid to go thither and being warned by God in a dream he retired into the region of Galilee twenty three And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets He shall be called a Nazarene

none	none	IN those days comes John the Immerser preaching in the wilderness of Judaea two and saying Repent for the kingdom of heaven is at hand three For this is he that was spoken of through the prophet Isaiah saying The voice of one crying in the wilderness Prepare the way of the Lord Make straight his paths four And he John had his raiment of camel s hair and a leathern girdle about his loins and his food was locusts and wild honey five Then went out to him Jerusalem and all Judaea and all the region about the Jordan six and they were immersed by him in the Jordan confessing their sins seven But seeing many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his immersion he said to them Brood of vipers who warned you to flee from the coming wrath eight Bring forth therefore fruit worthy of repentance nine and think not to say within yourselves We have Abraham for our father for I say to you that God is able of these stones to raise up children to Abraham ten And already the axe is laid to the root of the trees therefore every tree that brings not forth good fruit is cut down and cast into the fire eleven I indeed immerse you in water unto repentance but he that comes after me is mightier than I whose sandals I am not worthy to bear he will immerse you in the Holy Spirit and fire twelve whose fan is in his hand and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor and will gather his wheat into the garner but the chaff he will burn up with fire unquenchable thirteen Then Jesus comes from Galilee to the Jordan to John to be immersed by him fourteen But John sought to hinder him saying I have need to be immersed by thee and dost thou come to me fifteen And Jesus answering said to him Suffer it now for thus it becomes us to fulfill all righteousness Then he suffered him sixteen And having been immersed Jesus went up immediately from the water and lo the heavens were opened to him and he saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove and coming upon him seventeen And lo a voice out of heaven saying This is my beloved Son in whom I am well pleased IV THEN Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the Devil two And having fasted forty days and forty nights he afterwards hungered three And coming to him the tempter said If thou art the Son of God command that these stones become loaves of bread four But he answering said It is written Man shall not live on bread alone but on every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God five Then the Devil takes him into the holy city and sets him on the pinnacle of the temple six and says to him If thou art the Son of God cast thyself down for it is written He will give his angels command concerning thee And on their hands they will bear thee up Lest haply thou dash thy foot against a stone seven Jesus said to him Again it is written Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God eight Again the Devil takes him into an exceedingly high mountain and shows him all the kingdoms of the world and the glory of them nine and says to him All these things I will give thee if thou wilt fall down and worship me ten Then Jesus says to him Get thee hence Satan for it is written Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God and him only shalt thou serve eleven Then the Devil leaves him and behold angels came and ministered to him twelve And hearing that John was delivered up he retired into Galilee thirteen And leaving Nazareth he came and dwelt in Capernaum which is by the sea in the borders of Zebulun and Naphtali fourteen that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet saying fifteen The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali By the way of the sea beyond the Jordan Galilee of the Gentiles sixteen The people that sat in darkness saw great light And to those sitting in the region and shadow of death light sprang up seventeen From that time Jesus began to preach and to say Repent for the kingdom of heaven is at hand eighteen And walking by the sea of Galilee he saw two brothers Simon called Peter and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea for they were fishermen nineteen And he says to them Come after me and I will make you fishers of men twenty And they immediately leaving the nets followed him twenty one And going on from thence he saw other two brothers James the son of Zebedee and John his brother in the ship with Zebedee their father mending their nets and he called them twenty two And they immediately leaving the ship and their father followed him twenty three And Jesus went about all Galilee teaching in their synagogues and preaching the good news of the kingdom and healing every sickness and every infirmity among the people twenty four And his fame went forth into all Syria and they brought to him all that were sick taken with divers diseases and torments and possessed with demons and lunatic and palsied and he healed them twenty five And great multitudes followed him from Galilee and Decapolis and Jerusalem and Judaea and from beyond the Jordan V AND seeing the multitudes he went up into the mountain and he having sat down his disciples came to him two And he opened his mouth and taught them saying three Happy the poor in spirit for theirs is the kingdom of heaven four Happy they that mourn for they shall be comforted five Happy the meek for they shall inherit the earth five five six Happy they that hunger and thirst after righteousness for they shall be filled seven Happy the merciful for they shall obtain mercy eight Happy the pure in heart for they shall see God nine Happy the peacemakers for they shall be called sons of God ten Happy they who are persecuted for righteousness sake for theirs is the kingdom of heaven eleven Happy are ye when they shall revile and persecute you and shall say all evil against you falsely five eleven for my sake twelve Rejoice and exult because great is your reward in heaven for so they persecuted the prophets that were before you thirteen Ye are the salt of the earth but if the salt become tasteless wherewith shall it be salted It is thenceforth good for nothing but to be cast out and to be trodden under foot by men fourteen Ye are the light of the world A city that is set on a hill can not be hid fifteen Nor do they light a lamp and put it under the bushel but on the lamp stand and it shines to all that are in the house sixteen Thus let your light shine before men that they may see your good works and glorify your Father who is in heaven seventeen Think not that I came to destroy the law or the prophets I came not to destroy but to fulfill eighteen For verily I say to you till heaven and earth pass one jot or one tittle shall not pass from the law till all be fulfilled nineteen Whoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments and shall teach men so shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven but whoever shall do and teach them he shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven twenty For I say to you that except your righteousness shall exceed that of the scribes and Pharisees ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven twenty one Ye heard that it was said to those five twenty one of old Thou shalt not kill and whoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment twenty two But I say to you that every one who is angry with his brother without cause five twenty twoa shall be in danger of the judgment and whoever shall say to his brother Raca five twenty twob shall be in danger of the council and whoever shall say Thou fool shall be in danger of hell fire twenty three Therefore if thou bringest thy gift to the altar and there rememberest that thy brother has aught against thee twenty four leave there thy gift before the altar and go first be reconciled to thy brother and then come and offer thy gift twenty five Agree with thine adversary quickly while thou art in the way with him lest haply the adversary deliver thee to the judge and the judge deliver thee to the officer and thou be cast into prison twenty six Verily I say to thee thou shalt not come out thence till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing twenty seven Ye heard that it was said Thou shalt not commit adultery twenty eight But I say to you that every one who looks on a woman to lust after her has already committed adultery with her in his heart twenty nine And if thy right eye causes thee to offend pluck it out and cast it from thee for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members perish and not thy whole body be cast into hell thirty And if thy right hand causes thee to offend cut it off and cast it from thee for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members perish and not thy whole body be cast into hell thirty one And it was said Whoever shall put away his wife let him give her a writing of divorcement thirty two But I say to you that whoever shall put away his wife save for the cause of fornication makes her commit adultery and whoever shall marry her when put away commits adultery thirty three Again ye heard that it was said to those of old five thirty three Thou shalt not swear falsely but shalt perform to the Lord thine oaths thirty four But I say to you swear not at all neither by heaven for it is God s throne thirty five nor by the earth for it is his footstool nor by Jerusalem for it is the city of the great King thirty six Nor shalt thou swear by thy head because thou canst not make one hair white or black thirty seven But let your word be Yea yea Nay nay for that which is more than these comes of evil thirty eight Ye heard that it was said An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth thirty nine But I say to you that ye resist not evil but whoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek turn to him the other also forty And if any man will sue thee at the law and take thy coat let him have thy cloak also forty one And whoever shall compel thee to go one mile go with him two forty two Give to him that asks of thee and from him that would borrow of thee turn not away forty three Ye heard that it was said Thou shalt love thy neighbor and shalt hate thine enemy forty four But I say to you love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you forty five that ye may be sons of your Father who is in heaven for he causes his sun to rise on the evil and the good and sends rain on the just and the unjust forty six For if ye love those who love you what reward have ye Do not also the publicans the same forty seven And if ye salute your brethren only what do ye that excels Do not also the heathen thus forty eight Be ye therefore perfect even as your Father who is in heaven is perfect VI TAKE heed that ye do not your righteousness before men to be seen by them otherwise ye have no reward with your Father who is in heaven two Therefore when thou doest alms do not sound a trumpet before thee as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets that they may have glory of men Verily I say to you they have in full their reward three But when thou doest alms let not thy left hand know what thy right hand does four that thine aims may be in secret and thy Father who sees in secret will himself reward thee five And when ye pray ye shall not be as the hypocrites for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets that they may be seen by men Verily I say to you they have in full their reward six But thou when thou prayest enter into thy closet and having shut thy door pray to thy Father who is in secret and thy Father who sees in secret will reward thee seven But when ye pray use not vain repetitions as the heathen do for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking eight Be not ye therefore like to them for your Father knows what things ye have need of before ye ask him nine Do ye therefore pray after this manner Our Father who art in heaven hallowed be thy name ten Thy kingdom come thy will be done as in heaven so also on the earth eleven Give us this day our daily bread six eleven twelve And forgive us our debts as also we forgave our debtors thirteen And bring us not into temptation but deliver us from evil six thirteen fourteen For if ye forgive men their trespasses your heavenly Father will also forgive you fifteen but if ye forgive not men their trespasses neither will your Father forgive your trespasses sixteen And when ye fast be not as the hypocrites of a sad countenance for they disfigure their faces that they may appear to men to fast Verily I say to you they have in full their reward seventeen But thou when thou fastest anoint thy head and wash thy face eighteen that thou appear not to men to fast but to thy Father who is in secret and thy Father who sees in secret will reward thee nineteen Lay not up for yourselves treasures on the earth where moth and rust consume and where thieves break through and steal twenty But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven where neither moth nor rust consumes and where thieves do not break through nor steal twenty one For where your treasure is there will your heart be also twenty two The lamp of the body is the eye If therefore thine eye be single thy whole body will be light twenty three but if thine eye be evil thy whole body will be dark If therefore the light that is in thee is darkness how great the darkness twenty four No man can serve two masters for either he will hate the one and love the other or he will hold to one and despise the other Ye can not serve God and Mammon twenty five For this cause I say to you take not thought for your life what ye shall eat or what ye shall drink nor for your body what ye shall put on Is not the life more than food and the body than raiment twenty six Behold the birds of the air that they sow not nor reap nor gather into barns and your heavenly Father feeds them Are ye not much better than they twenty seven And which of you by taking thought can add one cubit to his stature six twenty seven twenty eight And why take ye thought for raiment Consider the lilies of the field how they grow They toil not nor spin twenty nine and I say to you that even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these thirty And if God so clothes the grass of the field which to day is and to morrow is cast into the oven will he not much more you ye of little faith thirty one Take not thought therefore saying What shall we eat or What shall we drink or Wherewith shall we be clothed thirty two For after all these do the Gentiles seek For your heavenly Father knows that ye have need of all these thirty three But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness and all these shall be added to you thirty four Take not thought therefore for the morrow for the morrow will take thought for itself Sufficient for the day is the evil thereof VII JUDGE not that ye be not judged two For with what judgment ye judge ye shall be judged and with what measure ye mete it shall be measured to you three And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother s eye but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye four Or how wilt thou say to thy brother Let me cast out the mote from thine eye and behold the beam is in thine own eye five Hypocrite first cast out the beam out of thine own eye and then thou wilt see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother s eye six Give not that which is holy to the dogs nor cast your pearls before the swine lest they trample them with their feet and turn and rend you seven Ask and it shall be given you seek and ye shall find knock and it shall be opened to you eight For every one that asks receives and he that seeks finds and to him that knocks it shall be opened nine Or what man is there of you of whom if his son ask bread will he give him a stone ten And if he ask a fish will he give him a serpent eleven If ye then being evil know how to give good gifts to your children how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him twelve Therefore all things whatever ye would that men should do to you so also do ye to them for this is the law and the prophets thirteen Enter in through the strait gate because wide is the gate and broad the way that leads to destruction and many are they who go in thereat fourteen seven fourteen Because strait is the gate and narrow the way that leads to life and few are they who find it fifteen Beware of false prophets who come to you in sheeps clothing but inwardly are ravening wolves sixteen Ye shall know them from their fruits Do men gather grapes from thorns or figs from thistles seventeen So every good tree brings forth good fruit but the corrupt tree brings forth evil fruit eighteen A good tree can not bring forth evil fruit nor a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit nineteen Every tree that brings not forth good fruit is cut down and cast into the fire twenty So then from their fruits ye shall know them twenty one Not every one that says to me Lord Lord shall enter into eight And be not afraid of those who kill the body but are not able to kill the soul but rather fear him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell twenty nine Are not two sparrows sold for a thirty two Every one therefore who shall acknowledge me before men him will I also acknowledge before my Father who is in heaven thirty three But whoever shall deny me before men him will I also deny that he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities two And John having heard in the prison the works of the Christ sent by his disciples three and said to him Art thou he that comes or eight Come unto me all ye that labor and are heavy laden and I will give you rest twenty nine Take my yoke upon you and learn from me for I am meek and lowly in heart and ye shall find rest for your souls thirty For my yoke is easy and my burden light XII AT that time Jesus went on the sabbath through the grain fields and his disciples were hungry and began to pluck ears of grain and to eat two thirteen Then he says to the man Stretch forth thy hand And he stretched it forth and it was restored whole as the other fourteen And the Pharisees went out and took counsel against him how they might three Either make the tree good and its fruit good or make the tree corrupt and its fruit corrupt for from the fruit the tree is known thirty four Brood of vipers How can ye being evil speak good he is offended twenty two And that sown among the thorns this is he that hears the word and the care of this world and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word and it becomes unfruitful twenty three And that sown on the good ground this is he that hears the word and understands who bears fruit and produces some a hundredfold some sixty some thirty twenty four Another parable he put forth to them Because of your want of faith For verily I say to you if ye have faith as a grain of mustard ye shall say to this mountain remove hence to yonder place and it shall remove and nothing shall be impossible to you twenty one But this kind goes not forth except by prayer and fasting twenty two And while they abode in Galilee Jesus said to them The Son of man is about to be delivered into the Simon Of whom do the kings of the earth take customs or tribute Of their sons or of strangers twenty six He says to him Of strangers Jesus said to him Then are the sons free twenty seven But that we the disciples to Jesus saying Who then is greatest in the kingdom of heaven two And Jesus calling a little child to him placed it in the midst of them three and said Verily I say to you if ye do not turn and become as the little children ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven four Whoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child he is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven five And whoever shall receive one such little child in my name receives me six But whoever shall cause one of these little ones that believe on me to offend it were better for him that an upper millstone were hanged about his neck and he were plunged in the depth of the sea seven Woe to the world for causes of offense For it must needs be that causes of offense come but woe to that man through whom the cause of offense comes eight But if thy hand or thy foot causes thee to offend cut it off and cast it from thee It is better for thee to enter into life lame or maimed than having two hands or two feet to be cast into the everlasting fire nine And if thine eye causes thee to offend pluck it out and cast it from thee It is better for thee to enter into life with one eye than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire ten Take heed that ye despise not one of these little ones for I say to you that their angels in heaven always behold the face of my Father who is in heaven eleven For the Son of man came to save that which was lost twelve What think ye If a man has a hundred sheep and one of them is gone astray does he not leave the ninety and nine upon the mountains and go and seek that which is gone astray thirteen And if it be that he find it verily I say to you he rejoices over it more than over the ninety and nine that went not astray fourteen So it is not the will of your Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones perish fifteen But if thy brother shall sin against thee go show him his fault between thee and him alone If he shall hear thee thou hast gained thy brother sixteen But if he hear not take with thee one or two more that in the mouth of two or three witnesses every word may be established seventeen And if he shall neglect to hear them tell it to the church and if he neglect to hear the church also let him be to thee as a heathen and a publican eighteen Verily I say to you Whatever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven and whatever ye shall loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven nineteen Again I say to you that if two of you shall agree on earth concerning any thing that they shall ask it shall be done for them by my Father who is in heaven twenty For where two or three are gathered together in my name there am I in the midst of them twenty one Then Peter came to him and said Lord how often shall my brother sin against me and I forgive him Until seven times twenty two Jesus says to him I say not to thee until seven times but until seventy times seven twenty three Therefore is the kingdom of heaven likened to a certain king who desired to make a reckoning with his servants twenty four And when he had begun to reckon there was brought to him one who owed ten thousand talents eighteen twenty four twenty five But as he was not able to pay his lord commanded him to be sold and his wife and children and all that he had and payment to be made twenty six The servant therefore falling prostrated himself before him saying Have patience with me and I will pay thee all twenty seven And the lord of that servant moved with compassion released him and forgave him the debt twenty eight But that servant went out and found one of his fellow servants who owed him a hundred denaries eighteen twenty eight and laying hold of him he took him by the throat saying Pay me that thou owest twenty nine Therefore his fellow servant fell down and besought him saying Have patience with me and I will pay thee thirty And he would not but went and cast him into prison till he should pay the debt thirty one And his fellow servants seeing what was done were very sorry and came and disclosed to their lord all that was done thirty two Then having called him his lord says to him Thou wicked servant I forgave thee all that debt because thou besoughtest me thirty three Shouldest not thou also have had pity on thy fellow servant as I too had pity on thee thirty four And his lord was angry and delivered him to the tormentors till he should pay all that was due to him thirty five So also will my heavenly Father do to you if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother XIX AND it came to pass when Jesus finished these sayings that he departed from Galilee and came into the borders of Judaea beyond the Jordan two And great multitudes followed him and he healed them there three And the Pharisees came to him tempting him and saying Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause four And he answering said to them Have ye not read that he who made them nineteen four from the beginning made them male and female five and said For this cause shall a man leave father and mother and shall cleave to his wife and the two shall be one flesh six So that they are no longer two but one flesh What therefore God joined together let not man put asunder seven They say to him Why then did Moses command to give a writing of divorcement and to put her away eight He says to them Moses for your hardness of heart suffered you to put away your wives but from the beginning it was not so nine And I say to you that whoever shall put away his wife except for fornication and shall marry another commits adultery and whoever marries her when put away commits adultery ten His disciples say to him If the case of the man with the woman is so it is not good to marry eleven But he said to them Not all can receive this saying but they to whom it is given twelve For there are eunuchs who were so born from the mother s womb and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by men and there are eunuchs who made themselves eunuchs for the sake of the kingdom of heaven He that is able to receive it let him receive it thirteen Then were brought to him little children that he might put his hands on them and pray and the disciples rebuked them fourteen But Jesus said Suffer the little children and forbid them not to come to me for to such belongs the kingdom of heaven fifteen And he laid his hands on them and departed thence sixteen And behold one came to him and said Teacher what good shall I do that I may have eternal life seventeen And he said to him Why dost thou ask me concerning good One is the Good But if thou desirest to enter into life keep the commandments eighteen He says to him Which Jesus said Thou shalt not kill Thou shalt not commit adultery Thou shalt not steal Thou shalt not bear false witness nineteen Honor thy father and thy mother and Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself twenty The young man says to him All these I kept what do I yet lack twenty one Jesus said to him If thou desirest to be perfect go sell what thou hast and give to the poor and thou shalt have treasure in heaven and come follow me twenty two But when the young man heard this saying he went away sorrowful for he had great possessions twenty three And Jesus said to his disciples Verily I say to you that a rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven twenty four And again I say to you It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God twenty five And the disciples hearing it were exceedingly amazed saying Who then can be saved twenty six But Jesus looking on them said to them With men this is impossible but with God all things are possible twenty seven Then Peter answering said to him Behold we forsook all and followed thee what then shall we have twenty eight And Jesus said to them Verily I say to you that ye who followed me in the renovation when the Son of man shall sit on his throne of glory shall also sit on twelve thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel twenty nine And every one who forsook houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands for my name s sake shall receive manifold more and shall inherit everlasting life thirty But many first will be last and last first XX FOR the kingdom of heaven is like to a householder who went out early in the morning to hire laborers into his vineyard two And having agreed with the laborers for a denary twenty two a day he sent them into his vineyard three And he went out about the third hour and saw others standing idle in the market place four And to them he said Go ye also into the vineyard and whatever is right I will give you And they went their way five Again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour and did likewise six And about the eleventh he went out and found others standing and says to them Why stand ye here all the day idle seven They say to him Because no one hired us He says to them Go ye also into the vineyard eight And when evening was come the lord of the vineyard says to his steward Call the laborers and pay them the hire beginning from the last unto the first nine And they of the eleventh hour came and received every man a denary ten But when the first came they supposed that they should receive more and they also received each one a denary eleven And on receiving it they murmured against the householder twelve saying These last labored one hour and thou madest them equal to us who bore the burden of the day and the burning heat thirteen But he answering said to one of them Friend I do thee no wrong Didst thou not agree with me for a denary fourteen Take what is thine and go But I will give to this last even as to thee fifteen Is it not lawful for me to do what I will with my own Is thine eye evil because I am good sixteen So will the last be first and the first last for many are called but few are chosen seventeen And Jesus going up to Jerusalem took the twelve disciples apart and in the way he said to them eighteen Behold we are going up to Jerusalem and the Son of man will be delivered to the chief priests and scribes and they will condemn him to death nineteen and will deliver him to the Gentiles to mock and scourge and crucify and on the third day he will rise again twenty Then came to him the mother of the sons of Zebedee with her sons bowing down and asking a certain thing of him twenty one And he said to her What wilt thou She says to him Command that these my two sons shall sit one on thy right hand and one on thy left in thy kingdom twenty two But Jesus answering said Ye know not what ye ask Are ye able to drink of the cup that I shall drink of They say to him We are able twenty three And he says to them Ye shall drink indeed of my cup but to sit on my right hand and on my left is not mine to give but is for them for whom it has been prepared by my Father twenty four And the ten hearing it were much displeased with the two brothers twenty five But Jesus having called them to him said Ye know that the rulers of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them and they that are great exercise authority over them twenty six Not so shall it be among you twenty seven but whoever would become great among you let him be your minister and whoever would be first among you let him be your servant twenty eight even as the Son of man came not to be ministered to but to minister and to give his life a ransom for many twenty nine And as they were going forth from Jericho a great multitude followed him thirty And behold two blind men sitting by the way side hearing that Jesus was passing by cried saying Have mercy on us O Lord Son of David thirty one And the multitude rebuked them that they should hold their peace But they cried the more saying Have mercy on us O Lord Son of David thirty two And Jesus stood still and called them and said What will ye that I shall do to you thirty three They say to him Lord that our eyes may be opened thirty four And Jesus moved with compassion touched their eyes and immediately their eyes received sight and they followed him XXI AND when they drew near to Jerusalem and came to Bethphage at the mount of the Olives Jesus sent forth two disciples two saying to them Go into the village over against you and straightway ye will find an ass tied and a colt with her loose and bring them to me three And if any one say aught to you ye shall say The Lord has need of them and straightway he will send them four Now all this has been done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet saying five Say to the daughter of Zion Behold thy King comes to thee Meek and mounted upon an ass And upon a colt the foal of a beast of burden six And the disciples having gone and done as Jesus commanded them seven brought the ass and the colt and put on them their garments and he sat thereon eight And most of the multitude spread their own garments in the way and others cut down branches from the trees and strewed in the way nine And the multitudes that went before and that followed cried saying Hosanna twenty one nine to the Son of David Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord Hosanna in the highest ten And as he entered into Jerusalem all the city was moved saying Who is this eleven And the multitudes said This is Jesus the prophet from Nazareth of Galilee twelve And Jesus entered into the temple of God and cast out all that sold and bought in the temple and overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who sold doves thirteen And he says to them It is written My house shall be called a house of prayer But ye make it a den of robbers fourteen And the blind and the lame came to him in the temple and he healed immediately wither away twenty one And Jesus answering said to them Verily I say to you if ye have faith and do not doubt not only shall ye do what is done to the fig tree but even if ye say to this among themselves saying If we say From heaven he will say to us Why then did ye not believe him twenty six But if we say From men we fear the multitude for all hold John as a prophet twenty seven And they answered Jesus saying We do not know And he said to them Neither do I say to you by what authority I do these things twenty eight But what think ye A man had two sons and he came to the first and answering said I will sir and went not thirty one Which of the two did the father s will They say to him The first twenty one thirty one Jesus says to them Verily I say to you that the publicans and had seen it repented not afterward that ye might believe him thirty three Hear another parable There was a householder who planted a vineyard and put a hedge around it and dug a winepress in it and built a tower and let it out to husband men and went abroad thirty four And when the season of fruits drew near he sent his servants to the husbandmen to receive his fruits thirty five And the husbandmen taking his servants beat one and killed another and stoned another thirty six Again he sent other servants more than the first and they did to them likewise thirty seven And afterward he sent to them his son saying They will reverence my son thirty eight But the husbandmen seeing the son said among themselves This is the heir come let us kill him and have his inheritance thirty nine And taking him they cast him out of the vineyard and killed him forty When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes what will he do to those husbandmen forty one They say to him He will miserably destroy those wicked men and will let out the vineyard to other husbandmen who will deliver over to him the fruits in their seasons forty two Jesus says to them Did ye never read in the Scriptures The five And the chief priests and Pharisees hearing his parables knew that he spoke of them forty six And they sought to lay hold of him but feared the multitudes since they held him as a prophet XXII AND Jesus answering spoke to them again in parables saying two The kingdom of heaven is like to a certain king who made a marriage for his son three And he sent forth his servants to call those who seven And the king hearing it was angry and sending forth his armies he destroyed those murderers and burned up their city eight Then he says to his servants The wedding is ready but they who were bidden were not worthy nine Go therefore into the thoroughfares and as many as ye find bid to the marriage ten And those servants went out into the highways and gathered together all as many as they the resurrection of the dead have ye not read that which was spoken to you by God saying thirty two I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob God is not the God of the dead but say to him Of David forty three He says to them How then does David in the Spirit call him Lord saying forty four The Lord said to my Lord Sit on my right hand Till I put thine enemies under thy feet forty five If then David calls him Lord how is he his son forty six And no one was able to answer him a word nor durst any one from that day question him any more XXIII THEN Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to his disciples two saying The scribes and the Pharisees sat down in Moses seat three All therefore whatever they bid you do and observe but do not according to their works for they yourselves sixteen Woe to you blind guides who say Whoever shall swear by the temple it is nothing but whoever shall swear by the gold of the temple he is bound seventeen Fools and blind for which is greater the gold or the temple that sanctifies the gold eighteen And Whoever shall swear by the altar it is nothing but whoever shall swear by the gift that is upon it he is bound nineteen Fools and blind for which is greater the gift or the altar that sanctifies the gift twenty He therefore who swears by the altar swears by it and by all things thereon twenty one And he that swears by the temple of rapacity and excess twenty six Blind Pharisee Cleanse first the inside of the cup and the platter that its outside also may become clean twenty seven Woe to you scribes and Pharisees hypocrites righteous and say thirty If we had been in the days of our fathers we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets thirty one So that ye witness to yourselves that ye are sons is he that comes in the name of the Lord XXIV AND Jesus went out and departed from the temple and his disciples came to him to show him the buildings of the temple two And he answering said to them five Who then is the faithful and wise servant whom his lord set over his household to give them their food in due season forty six Happy that servant whom his lord when he comes shall find so doing forty seven Verily I say to you that he will set him over all his goods forty eight But if that evil servant shall say in his heart My lord delays his coming forty nine and shall begin to beat his fellow servants and shall eat and drink with the drunken fifty the lord of that servant will come in a day when he looks not for it and in an hour when he is not aware fifty one and will cut him asunder and appoint his portion with the hypocrites There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth XXV THEN shall the kingdom of heaven be likened to ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom two And five of them were wise and five foolish three The foolish taking their lamps took no oil with them four but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps five While the bridegroom tarried they all slumbered and slept six And at midnight a cry was made Behold the bridegroom Go out to meet him seven Then all those virgins arose and trimmed their lamps eight And the foolish said to the wise Give us of your oil for our lamps are going out nine But the wise answered saying Not so there will not be enough for us and you Go rather to those who sell and buy for yourselves ten And while they went to buy the bridegroom came and they who were ready went in with him to the marriage and the door was shut eleven And afterward come also the rest of the virgins saying Lord Lord open to us twelve But he answering said Verily I say to you I know you not thirteen Watch therefore because ye know not the day nor the hour fourteen For as a man going abroad called his own servants and delivered to them his goods fifteen and to one gave five talents to another two and to another one to each according to his own ability and straightway went abroad sixteen And he that received the five talents went and traded with them and gained other five talents seventeen Likewise also he that received the two gained other two eighteen But he that received the one went away and digged in the earth and hid his lord s money nineteen After a long time the lord of those servants comes and reckons with them twenty And he that received the five talents came and brought other five talents saying Lord thou deliveredst to me five talents behold I gained other five talents beside them twenty one His lord said to him Well done good and faithful servant thou wast faithful over a little I will set thee over much Enter thou into the joy of thy lord twenty two And he also that received the two talents came and said Lord thou deliveredst to me two talents behold I gained other two talents beside them twenty three His lord said to him Well done good and faithful servant thou wast faithful over a little I will set thee over much Enter thou into the joy of thy lord twenty four And he also that received the one talent came and said Lord I knew thee that thou art a hard man reaping where thou didst not sow and gathering where thou strewedst not twenty five And fearing I went and hid thy talent in the earth Lo thou hast thine own twenty six And his lord answering said to him Wicked and slothful servant Thou knewest that I reap where I did not sow and gather where I strewed not twenty seven Thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers and when I came I should have received my own with interest twenty eight Take therefore the talent from him and give to him that has the ten talents twenty nine For to every one that has shall be given and he shall have abundance but from him that has not even what he has shall be taken away thirty And cast forth the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth thirty one And when the Son of man shall come in his glory and all the angels with him then will he sit set the sheep on his right hand but the goats on the left thirty four Then will the King say to those on his right hand Come blessed of my Father inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world thirty five For I was hungry and ye gave me to eat I was thirsty and ye gave me drink I was a stranger and ye took me in thirty six naked and ye clothed me I was sick and ye visited me I was in prison and ye came to me thirty seven Then will the righteous answer him saying Lord when saw we thee hungering and fed thee or thirsting and gave thee drink thirty eight And when saw we thee a stranger and took thee in or naked and clothed thee thirty nine And when saw we thee sick or in prison and came to thee forty And the King will answer and say to them Verily I say to you inasmuch as ye did it to one of the least of these my brethren ye did it to me forty one Then will he say also to those on the left hand Depart from me accursed into the everlasting fire prepared for the Devil and his angels forty two For I was hungry and ye did not give me to eat I was thirsty and ye did not give me drink forty three I was a stranger and ye did not take me in naked and ye did not work upon me eleven For the poor ye have always with you but me ye have not always twelve For she in pouring this ointment on my body did it to prepare me for burial thirteen Verily I say to you And when evening was come he reclined at table with the twelve twenty one And as they were eating he said Verily I say to you that one of you will betray me twenty two And they were exceedingly GOSPEL ACCORDING TO MARK I THE beginning of the good news of Jesus Christ Son of God two as it is written in Isaiah the prophet Behold I send forth my messenger before thy face who shall prepare thy way three the voice of one crying in the wilderness Prepare the way of the Lord make straight his paths four John came immersing in the wilderness and preaching the immersion of repentance unto remission of sins five And there went out to him all the country of Judaea and all they of Jerusalem and they were immersed by him in the river Jordan confessing their sins six And John was clothed with camel s hair and with a leathern girdle about his loins and ate locusts and wild honey seven And he preached saying There comes after me he that is mightier than I the latchet of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loose eight I indeed immersed you in water but he will immerse you in the Holy Spirit nine And it came to pass in those days that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee and was immersed by John in the Jordan ten And straightway coming up out of the water he saw the heavens parted and the Spirit as a dove descending upon him eleven And there came a voice out of heaven Thou art my beloved son in thee I am well pleased twelve And immediately the Spirit drives him forth into the wilderness thirteen And he was in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan and was with the wild beasts and the angels ministered to him fourteen And after John was delivered up Jesus came into Galilee publishing the good news of the kingdom of God one fourteen fifteen and saying The time is fulfilled and the kingdom of God is at hand repent and believe in the good news sixteen And walking by the sea of Galilee he saw Simon and Andrew Simon s brother casting a net in the sea for they were fishermen seventeen And Jesus said to them Come after me and I will cause you to become fishers of men eighteen And immediately leaving the nets they followed him nineteen And going a little further he saw James the son of Zebedee and John his brother who also were in the ship mending the nets twenty And straightway he called them and leaving their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants they went after him twenty one And they enter into Capernaum and straightway on the sabbath he went into the synagogue and taught twenty two And they were astonished at his teaching for he taught them as having authority and not as the scribes twenty three And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit And he cried out twenty four saying What have we to do with thee one twenty four Jesus Nazarene Didst thou come to destroy us I know thee who thou art the Holy One of God twenty five And Jesus rebuked him saying Hold thy peace and come out of him twenty six And the unclean spirit tearing him and crying with a loud voice came out of him twenty seven And they were all amazed so that they questioned among themselves saying What is this one twenty seven A new teaching with authority And he commands the unclean spirits and they obey him twenty eight And immediately his fame spread abroad into all the surrounding region of Galilee twenty nine And immediately having come out of the synagogue they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew with James and John thirty And the mother in law of Simon was lying sick with fever and immediately they tell him concerning her thirty one And he came and raised her up taking hold of her hand and immediately the fever left her and she ministered to them thirty two And evening having come when the sun set they brought to him all that were sick and those possessed with demons thirty three And all the city was gathered together at the door thirty four And he healed many that were sick with divers diseases and cast out many demons and suffered not the demons to speak because they knew him thirty five And rising very early by night he went out and departed into a solitary place and there prayed thirty six And Simon and they who were with him followed after him thirty seven And having found him they say to him All are seeking thee thirty eight And he says to them Let us go elsewhere into the neighboring towns that I may preach there also for for this I came forth thirty nine And he was preaching in their synagogues throughout all Galilee and casting out the demons forty And there came a leper to him beseeching him and kneeling down to him and saying to him If thou wilt thou canst cleanse me forty one And Jesus moved with compassion stretched forth his hand and touched him and says to him I will be thou cleansed forty two And immediately the leprosy departed from him and he was cleansed forty three And sternly charging him he forthwith sent him away forty four and says to him See thou say nothing to any one but go show thyself to the priest and offer for thy cleansing what Moses commanded for a testimony to them forty five But he going forth began to publish it much and to spread abroad the report so that he could no longer openly enter into a city but was without in desert places And they came to him from every quarter II AND again he entered into Capernaum after some days and it was heard that he is in the house two And straightway many were gathered together so that there was no longer room not even at the door and he spoke the word to them three And they come to him bringing one that was palsied borne by four four And not being able to come near him on account of the multitude they uncovered the roof where he was and having broken it up they let down the bed whereon the palsied man lay five And Jesus seeing their faith says to the palsied man Child thy sins are forgiven six But there were some of the scribes sitting there and reasoning in their hearts seven Why does this man speak thus He blasphemes Who can forgive sins but one God eight And Jesus immediately perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves said to them Why reason ye these things in your hearts nine Which is easier to say to the palsied man Thy sins are forgiven or to say Arise and take up thy bed and walk ten But that ye may know that the Son of man has power on earth to forgive sins he says to the palsied man eleven I say to thee arise take up thy bed and go to thy house twelve And he arose and immediately taking up the bed went forth before all so that all were amazed and glorified God saying We never saw it thus thirteen And he went forth again by the sea side and all the multitude came to him and he taught them fourteen And passing along he saw Levi the son of Alpheus sitting at the place of receiving custom and said to him Follow me And rising up he followed him fifteen And it came to pass as he reclined at table in his house that many publicans and sinners were reclining with Jesus and his disciples for there were many and they followed him sixteen And the scribes and the Pharisees seeing him eating with the sinners and publicans said to his disciples How is it that he eats and drinks with the sinners and the publicans seventeen And Jesus hearing it says to them They who are well need not a physician but they who are sick I came not to call righteous men but sinners eighteen And the disciples of John and the Pharisees were fasting two eighteen and they come and say to him Why do the disciples of John and the Pharisees fast but thy disciples fast not nineteen And Jesus said to them Can the sons of the bridechamber fast two nineteen while the bridegroom is with them So long as they have the bridegroom with them they can not fast twenty But days will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them and then they will fast in that day twenty one No one sews a piece of unfulled cloth upon an old garment else the new filling up of the old takes from it and a worse rent is made twenty two And no one puts new wine into old skins else the wine bursts the skins and the wine is destroyed and the skins two twenty two twenty three And it came to pass that he went through the grain fields on the sabbath and his disciples began to go forward two twenty three plucking the ears of grain twenty four And the Pharisees said to him Behold why do they on the sabbath that which is not lawful twenty five And he said to them Did ye never read what David did when he had need and hungered himself and they who were with him twenty six how he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest and ate the show bread which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests and gave also to those who were with him twenty seven And he said to them The sabbath was made for man and not man for the sabbath twenty eight So that the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath III AND he entered again into the synagogue and there was a man there having his hand withered two And they watched him whether he would heal him on the sabbath that they might accuse him three And he says to the man having the withered hand Arise and come into the midst four And he says to them Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath or to do evil to save life or to kill But they were silent five And looking round on them with anger being grieved for their hardness of heart he says to the man Stretch forth thy hand And he stretched it forth and his hand was restored six And going out the Pharisees immediately took counsel with the twenty And the multitude comes together again so that they could not even eat bread twenty one And hearing of it his kinsmen went out to lay hold of him for they said He is beside himself twenty two And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem said He has Beelzebul and through the prince of the demons he casts out the demons twenty three And calling them to him he said to them in parables How can Satan cast out Satan twenty four And if a kingdom be divided against itself that kingdom can not stand twenty five And if a house be divided against itself that house can not stand twenty six And if Satan rose up against himself and is divided he can not stand but has an end twenty seven No one can enter into a strong man s house and plunder his goods except he first bind the strong man and then he will plunder his house twenty eight Verily I say to you all sins will be forgiven the sons of men and the blasphemies wherewith they shall blaspheme twenty nine But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Spirit has no forgiveness forever but is guilty of eternal sin thirty because they said He has an unclean spirit thirty one And his brothers and his mother come and standing without they sent to him calling him thirty two And a crowd was sitting about him and they say to him Behold thy mother and thy brothers without are seeking thee thirty three And he answered them saying Who is my mother or my brothers thirty four And looking round on those who sat about him he said Behold my mother and my brothers thirty five For whoever shall do the will of God he is my brother and sister and mother IV AND he began again to teach by the sea side And there was gathered to him a very great multitude so that he entered into a ship and sat down in the sea and all the multitude was by the sea on the land two And he taught them many things in parables and said to them in his teaching three Hearken behold the sower went forth to sow four And it came to pass as he sowed one fell by the way side and the birds came and devoured it five And another fell on the rocky ground where it had not much earth and immediately it sprang up because it had not depth of earth six But when the sun was up it was scorched and because it had not root it withered away seven And another fell among the thorns and the thorns came up and choked it and it yielded no fruit eight And another fell into the good ground and yielded fruit that sprang up and increased and brought forth thirty and sixty and a hundredfold nine And he said He that has ears to hear let him hear ten And when he was alone they who were about him with the twelve asked him concerning the parables eleven And he said to them To you is given the mystery of the kingdom of God but to those who are without all things are done in parables twelve that seeing they may see and not perceive and hearing they may hear and not understand lest haply they should turn and be forgiven thirteen And he says to them Know ye not this parable And how will ye know all the parables fourteen The sower sows the word fifteen And these are they by the way side where the word is sown and when they hear Satan comes immediately and takes away the word that was sown in them sixteen And these are they likewise that are sown on the rocky places who when they hear the word immediately receive it with gladness seventeen and have no root in themselves but are only for a time Afterward when affliction or persecution arises because of the word immediately they are offended eighteen And others are they that are sown among the thorns These are they that hear the word nineteen and the cares of the world and the deceitfulness of riches and the lusts of other things entering in choke the word and it becomes unfruitful twenty And these are they that are sown on the good ground such as hear the word and receive it and bring forth fruit in thirty and in sixty and in a hundredfold twenty one And he said to them Is the lamp brought that it may be put under the bushel or under the bed Is it not that it may be put on the lamp stand twenty two For nothing is hidden but it shall be manifested nor was done in secret but that it should come abroad twenty three If any one has ears to hear let him hear twenty four And he said to them Take heed what ye hear With what measure ye mete it shall be measured to you and there shall be added to you twenty five For he that has to him shall be given and he that has not even what he has shall be taken from him twenty six And he said So is the kingdom of God as when a man has cast the seed upon the earth twenty seven and sleeps and rises night and day and the seed sprouts and grows up he knows not how twenty eight For the earth brings forth fruit of herself first the blade then the ear then the full grain in the ear twenty nine But when the fruit permits immediately he puts forth the sickle because the harvest is come thirty And he said How shall we liken the kingdom of God or in what comparison shall we set it forth thirty one As a grain of mustard which when it is sown in the earth is less than all the seeds that are in the earth thirty two And when it is sown it grows up and becomes greater than all the herbs and shoots out great branches so that the birds of the air can lodge under its shadow thirty three And with many such parables he spoke the word to them as they were able to hear thirty four But without a parable he spoke not to them and in private he explained all things to his disciples thirty five And on that day when evening was come he says to them Let us pass over to the other side thirty six And dismissing the multitude they take him as he was in the ship And there were also other ships with him thirty seven And there arose a great storm of wind and the waves beat into the ship so that the ship was already becoming filled thirty eight And he was in the stern on the cushion sleeping And they awake him and say to him Teacher carest thou not that we perish thirty nine And awaking he rebuked the wind and said to the sea Peace be still And the wind ceased and there was a great calm forty And he said to them Why are ye so fearful How is it that ye have no faith forty one And they feared exceedingly and said one to another Who then is this that even the wind and the sea obey him V AND they came to the other side of the sea into the country of the Gerasenes two And when he had come out of the ship immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit three who had his dwelling in the tombs and no one could any longer bind him not even with chains four Because he had often been bound with fetters and chains and the chains had been torn asunder by him and the fetters broken in pieces and no one could tame him five And always night and day he was in the tombs and in the mountains crying out and cutting himself with stones six But seeing Jesus afar off he ran and bowed down to him seven and cried with a loud voice eight For she said If I touch even his garments I shall be made whole twenty nine And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up and she perceived in her body that she was healed of that forty And they laughed him to scorn But he putting them all out takes the father of the child and the mother and those who were with him and enters in where the child was forty one And taking the hand
