husbandmen and went abroad two And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruits of the vineyard three And they took him and beat him and sent him away empty four And again he sent to them another servant and at him they cast stones and wounded him in the head and sent him away shamefully treated five And he sent another and him they killed and many others beating some and killing some six Having yet therefore one beloved son he sent him also to them last saying They will reverence my son seven But those husbandmen said among themselves This is the heir come let us kill him and the inheritance will be ours eight And they took and killed him and cast him out of the vineyard nine What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do He will come and destroy the husbandmen and will give the vineyard to others ten And have ye not read this scripture The stone which the builders disallowed The same is become the head of the corner eleven This is from the Lord and is wonderful in our eyes twelve And they sought to lay hold of him but feared the people for they knew that he spoke the parable against them and they left him and went away thirteen And they send to him some of the Pharisees and of the Herodians to entrap him with a word fourteen And they come and say to him Teacher we know that thou art true and carest for no one for thou regardest not the person of men but teachest the way of God in truth Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar or not fifteen Shall we give or shall we not give But he knowing their hypocrisy said to them Why tempt ye me Bring me a denary twelve fifteen that I may see it sixteen And they brought it And he says to them Whose is this image and the inscription And they said to him Caesar s seventeen And Jesus answering said to them Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar s and to God the things that are God s And they marveled at him eighteen And there come to him Sadducees who say there is no resurrection And they asked him saying nineteen Teacher Moses wrote to us that if one s brother die and leave a wife behind and leave no children his brother should take the wife and raise up seed to his brother twenty There were seven brothers and the first took a wife and dying left no seed twenty one And the second took her and died and he also left no seed and the third likewise twenty two And the seven took her and left no seed Last of all the woman died also twenty three In the resurrection therefore when they shall rise again of which of them shall she be wife For the seven had her for a wife twenty four Jesus answering said to them Do ye not therefore err because ye know not the Scriptures nor the power of God twenty five For when they shall rise from the dead they neither marry nor are given in marriage but are as angels who are in heaven twenty six And concerning the dead that they rise have ye not read in the book of Moses at The Bush how God spoke to him saying I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob twenty seven He is not God of the dead but of the living Ye greatly err twenty eight And one of the scribes came to him and having heard them reasoning together and perceiving that he answered them well asked him Which commandment is first of all twenty nine And Jesus answered him First is Hear O Israel the Lord is our God the Lord is one thirty and thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart and with all thy soul and with all thy mind and with all thy strength This is the first commandment thirty one Second is this Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself There is no other commandment greater than these thirty two And the scribe said to him Well Teacher thou saidst truly that he is one and there is no other beside him thirty three and to love him with all the heart and with all the understanding and with all the soul and with all the strength and to love his neighbor as himself is more than all the whole burnt offerings and sacrifices thirty four And Jesus seeing that he answered intelligently said to him Thou art not far from the kingdom of God And no one dared any longer to question him thirty five And Jesus answering said while teaching in the temple How say the scribes that the Christ is son of David thirty six For David himself said in the Holy Spirit The LORD said to my Lord Sit on my right hand Till I put thy enemies under thy feet thirty seven David himself calls him Lord and whence is he his son And the great multitude heard him gladly thirty eight And he said to them in his teaching Beware of the scribes who love to go about in long robes and love greetings in the markets thirty nine and the first seats in the synagogues and the first places at the feasts forty who devour widows houses and for a pretense make long prayers these shall receive greater condemnation forty one And sitting over against the treasury he beheld how the people cast money into the treasury and many that were rich cast in much forty two And one poor widow came and cast in two mites which are a farthing forty three And calling to him his disciples he said to them Verily I say to you that this poor widow cast in more than all who are casting into the treasury forty four For all cast in out of their abundance but she out of her want cast in all that she had her whole living XIII AND as he went out of the temple one of his disciples says to him Teacher see what manner of stones and what manner of buildings two And Jesus said to him Seest thou these great buildings There shall not be left one stone upon another that shall not be thrown down three And as he was sitting on the mount of the Olives over against the temple Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately four Tell us when will these things be And what is the sign when all these things are about to be accomplished five And Jesus began to say to them Take heed lest any one lead you astray six For many will come in my name saying I am he and will lead many astray seven And when ye shall hear of wars and rumors of wars be not troubled for it must come to pass but not yet is the end eight For nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom and there will be earthquakes in divers places and there will be famines and commotions these are the beginning of sorrows nine But do ye take heed to yourselves for they will deliver you up to councils and in the synagogues ye will be beaten and ye will be brought before governors and kings for my sake for a testimony to them ten And the good news must first be preached among all the nations eleven But when they lead you away to deliver you up take not thought beforehand what ye shall speak nor premeditate but whatever shall be given you in that hour that speak for it is not ye that speak but the Holy Spirit twelve And the brother will deliver up the brother to death and the father the child and children will rise up against parents and will put them to death thirteen And ye will be hated by all for my name s sake but he that has endured unto the end the same shall be saved fourteen But when ye see the abomination of desolation standing where it ought not let him that reads mark then let those in Judaea flee to the mountains fifteen And he that is upon the house let him not go down into the house nor enter in to take anything out of his house sixteen And he that is in the field let him not turn back to take his garment seventeen But woe to those who are with child and to those who give suck in those days eighteen And pray that it be not in the winter nineteen For in those days will be affliction such as has not been from the beginning of the creation which God created until now neither shall be twenty And if the Lord had not shortened those days no flesh would have been saved but for the sake of the chosen whom he chose he shortened the days twenty one And then if any one say to you Lo here is the Christ or Lo there believe not twenty two For false Christs and false prophets will arise and will show signs and wonders so as to lead if possible even the chosen astray twenty three But do ye take heed I have foretold you all twenty four But in those days after that affliction the sun shall be darkened and the moon shall not give her light twenty five and the stars shall fall from heaven and the powers that are in heaven shall be shaken twenty six And then shall they see the Son of man coming in clouds with great power and glory twenty seven And then will he send forth the angels and gather together his chosen from the four winds from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven twenty eight And learn the parable from the fig tree When its branch is already become tender and puts forth leaves ye know that summer is near twenty nine So also ye when ye see these things come to pass know that it is near at the doors thirty Verily I say to you that this generation shall not pass till all these things are done thirty one Heaven and earth shall pass away but my words shall not pass away thirty two But of that day or hour no one knows not even the angels in heaven nor the Son but the Father thirty three Take heed watch for ye know not when the time is thirty four As a man who is abroad having left his house and given authority to his servants to each one his work also commanded the porter that he should watch thirty five watch therefore for ye know not when the master of the house comes at evening or at midnight or at the cock crowing or in the morning thirty six lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping thirty seven And what I say to you I say to all Watch XIV TWO days after was the passover and the feast of unleavened bread and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft and put him to death two For they said Not at the feast lest there shall be a tumult of the people three And he being in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper as he was reclining at table there came a woman having an alabaster box of ointment of pure spikenard very precious and she broke the box and poured it on his head four And there were some that were much displeased among themselves and said Why was this waste of the ointment made five For this ointment could have been sold for more than three hundred denaries and given to the poor And they murmured at her six And Jesus said Let her alone why do ye trouble her She wrought a good work on me seven For the poor ye have always with you and when ye will ye can do good to them but me ye have not always eight She did what she could she beforehand anointed my body for the preparation for burial nine Verily I say to you wherever the good news shall be preached in the whole world this also that she did shall be told for a memorial of her ten And Judas Iscariot one of the twelve went to the chief priests to deliver him up to them eleven And they when they heard it were glad and promised to give him money And he sought how he might conveniently deliver him up twelve And on the first day of the feast of unleavened bread when they killed the passover his disciples say to him Where wilt thou that we go and prepare that thou mayest eat the passover thirteen And he sends forth two of his disciples and says to them Go into the city and there will meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water follow him fourteen And where he shall go in say to the master of the house The Teacher says Where is the guest chamber in which I may eat the passover with my disciples fifteen And he will show you a large upper room furnished ready there prepare for us sixteen And his disciples went forth and came into the city and found as he said to them and they made ready the passover seventeen And at evening he comes with the twelve eighteen And as they were reclining at table and eating Jesus said Verily I say to you that one of you will betray me one that eats with me nineteen And they began to be sorrowful and to say to him one by one Is it I And another said Is it I twenty And he answering said to them It is one of the twelve one that dips with me into the dish twenty one The Son of man indeed goes as it is written of him but woe to that man through whom the Son of man is betrayed It were good for him if that man had not been born twenty two And as they were eating Jesus taking a loaf blessed and broke and gave it to them and said Take it this is my body twenty three And taking the cup he gave thanks and gave it to them and they all drank of it twenty four And he said to them This is my blood of the covenant which is shed for many twenty five Verily I say to you I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God twenty six And having sung they went out into the mount of the Olives twenty seven And Jesus says to them All ye will be offended because it is written I will smite the shepherd and the sheep shall be scattered twenty eight But after I am risen I will go before you into Galilee twenty nine And Peter said to him Though all shall be offended yet will not I thirty And Jesus says to him Verily I say to thee that thou this day in this night before a cock crows twice wilt thrice deny me thirty one But he said the more vehemently If I should die with thee I will not deny thee Likewise also said they all thirty two And they come to a place which was named Gethsemane And he says to his disciples Sit ye here while I shall pray thirty three And he takes with him Peter and James and John and began to be sore amazed and to be troubled thirty four And he says to them My soul is exceedingly sorrowful unto death tarry here and watch thirty five And going forward a little he fell on the ground and prayed that if it were possible the hour might pass from him thirty six And he said Abba Father all things are possible to thee take away this cup from me but not what I will but what thou wilt thirty seven And he comes and finds them sleeping And he says to Peter Simon sleepest thou Couldest thou not watch one hour thirty eight Watch and pray that ye enter not into temptation The spirit indeed is willing but the flesh is weak thirty nine And again he went away and prayed saying the same words forty And returning he found them again sleeping for their eyes were heavy and they knew not what to answer him forty one And he comes the third time and says to them Do ye sleep the remaining time and take your rest fourteen forty one It is enough the hour is come behold the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners forty two Rise let us go behold he that betrays me is at hand forty three And immediately while he was yet speaking comes Judas one of the twelve and with him a multitude with swords and staves from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders forty four And his betrayer had given them a signal saying Whom I shall kiss that is he lay hold of him and lead him away securely forty five And coming he goes straightway to him and says Master Master and kissed him forty six And they laid their hands on him and held him fast forty seven And one of those standing by drew his sword and smote the servant of the high priest and took off his ear forty eight And Jesus answering said to them Came ye out as against a robber with swords and staves to take me forty nine I was daily with you in the temple teaching and ye did not lay hold of me but that the Scriptures might be fulfilled fifty And all forsook him and fled fifty one And there followed him a certain young man having a linen cloth cast about his naked body and the young men lay hold of him fifty two And leaving behind the linen cloth he fled from them naked fifty three And they led Jesus away to the high priest and with him assembled all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes fifty four And Peter followed him afar off even into the court of the high priest and was sitting with the officers and warming himself at the fire fifty five And the chief priests and all the council sought for testimony against Jesus in order to put him to death and they found none fifty six For many bore false witness against him but their testimonies agreed not together fifty seven And certain ones rose up and bore false witness against him saying fifty eight We heard him say I will destroy this temple that is made with hands and in three days I will build another made without hands fifty nine And not even so did their testimony agree sixty And the high priest stood up in the midst and asked Jesus saying Answerest thou nothing What do these witness against thee sixty one But he was silent and answered nothing Again the high priest asked him and said to him Art thou the Christ the Son of the Blessed sixty two And Jesus said I am and ye shall see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power and coming with the clouds of heaven sixty three And the high priest rending his clothes says What further need have we of witnesses sixty four Ye heard the blasphemy What think ye And they all condemned him to be guilty of death sixty five And some began to spit on him and to cover his face and buffet him and say to him Prophesy And the officers with blows took him in charge sixty six And Peter being below in the court there comes one of the maid servants of the high priest sixty seven and seeing Peter warming himself she looked upon him and said Thou also wast with Jesus the Nazarene sixty eight But he denied saying I do not know nor do I understand what thou sayest And he went out into the fore court and a cock crowed sixty nine And the maid servant seeing him began again to say to those standing by This is one of them seventy And he again denied it And a little after they that stood by said again to Peter Surely thou art one of them for thou art a Galilaean seventy one But he began to invoke curses and to swear I do not know this man of whom ye speak seventy two And a cock crowed a second time And Peter remembered the word how Jesus said to him Before a cock crows twice thou wilt thrice deny me And as he thought thereon he wept XV AND straightway in the morning the chief priests with the elders and scribes and the whole council having held a consultation bound Jesus and carried him away and delivered him up to Pilate two And Pilate asked him Art thou the King of the Jews And he answering said to him Thou sayest it three And the chief priests accused him of many things four And Pilate asked him again saying Answerest thou nothing Behold what things they testify against thee five But Jesus no longer made any answer so that Pilate marveled six And at the feast he released to them one prisoner whomsoever they asked seven And there was the one called Barabbas bound with his companions in sedition who in the sedition had committed murder eight And coming up the multitude began to make request according as he had always done for them nine And Pilate answered them saying Will ye that I release to you the King of the Jews ten For he knew that through envy the chief priests had delivered him up eleven But the chief priests stirred up the multitude that he should rather release to them Barabbas twelve And Pilate answering said again to them What will ye then that I shall do to him whom ye call the King of the Jews thirteen And they cried again Crucify him fourteen And Pilate said to them What evil then has he done And they cried the more exceedingly Crucify him fifteen And Pilate wishing to satisfy the multitude released to them Barabbas and he delivered up Jesus after scourging him to be crucified sixteen And the soldiers led him away into the court which is Praetorium and they call together the whole band seventeen And they clothe him with purple and having platted a crown of thorns they put it on him eighteen And they began to salute him Hail King of the Jews nineteen And they smote him on the head with a reed and spit upon him and kneeling down did homage to him twenty And when they had mocked him they took off the purple from him and put on him his own garments And they lead him out to crucify him twenty one And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian who was passing by coming from the country the father of Alexander and Rufus to bear his cross twenty two And they bring him to the place Golgotha which is interpreted Place of a skull twenty three And they gave him wine mingled with myrrh but he took it not twenty four And having crucified him they divide his garments casting lots upon them what any one should take twenty five And it was the third hour and they crucified him twenty six And the inscription of the accusation against him was written over THE KING OF THE JEWS twenty seven And with him they crucify two robbers one on his right hand and one on his left twenty eight And the scripture was fulfilled which says And he was reckoned with transgressors twenty nine And they that passed by railed at him wagging their heads and saying Aha thou that destroyest the temple and buildest it in three days thirty save thyself and come down from the cross thirty one Likewise also the chief priests mocking one with another together with the scribes said Others he saved himself he can not save thirty two Let the Christ the King of Israel come down now from the cross that we may see and believe And they that were crucified with him reproached him thirty three And when the sixth hour was come there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour thirty four And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice saying Eloi Eloi lama sabachthani Which is interpreted My God my God why didst thou forsake me thirty five And some of those standing by hearing it said Behold he calls Elijah thirty six And one ran and filled a sponge with vinegar and put it on a reed and gave him to drink saying Let alone let us see whether Elijah comes to take him down thirty seven And Jesus uttering a loud cry expired thirty eight And the vail of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom thirty nine And the centurion who was standing near over against him seeing that he so cried out and expired said Truly this man was the Son of God forty And there were also women looking on afar off among whom was also Mary the Magdalene and Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses and Salome forty one who also when he was in Galilee followed him and ministered to him and many other women who came up with him to Jerusalem forty two And evening having now come since it was the preparation which is the day before the sabbath fifteen forty two forty three Joseph from Arimathaea an honorable counselor who also was himself waiting for the kingdom of God came and went in boldly to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus forty four And Pilate marveled if he were already dead and calling to him the centurion he asked him if he had been long dead forty five And having learned it from the centurion he gave the dead body to Joseph forty six And having bought fine linen and taken him down he wrapped him in the linen and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock and rolled a stone to the door of the sepulchre forty seven And Mary the Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid XVI AND the sabbath being past Mary the Magdalene and Mary the mother of James and Salome bought spices that they might come and anoint him two And very early on the first day of the week they come to the sepulchre when the sun was risen three And they said to one another Who will roll away the stone for us out of the door of the sepulchre four And looking up they see that the stone has been rolled away For it was very great five And entering into the sepulchre they saw a young man sitting on the right side clothed in a white robe and they were affrighted six And he says to them Be not affrighted Ye are seeking Jesus the Nazarene who was crucified He is risen he is not here Behold the place where they laid him seven But go say to his disciples and to Peter that he goes before you into Galilee There shall ye see him as he said to you eight And they went out and fled from the sepulchre for trembling and astonishment seized them And they said nothing to any one for they were afraid nine And having risen early on the first day of the week he appeared first to Mary the Magdalene from whom he had cast out seven demons ten She went and reported it to those who had been with him as they mourned and wept eleven And they hearing that he is alive and was seen by her believed not twelve After that he appeared in another form to two of them as they walked going into the country thirteen They also went and reported it to the rest nor did they believe them fourteen Afterward he appeared to the eleven themselves as they reclined at table and upbraided their unbelief and hardness of heart because they believed not those who saw him after he was risen fifteen And he said to them Go into all the world and preach the good news to every creature sixteen He that believes and is immersed shall be saved but he that believes not shall be condemned seventeen And these signs shall accompany those who have believed in my name they shall cast out demons they shall speak with new tongues eighteen they shall take up serpents and if they drink any deadly thing it shall not hurt them they shall lay hands on the sick and they shall recover nineteen The Lord therefore after he had spoken to them was taken up into heaven and sat down on the right hand of God twenty and they went forth and preached everywhere the Lord working with them and confirming the word by the signs that followed THE GOSPEL ACCORDING TO LUKE I FORASMUCH as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a narration concerning the things fully believed among us one one two as they who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and ministers of the word delivered them to us three it seemed good to me also having accurately traced all from the very first to write to thee in order most excellent Theophilus four that thou mightest know the certainty concerning those things one four wherein thou wast instructed five There was in the days of Herod the king of Judaea a certain priest Zachariah by name of the course of Abijah and his wife was of the daughters of Aaron and her name was Elisabeth six And they were both righteous before God walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless seven And they had no child because Elisabeth was barren and they both were now far advanced in years eight And it came to pass that while he executed the priest s office before God in the order of his course nine it fell to his lot according to the custom of the priest s office to burn incense going into the temple of the Lord ten And the whole multitude of the people were praying without at the hour of incense eleven And there appeared to him an angel of the Lord standing on the right side of the altar of incense twelve And Zachariah seeing him was troubled and fear fell upon him thirteen But the angel said to him Fear not Zachariah for thy prayer was heard and thy wife Elisabeth shall bear thee a son and thou shalt call his name John fourteen And thou shalt have joy and gladness and many shall rejoice at his birth fifteen For he shall be great before the Lord and he shall not drink wine nor strong drink and he shall be filled with the Holy Spirit even from his mother s womb sixteen And many of the sons of Israel shall he turn to the Lord their God seventeen And he shall go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just to make ready a prepared people for the Lord eighteen And Zachariah said to the angel Whereby shall I know this For I am an old man and my wife is far advanced in years nineteen And the angel answering said to him I am Gabriel that stands in the presence of God and I was sent to speak to thee and to bring thee these glad tidings twenty And behold thou shalt be dumb and not able to speak until the day that these things shall be performed because thou didst not believe thy words which shall be fulfilled in their season twenty one And the people were waiting for Zachariah and they were wondering at his long tarrying in the temple twenty two And when he came out he was not able to speak to them and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple and he was making signs to them and remained speechless twenty three And it came to pass when the days of his ministration were completed that he departed to his own house twenty four And after those days his wife Elisabeth conceived and she hid herself five months saying twenty five Thus has the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he looked on me to take away my reproach among men twenty six And in the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a city of Galilee named Nazareth twenty seven to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph of the house of David and the virgin s name was Mary twenty eight And the angel coming in to her said Hail highly favored The Lord is with thee Blessed art thou among women twenty nine And she was troubled at the saying and was considering what manner of salutation this might be thirty And the angel said to her Fear not Mary for thou didst find favor with God thirty one And behold thou shalt conceive in thy womb and bring forth a son and shalt call his name Jesus thirty two He shall be great and shall be called Son of the Highest and the Lord God will give to him the throne of David his father thirty three and he shall reign over the house of Jacob forever and of his kingdom there shall be no end thirty four Then said Mary to the angel How shall this be seeing that I know not a man thirty five And the angel answering said to her The Holy Spirit will come upon thee and the power of the Highest will overshadow thee therefore also the Holy One that is born shall be called the Son of God thirty six And behold Elisabeth thy kinswoman she also has conceived a son in her old age and this is the sixth month with her who is called barren thirty seven For with God nothing shall be one thirty seven impossible thirty eight And Mary said Behold the handmaid of the Lord let it be to me according to thy word And the angel departed from her thirty nine And Mary arose in those days and went into the hill country with haste into a city of Judah forty and entered into the house of Zachariah and saluted Elisabeth forty one And it came to pass as Elisabeth heard the salutation of Mary that the babe leaped in her womb and Elisabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit forty two And she spoke out with a loud voice and said Blessed art thou among women and blessed is the fruit of thy womb forty three And whence is this to me that the mother of my Lord should come to me forty four For behold as the voice of thy salutation came into my ears the babe leaped in my womb for joy forty five And happy is she who believed that there shall be one forty five a fulfillment of the things told her from the Lord forty six And Mary said My soul magnifies the Lord forty seven and my spirit rejoiced in God my Savior forty eight Because he looked upon the low estate of his handmaid for behold henceforth all generations will call me happy forty nine Because the Mighty One did great things for me and holy is his name fifty And his mercy is from generation to generation to those who fear him fifty one He wrought might with his arm he scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts fifty two He cast down princes from thrones and exalted those of low degree fifty three The hungry he filled with good and the rich he sent empty away fifty four He helped Israel his servant to remember mercy fifty five as he spoke to our fathers for Abraham and for his seed forever fifty six And Mary abode with her about three months and returned to her own house fifty seven Now Elisabeth s full time came that she should be delivered and she brought forth a son fifty eight And her neighbors and her kindred heard that the Lord showed great mercy toward her and they rejoiced with her fifty nine And it came to pass that on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child and they called him Zachariah after the name of his father sixty And his mother answered and said Nay but he shall be called John sixty one And they said to her There is none of thy kindred that is called by this name sixty two And they made signs to his father how he would have him called sixty three And asking for a writing tablet he wrote saying His name is John And they all wondered sixty four And his mouth was opened immediately and his tongue was loosed and he spoke blessing God sixty five And fear came on all that dwelt around them And all these things one sixty five were told abroad in all the hill country of Judaea sixty six And all who heard laid them up in their hearts saying What then will this child be And the hand of the Lord was with him sixty seven And Zachariah his father was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied saying sixty eight Blessed be the Lord the God of Israel that he visited and wrought redemption for his people sixty nine and raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of David his servant seventy as he spoke by the mouth of his holy prophets of old seventy one salvation from our enemies and from the hand of all that hate us seventy two to show mercy to our fathers and to remember his holy covenant seventy three the oath which he swore to Abraham our father seventy four to grant to us that without fear being rescued from the hand of our enemies we should serve him seventy five in holiness and righteousness before him all our days seventy six And also thou O child shalt be called Prophet of the Highest for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways seventy seven in order to give knowledge of salvation to his people in remission of their sins seventy eight through the tender mercies of our God whereby the dayspring from on high visited us seventy nine to give light to those sitting in darkness and the shadow of death in order to guide our feet into the way of peace eighty And the child grew and became strong in spirit and was in the deserts till the day of his manifestation to Israel II AND it came to pass in those days that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be registered two This registering was the first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria three And all went to be registered each one to his own city four And Joseph also went up from Galilee out of the city of Nazareth into Judaea to the city of David which is called Bethlehem because he was of the house and family of David five to be registered with Mary his betrothed wife who was with child six And so it was that while they were there the days were completed that she should bring forth seven And she brought forth her first born son and wrapped him in swathing bands and laid him in a manger because there was no room for them in the inn eight And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field and keeping watch over their flock by night nine And behold an angel of the Lord came upon them and the glory of the Lord shone around them and they were sore afraid ten And the angel said to them Fear not for behold I bring you good tidings of great joy which shall be to all the people eleven For to you is born this day in the city of David a Savior who is Christ the Lord twelve And this shall be to you the sign Ye will find a babe wrapped in swathing bands lying in a manger thirteen And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God and saying fourteen Glory to God in the highest and on earth peace good will among men fifteen And it came to pass when the angels were gone away from them into heaven that the shepherds said one to another Let us go now unto Bethlehem and see this thing that is come to pass which the Lord made known to us sixteen And they came with haste and found both Mary and Joseph and the babe lying in the manger seventeen And having seen it they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child eighteen And all that heard wondered at the things which were told them by the shepherds nineteen And Mary kept all these things two nineteen pondering them in her heart twenty And the shepherds returned glorifying and praising God for all that they heard and saw as it was told to them twenty one And when eight days were completed for circumcising him his name was called Jesus the name given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb twenty two And when the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were completed they brought him up to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord twenty three as it is written in the law of the Lord Every male that opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord twenty four and to offer a sacrifice according to what is said in the law of they understood not the saying which he spoke to them fifty one And he went down with them and came to Nazareth and was subject to them And his mother kept all these sayings in her heart fifty two And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature and in favor with God and men III NOW in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judaea and Herod tetrarch of Galilee and his brother Philip tetrarch of Iturea and of the region of Trachonitis and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene two when Annas was high priest and Caiaphas the word of God came to John the son of Zachariah in the wilderness three And he came into all the country about the Jordan preaching the immersion of repentance unto remission of sins four as it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet The voice of one crying in the wilderness Prepare the way of the Lord Make straight his paths five Every valley shall be filled And every mountain and hill shall be brought low And the crooked shall be straight And the rough ways smooth six And all flesh shall see the salvation of God seven He said therefore to the multitudes that came out to be immersed by him Brood of vipers who warned you to flee from the coming wrath eight Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance and begin not to say within yourselves We have Abraham for our father for I say to you that God is able of these stones to raise up children to Abraham nine And now also the axe is laid to the root of the trees Every tree therefore that brings not forth good fruit is cut down and cast into the fire ten And the multitudes asked him saying What then shall we do eleven He answering says to them He that has two coats let him impart to him that has none and he that has food let him do likewise twelve And there came also publicans to be immersed and they said to him Teacher what shall we do thirteen And he said to them Exact no more than that which is appointed you fourteen And soldiers also asked him saying What shall we also do And he said to them Do violence to no one neither accuse any falsely and be content with your wages three fourteen fifteen And while the people were in expectation and all were reasoning in their hearts concerning John whether he himself were not the Christ sixteen John answered them all saying I indeed immerse you in water but there comes he that is mightier than I the latchet of whose sandals I am not worthy to loose he will immerse you in the Holy Spirit and fire seventeen whose fan is in his hand and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor and will gather the wheat into his garner but the chaff he will burn up with fire unquenchable eighteen And with many other exhortations he published the good tidings to the people nineteen But Herod the tetrarch being reproved by him on account of Herodias the wife of his brother and for all the evils which Herod did twenty added to all this also that he shut up John in prison twenty one Now it came thirteen And having finished every temptation the Devil departed from him for a season fourteen And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee and there went out a report concerning him through all the surrounding country fifteen And he taught in their synagogues being honored by all sixteen And he came to Nazareth where he had been brought up And as his custom was he went into the oppressed away free nineteen To proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord twenty And rolling up the book he gave it again to the servant and sat down And the eyes of all in the synagogue were fastened And they said Is not this Joseph s son twenty three And he said to them Ye will surely say to me this proverb Physician heal thyself Whatever we heard done in Capernaum do also here in thy country twenty four And he said Verily I say to you no prophet is accepted in his own country twenty five But I tell you of a truth there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah when the heaven was Simon And the mother in law of Simon was seized with a violent fever four thirty eight and they besought him for her thirty nine And standing over her he rebuked the fever and it left her and immediately she arose and ministered to them forty Now when the sun was setting all that had any sick with divers diseases brought them to him and he laid his hands on each one of them and healed them forty one And demons also came out from many crying out and saying Thou art the Son of God And he rebuking them suffered them not to speak because they knew that he was the Christ forty two And when it was day he went out and went into a desert place And the multitudes sought him and came to him and stayed him that he should not depart from them forty three And he said to them I must publish the to hear the word of God and he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret two that he saw two ships standing by the lake but the fishermen had gone out of them and were washing the nets three And entering into one of the ships which was Simon s he asked him to put out a little from the land And sitting down he taught the multitudes out of the ship four And when he ceased speaking he said to Simon Put out into the deep and do ye let down your nets for a draught five And Simon answering said to him Master we toiled all night and took nothing but at thy word I will let down the net six And having done this they inclosed a great multitude of fishes and their net began to break seven And they beckoned to their partners in the other ship to come and help them And they came and filled both the ships so that they began to sink eight And Simon Peter seeing it fell down at the knees of Jesus saying Depart from me for I am a sinful man O Lord nine For astonishment had seized him and all that seventeen And it came to pass on a certain day that he was teaching and there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting by who had come out of every village of Galilee and Judaea and Jerusalem and there was power of the Lord for healing them eighteen And behold men brought on a bed a man who was palsied and they sought to bring him in and to lay him before him nineteen And not finding by said Man thy sins are forgiven thee twenty one And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason saying Who is this that speaks blasphemies Who can forgive sins but God alone twenty two But Jesus perceiving their thoughts answering said to them What reason ye in your hearts twenty three Which is easier to say Thy sins are forgiven thee or to say Arise and walk twenty four But that ye may know that the Son of man has power on the earth to forgive sins he said to the palsied man I say to thee arise and taking up thy couch go to thy house twenty five And immediately standing up before them he took up that whereon he lay and departed to his house glorifying God twenty six And they were all amazed and they glorified God and were filled with fear saying We have seen strange things to day twenty seven And after these things he went forth and saw a publican named Levi sitting at the place of receiving custom and he said to him Follow me twenty eight And leaving all he arose and followed him twenty nine And Levi made him a great feast in his own house and there was a great company of publicans and of others who reclined at the table with them thirty And the Pharisees and their scribes five thirty murmured against his disciples saying Why do ye eat and drink with the publicans and sinners thirty one And Jesus answering said to them They who are well need not a physician but they who are sick thirty two I have not come to call righteous men but sinners to repentance thirty three And they said to him Why do the disciples of John fast often and make prayers and likewise those of the Pharisees but thine eat and drink thirty four And he said to them Can ye make the sons of the bridechamber fast five thirty four while the bridegroom is with them thirty five But days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them then shall they fast in those days thirty six And he spoke also a parable to them No one rends a piece from a new garment and puts it on an old garment else both the new will make a rent and the piece from the new agrees not with the old thirty seven And no one puts new wine into old skins else the new wine will burst the skins and will itself be poured out and the skins will perish thirty eight But new wine must be put into new skins and both are preserved together five thirty eight thirty nine And no one having drunk old wine straightway desires new for he says The old is better five thirty nine VI AND it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first six one that he was going through grain fields and his disciples plucked and ate the Son of man twenty three Rejoice in that day and leap for joy for behold your reward is great in heaven for in the same manner did their fathers to the prophets twenty four But woe to you that are rich for ye have received your consolation twenty five Woe to you that are full for ye shall hunger Woe to you that laugh now for ye shall mourn and weep twenty six Woe when all men shall speak well of you for in the same manner did their fathers to the false prophets twenty seven But I say to you who hear Love your enemies do good to those who hate you twenty eight bless those who curse you pray for those who abuse you six twenty eight twenty nine To him who smites thee on the cheek offer also the other and him who takes away thy cloak forbid not to take thy coat also thirty Give to every one love you what thanks have ye For even the sinners love those who love them thirty three And if ye do good to those who do good to you what thanks have ye For even the sinners do the same thirty four And if ye lend to those of whom ye hope to receive what thanks have ye And sinners lend to sinners that they may receive as much in return thirty five But love your enemies and do good and lend hoping for nothing in return and your reward shall be great and ye shall be sons of the Highest for he is kind to the unthankful and evil thirty six Be ye merciful as your Father also is merciful thirty seven And judge not and ye shall not be judged condemn not and ye shall not be condemned acquit and ye shall be acquitted thirty eight Give and it shall be given to you good measure pressed down shaken together running over shall they give into your bosom For with the same measure with which ye mete it shall be measured to you again thirty nine And he spoke also a parable to them Can the blind lead the blind Shall they not both fall into the ditch forty A disciple is not above the teacher but every one shall be perfected as his teacher forty one And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother s eye but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye forty two How canst thou say to thy brother Brother let me cast out the mote that is in thine eye when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye Hypocrite cast out first the beam out of thine eye and then thou shalt see clearly to cast out the mote that is in thy brother s eye forty three For there is no good tree that bears corrupt fruit nor corrupt tree that bears good fruit forty four For every tree is known from its own fruit For from thorns they do not gather figs nor from a bramble bush do they harvest grapes forty five The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth that which is good and the evil out of the evil brings forth that which is evil for out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks forty six And why call ye me Lord Lord and do not the things which I say forty seven Every one that comes to me and hears my sayings and does them I will show you to whom he is like forty eight He is like a man building a house who digged deep and laid a foundation on the rock And when a flood arose the stream burst upon that house and could not shake it because it was well builded forty nine But he that hears and does not is like a man that built a house upon the earth without a foundation on which the stream burst and immediately it fell six forty nine and the ruin of that house was great VII WHEN he completed all his sayings in the hearing of the people he entered into Capernaum two And a certain centurion s servant who was dear to him was sick and about seventeen And this report went forth in all Judaea concerning him and in all the country around eighteen And the disciples of John reported to him concerning all these things nineteen And John calling thirty one To what then shall I liken the men of this generation And to what are they like thirty two They are like to children sitting in the market and calling to one another saying We piped to you woman this is that touches him for she is a sinner forty And Jesus answering said to him Simon I have somewhat to say to thee And he says Teacher say on forty one A certain money lender had two debtors The one owed five hundred denaries seven forty one and the other fifty forty two And they having nothing to pay he forgave them both Which of them therefore tell me will love him most forty three Simon answering said I suppose he to whom he forgave most And he said to him Thou didst rightly judge forty four And turning to the woman he said to Simon Seest thou this woman I entered into thy house thou gayest me no water for my feet but she has wet my feet with tears and wiped them with her hair forty five Thou gavest me no kiss but she from the time I came in ceased not to kiss my forgiven the same loves little forty eight And he said to her Thy sins are forgiven forty nine And they who reclined with him began to say within themselves Who is this that also forgives sins fifty And he said to the woman Thy faith has saved thee go in peace VIII AND it came to pass afterward that he journeyed through every city and village preaching and publishing the good news of the kingdom of God and with him the twelve two and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities Mary called the Magdalene from whom had gone out seven demons three and Joanna wife of Chuza Herod s steward and Susanna and many others who ministered to them of their substance four And a great multitude coming together of those also who came to him out of every city he spoke by a parable five The sower went forth to sow his seed And as he sowed one fell by the way side and it was trodden down and the fowls of the air devoured it six And another fell upon the rock and springing up it withered away because it had no moisture seven And another fell among the thorns and the thorns sprang up with it and choked it eight And another fell into the good ground and sprang up and bore fruit a hundredfold And saying these things he cried He that has ears to hear let him hear nine And his disciples asked him what this parable was ten And he said To you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God but to the rest in parables that seeing they may not see and hearing they may not understand eleven Now the parable is this The seed is the word of God twelve Those by the way side are they that hear after that comes the Devil and takes away the word from their heart that they may not believe and be saved thirteen Those on the rock are they who when they hear with joy receive the word and these have no root who for a while believe and in time of temptation fall away fourteen And that which fell among the thorns these are they who have heard and going forth are choked with the cares and riches and pleasures of life and bring no fruit to perfection fifteen But that in the good ground these are they who in an honest and good heart having heard hold fast the word and bring forth fruit with patience sixteen No one having lighted a lamp covers it with a vessel or puts it under a bed but puts it on a lamp stand that they who enter in may behold the light seventeen For nothing is secret that shall not be made manifest nor hidden that shall not be known and come abroad eighteen Take heed therefore how ye hear For whoever has to him shall be given and whoever has not even what he seems to have shall be taken from him nineteen And his mother and his brothers came to him and they could not come near him on account of the multitude twenty And it was told him saying Thy mother and thy brothers are standing without desiring to see thee twenty one And he answering said to them My mother and my brothers are these who hear and do the word of God twenty two And it came to pass on a certain day that he went into a ship with his disciples And he said to them Let us go over to the other side of the lake And they launched forth twenty three And as they were sailing he fell asleep And there came down a storm of wind on the lake and they began to be filled and were in jeopardy twenty four And coming to him they awoke him saying Master Master we perish And he rising rebuked the wind and the raging of the water and they ceased and there was a calm twenty five And he said to them Where is your faith And they fearing wondered saying one to another Who then is this that he commands even the winds and the water and they obey him twenty six And they sailed to the country of the Gerasenes which is over against Galilee twenty seven And when he had gone forth upon the land there met him a certain man out of the city who had demons a long time and wore no clothing and abode not in a house but in the tombs twenty eight And seeing Jesus he cried out and fell down before him and with a loud voice said What have I to do with thee Jesus Son of the most high God I beseech thee do not torment me twenty nine For he commanded the unclean spirit to come out from the man For of a long time it had seized him and he was bound being secured with chains and fetters and bursting the bands he was driven by the demon into the deserts thirty And Jesus asked him saying What is thy name And he said Legion because many demons had entered into him thirty one And he besought him that he would not command them to go away into the abyss thirty two And there was a herd of many swine feeding in the mountain and they besought him that he would permit them to enter into them And he permitted them thirty three And going out of the man the demons entered into the swine and the herd rushed down the steep into the lake and were choked thirty four And seeing what was done the herdsmen fled and reported it in the city and in the country thirty five And they went out to see what was done And they came to Jesus and found the man from whom the demons had gone out sitting at the feet of Jesus clothed and in his right mind and they were afraid thirty six They also who saw it reported to them how he that was possessed by demons was healed thirty seven And the whole multitude of the surrounding country of the Gerasenes besought him to depart from them for they were seized And he went through cities and villages teaching and journeying toward Jerusalem twenty three And a certain one said to him Lord are there few that are saved twenty four And he said to them Strive to to him Happy is he who shall eat bread in the kingdom of God sixteen And he said to him A certain man made a great supper and bade many seventeen And he sent his servant at the hour of the supper to say to those who were bidden Come for all things are now ready eighteen And they all with one mind began fourteen eighteen to excuse themselves The first said to him I bought a piece of ground and I must needs go out and see it I pray thee let me be excused nineteen And another said I bought five yoke of oxen and I am going to make trial of them I pray thee let me be excused twenty And another said I married a wife and therefore I can not come twenty one And the servant came and reported these things to his lord Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city and bring in hither the poor and maimed and lame and blind twenty two And the servant said Lord it is done as thou didst command and yet there is room twenty three And the Lord said to the servant Go out into the highways and hedges and compel them fourteen twenty three to come in that my house may be filled twenty four for I say to you that none of those men who were bidden shall taste of my supper twenty five And great multitudes were going with him and turning he said to them twenty six If any one comes to me and hates not his father and mother and wife and children and brothers and sisters and even his own life besides he can not be my disciple twenty seven And whoever does not bear his cross and come after me can not be my disciple twenty eight For who of you intending to build a tower does not first sit down and count the cost whether he has sufficient to finish it twenty nine Lest haply when he has laid a foundation and is not able to finish all that behold begin to mock him thirty saying This man began to build and was not able to finish thirty one Or what king going to make war against another king does not first sit down and consult whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand thirty two Else while he is yet a great way off he sends an embassy and desires conditions of peace thirty three So then whoever of you forsakes not all that he has can not be my disciple thirty four Salt therefore is good but if even the salt has become tasteless wherewith shall it be seasoned thirty five It is fit neither for the land nor for the dunghill they cast it out He that has ears to hear let him hear XV AND there were drawing near to him all the publicans and the sinners to hear him two And the Pharisees and the scribes murmured saying This man receives sinners and eats with them three And he spoke this parable to them saying four What man of you having a hundred sheep and having lost one of them does not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness and go after that which is lost until he finds it five And having found it he lays it on his shoulders rejoicing six And coming home he calls together his friends and neighbors saying to them Rejoice with me because I found my sheep which was lost seven I say to you that so there will be joy in heaven over one sinner that repents more than over ninety and nine just persons who have no need of repentance eight Or what woman having ten pieces of silver if she lose one piece does not light a lamp and sweep the house and seek carefully till she finds it nine And having found it she calls her friends and neighbors together saying Rejoice with me because I found the piece which I lost ten So I say to you there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repents eleven And he said A certain man had two sons twelve And the younger of them said to his father Father give me the portion of the property that falls to me And he divided to them his living thirteen And not many days after the younger son gathered all together and went abroad into a far country and there wasted his substance in riotous living fourteen And when he had spent all there arose a grievous famine in that country and he began to be in want fifteen And he went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country and he sent him into his fields to feed swine sixteen And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks which the swine ate and no one gave to him seventeen And coming to himself he said How many hired servants of my father have bread enough and to spare and I perish here with hunger eighteen I will arise and go to my father and will say to him Father I sinned against heaven and before thee nineteen I am no longer worthy to be called thy son make me as one of thy hired servants twenty And he arose and came to his father But when he was yet a great way off his father saw him and had compassion and ran and fell on his neck and kissed him twenty one And the son said to him Father I sinned against heaven and before thee I am no longer worthy to be called thy son twenty two But the father said to his servants Bring forth a robe the best and put it on him and put a ring on his hand and sandals on his feet twenty three and bring the fatted calf and kill it and let us eat and be so many years do I serve thee and never transgressed thy command and to me thou never gayest a kid that I might make merry with my friends thirty But when this thy son came who devoured thy living because this thy brother was dead and is alive again and was lost and is found XVI AND he said also to the disciples There was a certain rich man who had a steward and the same was accused to him as himself What shall I do for my master takes away from me the stewardship I am not able to dig to beg I am ashamed four I am resolved what to do that when I am put out of the stewardship they may receive me into their houses five And having called to him each one of his master s debtors he said to the first How much owest thou to my master six And he said A hundred measures of oil And he said to him Take thy bill and sit down quickly and write fifty seven Then he said to another And how much owest thou And he said A hundred measures of wheat And he said to him Take thy bill and write fourscore eight And the master commended the unjust steward because he had done wisely because the sons of this world are in their generation wiser than the sons of light nine And I say to you Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness that when it fails they may receive you into the everlasting habitations ten He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much eleven If therefore ye were not faithful in the unrighteous mammon who will entrust to you the true riches twelve And if ye were not faithful in that which is another s who will give to you your own thirteen No servant can serve two masters for either he will hate the one and love the other or he will hold to one and despise the other Ye can not serve God and Mammon fourteen And the Pharisees also who were covetous heard all these things and they derided him fifteen And he said to them Ye are they who justify themselves before men but God knows your hearts for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination before God sixteen The law and the prophets were until John from that time the good news of the kingdom of God is published and every man presses into it seventeen And it is easier that heaven and earth should pass away than that one tittle of the law should fail eighteen Every one who puts away his wife and marries another commits adultery and he who marries her when put away from a husband commits adultery nineteen There was a certain rich man who was clothed in purple and fine linen and fared sumptuously every day twenty And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus who was laid at his gate full of sores twenty one and desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man s table Moreover the dogs came and licked his sores twenty two And it came to pass that the beggar died and he was borne away by the angels into Abraham s bosom The rich man also died and was buried twenty three and in the underworld lifting up his eyes being in torments he sees Abraham afar off and Lazarus in his bosom twenty four And he cried and said Father Abraham have mercy on me and send Lazarus that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue for I am tormented in this flame twenty five But Abraham said Child remember that in thy lifetime thou receivedst thy good things in full and Lazarus in like manner his evil things but now here he is comforted and thou art tormented twenty six And besides all this between us and you a great gulf is fixed that they who would pass from hence to you may not be able nor those from thence pass over to us twenty seven And he said I pray thee therefore father that thou wouldst send him to my father s house twenty eight For I have five brothers that he may testify to them that they may not also come into this place of torment twenty nine Abraham says to him They have Moses and the prophets let them hear them thirty And he said Nay father Abraham but if one should go to them from the dead they will repent thirty one And he said to him If they hear not Moses and the prophets neither will they be persuaded though one should rise from the dead XVII AND he said to his disciples It is impossible that causes of offense should not come but woe to him through whom they come two It were better for him that a mill stone were placed about his neck and he were thrown into the sea than that he should cause one of these little ones to offend three Take heed to yourselves If thy brother sin rebuke him and if he repent forgive him four And if he sin against thee seven times in the day and seven times turn to thee saying I repent thou shalt forgive him five And the apostles said to the Lord Increase our faith six And the Lord said If ye had faith as a grain of mustard ye would say to this sycamine tree Be thou plucked up by the root and planted in the sea and it would have obeyed you seven And who of you having a servant plowing or feeding cattle will say to him immediately when he has come in from the field Come and recline at table eight and will not rather say to him Make ready wherewith I may sup and gird thyself and serve me till I have eaten and drunken and afterward thou shalt eat and drink nine Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded I think not ten So also ye when ye shall have done all the fourteen And seeing it he said to them Go show yourselves to the priests And it came to pass that as they went they were cleansed fifteen And one of them seeing that he was healed turned back with a eighteen Were none found returning to give glory to God except this stranger nineteen And he said to him Arise and go thy faith has made thee whole twenty And being asked by the Pharisees when the to them sixteen He will come and destroy these husbandmen and will give the vineyard to others And hearing it they said Far be it seventeen And he looking on them said What then is this that is written The stone which the builders disallowed The same is become the head of the corner eighteen Every one that falls upon that stone shall be broken but on whomsoever it shall fall it will grind before the people and they marveled at his answer and held their peace twenty seven And some of the Sadducees who deny that there is a resurrection coming to him asked him twenty eight saying Teacher thirty three In the resurrection therefore of which of them is she wife For the seven had her for a wife thirty four And Jesus answering said to them The sons of this world marry and are given in forty For they no longer dared to ask him any question forty one And he said to them How say they that the Christ is son of David forty two And David himself says in the book of Psalms The LORD said exercise lordship over them and they who exercise authority over them are called benefactors twenty six But ye are not so but let the greatest among you become as the younger and he that is chief as he that serves twenty seven For which is greater he that reclines at table or he that serves Is not he that reclines at table But I am in the midst of you as he that serves twenty eight Ye are they who have continued with me in my temptations twenty nine and I appoint to you a kingdom as my Father appointed to me thirty that ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom and ye shall sit on Therefore said he to them But now he that has a purse let him take it and likewise a bag and he that has not let him sell his garment and buy a sword thirty seven For I say to you that yet this which eight But Jesus said to him Judas betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss forty nine And they who were about him seeing what would follow said to him Lord shall we smite with the sword fifty And a
