the chief priests and captains of the temple and elders who were come to him Have ye come out as against a robber with swords and staves fifty three When I was daily with you in the temple ye stretched not forth your hands against me But this is your hour and the power of darkness fifty four And they took him and led him away and brought him into the house of the high priest And Peter followed afar off fifty five And they having kindled a fire in the midst of the court and sat down together Peter sat down among them fifty six And a certain maid seeing him as he sat by the fire and looking intently upon him said This man also was with him fifty seven And he denied him saying Woman I do not know him fifty eight And after a little while another seeing him said Thou also art of them And Peter said Man I am not fifty nine And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed saying Of a truth this one also was with him for he is a Galilaean sixty And Peter said Man I know not what thou sayest And immediately while he was yet speaking a cock crowed sixty one And the Lord turning looked upon Peter And Peter remembered the word of the Lord how he said to him Before a cock crows this day thou wilt deny me thrice sixty two And Peter went out and wept bitterly sixty three And the men who held Jesus mocked him beating him sixty four and having blindfolded him they asked him saying Prophesy who is it that smote thee sixty five And many other things they said reviling him sixty six And when it was day the elders of the people twenty two sixty six and the chief priests and scribes came together and they brought him up into their council saying sixty seven If thou art the Christ tell us And he said to them If I tell you ye will not believe sixty eight And if I ask ye will not answer sixty nine But henceforth shall the Son of man sit on the right hand of the power of God seventy And they all said Art thou then the Son of God And he said to them Ye say it for I am seventy one And they said Why need we any further witness For we ourselves heard it from his own mouth XXIII AND the whole multitude of them arose and led him unto Pilate two And they began to accuse him saying We found this man perverting our nation and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar saying that he himself is Christ a king three And Pilate asked him saying Art thou the King of the Jews And he answering said to him Thou sayest it four And Pilate said to the chief priests and the multitudes I find no fault in this man five And they were the more violent saying He stirs up the people teaching throughout all Judaea beginning from Galilee unto this place six When Pilate heard of Galilee he asked if the man is a Galilaean seven And learning that he belonged to Herod s jurisdiction he sent him up to Herod who also was himself in Jerusalem at that time eight And Herod when he saw Jesus rejoiced greatly for he had desired for a long time to see him because he had heard concerning him and he hoped to see some sign wrought by him nine And he questioned him in many words but he answered him nothing ten And the chief priests and scribes stood vehemently accusing him eleven And Herod with his men of war set him at naught and mocked him and arraying him in a gorgeous robe sent him back to Pilate twelve And Pilate and Herod on that day became friends with each other for before they were at enmity between themselves thirteen And Pilate having called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people fourteen said to them Ye brought to me this man as one perverting the people and behold I having examined him before you found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him fifteen No nor yet Herod for I sent you up to him and behold nothing worthy of death has been done by him sixteen I will therefore chastise and release him seventeen twenty three seventeen eighteen And they cried out all at once saying Away with this man and release to us Barabbas nineteen who for a certain sedition made in the city and for murder was cast into prison twenty Again therefore Pilate spoke to them desiring to release Jesus twenty one But they cried saying Crucify crucify him twenty two And a third time he said to them What evil then has this man done I found no cause of death in him I will therefore chastise and release him twenty three And they were urgent with loud voices requiring that he should be crucified And their voices and those of the chief priests prevailed twenty four And Pilate gave sentence that what they required should be done twenty five And he released him who for sedition and murder was cast into prison whom they required but Jesus he delivered up to their will twenty six And as they led him away they laid hold of one Simon a Cyrenian coming from the country and on him they laid the cross that he might bear it after Jesus twenty seven And there followed him a great company of the people and of women who also bewailed and lamented him twenty eight But Jesus turning to them said Daughters of Jerusalem weep not for me but weep for yourselves and for your children twenty nine For behold days are coming in which they shall say Happy the barren and wombs that never bore and breasts that never gave suck thirty Then shall they begin to say to the mountains Fall on us and to the hills Cover us thirty one For if they do these things in the green tree what shall be done in the dry thirty two And there were also two others malefactors led with him to be put to death thirty three And when they had gone away to the place which is called A Skull there they crucified him and the malefactors one on the right hand and the other on the left thirty four And Jesus said Father forgive them for they know not what they do And they divided his garments casting lots thirty five And the people stood beholding And the rulers also scoffed saying Others he saved let him save himself if he is the Christ the chosen of God thirty six And the soldiers also coming to him mocked him offering him vinegar thirty seven and saying If thou art the King of the Jews save thyself thirty eight And there was an inscription written over him THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS thirty nine And one of the malefactors who were hanged railed at him saying If thou art the Christ save thyself and us forty But the other answering rebuked him saying Dost thou not even fear God seeing thou art in the same condemnation forty one And we indeed justly for we are receiving the due reward of our deeds but this man did nothing amiss forty two And he said to Jesus Remember me when thou comest in thy kingdom forty three And Jesus said to him Verily I say to thee to day thou shalt be with me in paradise forty four And it was about the sixth hour and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour forty five And the sun was darkened and the vail of the temple was rent in the midst forty six And Jesus crying with a loud voice said Father into thy hands I commit my spirit And having said this he expired forty seven And the centurion seeing what was done glorified God saying Verily this man was righteous forty eight And all the multitudes who had come together to that sight having beheld the things that were done returned beating their breasts forty nine And all his acquaintance were standing afar off and women who had followed him from Galilee beholding these things fifty And behold a man named Joseph a counselor a good and just man fifty one he had not consented to their counsel and deed from Arimathaea a city of the Jews who was waiting for the kingdom of God fifty two this man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus fifty three And taking it down he wrapped it in linen and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in the rock where no one was yet laid fifty four And it was the day of preparation and the sabbath drew on fifty five And the women also who had come with him out of Galilee followed after and viewed the sepulchre and how his body was laid fifty six And returning they prepared spices and ointments and on the sabbath they rested according to the commandment XXIV NOW on the first day of the week very early in the morning they came to the sepulchre bringing the spices which they prepared two And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre three And entering in they found not the body of the Lord Jesus four And it came to pass that as they were much perplexed concerning this behold two men stood by them in shining garments five And they being afraid and bowing their faces to the earth they said to them Why seek ye the living among the dead six He is not here but is risen Remember how he spoke to you when he was yet in Galilee seven saying The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men and be crucified and on the third day rise again eight And they remembered his words nine And returning from the sepulchre they reported all these things to the eleven and to all the rest ten And it was Mary the Magdalene and Joanna and Mary the mother of James and the other women with them who said these things to the apostles eleven And their words seemed to them as idle talk and they believed them not twelve But Peter rose up and ran to the sepulchre and stooping down he beholds the linen cloths lying by themselves and he departed to his home wondering at that which was come to pass thirteen And behold two of them were going on that same day to a village called Emmaus distant sixty furlongs from Jerusalem fourteen And they were conversing together concerning all these things that had taken place fifteen And it came to pass that while they were conversing and reasoning Jesus himself drew near and went with them sixteen But their eyes were holden that they should not know him seventeen And he said to them What communications are these that ye have one with another as ye walk and are sad eighteen And one whose name was Cleopas answering said to him Dost thou alone sojourn in Jerusalem and not know the things that have come to pass there in these days nineteen And he said to them What things And they said to him The things concerning Jesus of Nazareth who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people twenty and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death and crucified him twenty one But we were hoping that it was he who was to redeem Israel But indeed beside all this to day is the third day since these things were done twenty two Yea and certain women also of our company made us astonished who were early at the sepulchre twenty three and not finding his body came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels who say that he is alive twenty four And some of those who were with us went away to the sepulchre and found it even so as the women said but him they saw not twenty five Then he said to them O foolish and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken twenty six Was it not necessary that the Christ should suffer these things and enter into his glory twenty seven And beginning from Moses and all the prophets he explained to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself twenty eight And they drew near to the village whither they were going and he made as though he would go further twenty nine But they constrained him saying Abide with us for it is toward evening and the day has declined And he went in to abide with them thirty And it came to pass that as he was reclining at table with them he took bread and blessed it and breaking gave to them thirty one And their eyes were opened and they knew him and he vanished out of their sight thirty two And they said one to another Did not our them These are my words which I spoke to you while I was yet with you that all things must be fulfilled which are written in the law of Moses and the prophets and psalms concerning me forty five Then he opened their understanding that they might understand the Scriptures forty six And he said to them Thus it is written that the Christ should suffer and should rise from the dead on the third day them fifty one And it came to pass while he blessed them that he parted from them and was borne up into heaven fifty two And they having worshiped him returned to Jerusalem with great joy fifty three and were continually in the temple praising and blessing God THE GOSPEL ACCORDING TO JOHN I IN the beginning was the Word and the Word was with God and the Word was God two The same was in the beginning with God three All things were made by him one three and without him was nothing made that has been made four In him was life and the life was the light of men five And the light shines in the darkness and the darkness comprehended it not six There was a man sent from God whose name was John seven The same came for witness to bear witness of the light that through him all might believe eight He was not the light but came to bear witness of the light nine There was the true light which lights every man that comes into the world ten He was in the world and the world was made by him and the world knew him not eleven He came to his own and his own received him not twelve But as many as received him to them he gave power to become children of God to those who believe on his name thirteen who were born not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of man but of God fourteen And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us one fourteen and we beheld his glory a glory as of the only begotten from the Father full of grace and truth fifteen John bore witness of him and cried saying This was he of whom I said He that comes after me is preferred before me because he was before me one fifteen sixteen Because out of his fullness we all received and grace for grace seventeen For the law was given through Moses grace and truth came through Jesus Christ eighteen No one has ever seen God the only begotten Son who is in the bosom of the Father he declared him nineteen And this is the witness of John when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him Who art thou twenty And he confessed and denied not and he confessed I am not the Christ twenty one And they asked him What then Art thou Elijah And he says I am not Art thou the Prophet And he answered No twenty two They said therefore to him Who art thou that we may give an answer to those who sent us What sayest thou of thyself twenty three He said I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness Make straight the way of the Lord as said Isaiah the prophet twenty four And they who were sent were of the Pharisees twenty five And they asked him and said to him Why then dost thou immerse if thou art not the Christ nor Elijah nor the Prophet twenty six John answered them saying I immerse in water There stands one in the midst of you whom ye know not twenty seven he who comes after me the latchet of whose sandal I am not worthy to loose twenty eight These things took place in Bethany beyond the Jordan where John was immersing twenty nine On the morrow he sees Jesus coming to him and says Behold the Lamb of God that takes away the sin of the world thirty This is he of whom I said After me comes a man who is preferred before me because he was before me one thirty thirty one And I knew him not but that he might be made manifest to Israel for this I came immersing in water thirty two And John bore witness saying I have seen the Spirit descending as a dove out of heaven and it abode upon him thirty three And I knew him not but he who sent me to immerse in water the same said to me Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending and abiding on him the same is he who immerses in the Holy Spirit thirty four And I have seen and have borne witness that this is the Son of God thirty five Again on the morrow John was standing and two of his disciples thirty six and looking upon Jesus as he walked he says Behold the Lamb of God thirty seven And the two disciples heard him speak and they followed Jesus thirty eight And Jesus turning and beholding them following says to them What seek ye They said to him Rabbi which interpreted means Teacher where dost thou abide thirty nine He says to them Come and ye shall see They came and saw where he abode and they abode with him that day It was about the tenth hour forty Andrew the brother of Simon Peter was one of the two who heard it from John and followed him forty one He first finds his brother Simon and says to him We have found the Messiah which is interpreted Christ forty two And he brought him to Jesus Jesus beholding him said Thou art Simon the son of Jonah thou shalt be called Cephas which is interpreted Peter one forty two forty three On the morrow he would go forth into Galilee And he finds Philip and Jesus says to him Follow me forty four Now Philip was from Bethsaida of the city of Andrew and Peter forty five Philip finds Nathanael and says to him We have found him of whom Moses in the law and the prophets wrote Jesus the son of Joseph who is from Nazareth forty six And Nathanael said to him Can any good thing come out of Nazareth Philip says to him Come and see forty seven Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him and says of him Behold an Israelite indeed in whom is no guile forty eight Nathanael says to him Whence knowest thou me Jesus answered and said to him Before Philip called thee when thou wast under the fig tree I saw thee forty nine Nathanael answered Rabbi thou art the Son of God thou art the King of Israel fifty Jesus answered and said to him Because I said to thee I saw thee under the fig tree believest thou Thou shalt see greater things than these fifty one And he says to him Verily verily I say to you henceforth one fifty one ye shall see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man II AND on the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee and the mother of Jesus was there two And Jesus also was bidden and his disciples to the marriage three And wine having failed the mother of Jesus says to him They have no wine four Jesus says to her Woman what have I to do with thee My hour is not yet come five His mother says to the servants Whatever he says to you do it six Now there were set there six water pots of stone after the Jewish custom of purifying containing two or three firkins two six apiece seven Jesus says to them Fill the water pots with water And they filled them up to the brim eight And he says to them Draw out now and bear to the ruler of the feast And they bore it nine When the ruler of the feast tasted the water that was made wine and he knew not whence it was but the servants who had drawn the water knew the ruler of the feast called the bridegroom ten and says to him Every man sets forth the good wine first and when they have drunk freely then that which is worse Thou hast kept the good wine until now eleven This beginning of the signs Jesus wrought in Cana of Galilee and manifested his glory and his disciples believed on him twelve After this he went down to Capernaum he and his mother and his brothers and his disciples and they abode there not many days thirteen And the passover of the Jews was at hand and Jesus went up to Jerusalem fourteen And he found in the temple those who sold oxen and sheep and doves and the money changers sitting fifteen And having made a scourge of small cords he drove all out of the temple both the sheep and the oxen and poured out the changers money and overthrew the tables sixteen and to those who sold doves he said Take these things hence make not my Father s house a house of merchandise seventeen And his disciples remembered that it is written for thy house consumes me eighteen The Jews therefore answered and said to him What sign dost thou show to us seeing that thou doest these things nineteen Jesus answered and said to them Destroy this temple and in three days I will raise it up twenty Therefore said the Jews Forty and six years was this temple in building and wilt thou raise it up in three days twenty one But he said it of the temple of his body twenty two When therefore he was risen from the dead his disciples remembered that he said this and they believed the Scripture and the word which Jesus spoke twenty three And when he was in Jerusalem at the passover on the feast day many believed on his name beholding his signs which he wrought twenty four But Jesus did not trust himself to them because he knew all men twenty five and had no need that any one should testify of man for he himself knew what was in man III THERE was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus a ruler of the Jews two The same came to him by night and said to him Rabbi we know that thou hast come a teacher from God for no one can do these signs which thou doest except God be with him three Jesus answered and said to him Verily verily I say to thee except a man be born again three three he can not see the kingdom of God four Nicodemus says to him How can a man be born when he is old Can he enter the second time into his mother s womb and be born five Jesus answered Verily verily I say to thee except a man be born of water and the Spirit he can not enter into the kingdom of God six That which is born of the flesh is flesh and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit seven Marvel not that I said to thee Ye must be born again eight The wind blows where it will and thou hearest the sound thereof but knowest not whence it comes and whither it goes So is every one that is born of the Spirit nine Nicodemus answered and said to him How can these things be ten Jesus answered and said to him Art thou the teacher of Israel and knowest not these things eleven Verily verily I say to thee we speak that which we know and testify that which we have seen and ye receive not our testimony twelve If I told you the earthly things and ye believe not how shall ye believe if I tell you the heavenly things thirteen And no one has ascended up into heaven but he who came down out of heaven the Son of man who is in heaven fourteen And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness so must the Son of man be lifted up fifteen that every one who believes on him may have everlasting life sixteen For God so loved the world that he gave his only begotten Son that whoever believes on him should not perish but may have everlasting life seventeen For God sent not his Son into the world to judge the world but that the world through him might be saved eighteen He that believes on him is not judged but he that believes not has already been judged because he has not believed on the name of the only begotten Son of God nineteen And this is the judgment that light has come into the world and men loved the darkness rather than the light for their deeds were evil twenty For every one that does evil hates the light and comes not to the light lest his deeds should be reproved twenty one But he that does the truth comes to the light that his deeds may be made manifest that they are wrought in God twenty two After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea and there he remained with them and immersed twenty three And John also was immersing in Aenon near to Salim because there was much water there and they came and were immersed twenty four For John was not yet cast into prison twenty five There arose therefore a question on the part of John s disciples with a Jew about purification twenty six And they came to John and said to him Rabbi he who was with thee beyond the Jordan to whom thou hast borne witness behold he immerses and all come to him twenty seven John answered and said A man can receive nothing except it be given him from heaven twenty eight Ye yourselves bear me witness that I said I am not the Christ but I am sent before him twenty nine He that has the bride is the bridegroom But the friend of the bridegroom who stands and hears him rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom s voice This my joy therefore is made full thirty He must increase but I must decrease thirty one He that comes from above is above all he that is from the earth is of the earth and speaks of the earth he that comes from heaven is above all thirty two And what he has seen and heard that he testifies and his testimony no one receives thirty three He that received his testimony has set his seal That God is true thirty four For he whom God sent forth speaks the words of God for he gives not three thirty four the Spirit by measure thirty five The Father loves the Son and has given all things into his hand thirty six He that believes on the Son has everlasting life and he that believes not the Son shall not see life but the wrath of God abides on him IV WHEN therefore the Lord knew that the Pharisees heard that Jesus made and immersed more disciples than John two though Jesus himself immersed not but his disciples three he left Judaea and departed again into Galilee four And he must go through Samaria five He comes therefore to a city of Samaria called Sychar four five near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph six And Jacob s well was there Jesus therefore being wearied with the journey sat down thus on the well It was about the sixth hour seven There comes a woman of Samaria to draw water Jesus says to her Give me to drink eight For his disciples had gone away into the city to buy food nine The Samaritan woman therefore says to him How is it that thou being a Jew askest drink of me being a Samaritan woman For Jews do not associate with Samaritans ten Jesus answered and said to her If thou knewest the gift of God and who it is that says to thee Give me to drink thou wouldest have asked of him and he would have given thee living water eleven The woman says to him Sir thou hast nothing to draw with and the well is deep From whence then hast thou the living water twelve Art thou greater than our father Jacob who gave us the well and drank thereof himself and his children and his cattle thirteen Jesus answered and said to her Every one that drinks of this water shall thirst again fourteen But whoever drinks of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst but the water that I shall give him shall become in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life fifteen The woman says to him Sir give me this water that I may not thirst nor come hither to draw sixteen Jesus says to her Go call thy husband and come hither seventeen The woman answered and said I have no husband Jesus says to her Thou saidst well I have no husband eighteen For thou hast had five husbands and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband That thou hast spoken truly nineteen The woman says to him Sir I perceive that thou art a prophet twenty Our fathers worshiped in this mountain and ye say that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship twenty one Jesus says to her Woman believe me an hour is coming when ye shall neither in this mountain nor in Jerusalem worship the Father twenty two Ye worship that which ye know not we worship that which we know because salvation is of the Jews twenty three But an hour is coming and now is when the true worshipers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth for such the Father seeks to worship him twenty four God is spirit and they that worship him must worship in spirit and in truth twenty five The woman says to him I know that Messiah comes who is called Christ when he is come he will tell us all things twenty six Jesus says to her I that speak to thee am he twenty seven And upon this came his disciples and they marveled that he talked with the woman four twenty seven Yet no one said What seekest thou or Why talkest thou with her twenty eight The woman then left her water pot and went away into the city and she says to the men twenty nine Come see a man who told me all things that ever I did Is this the Christ thirty Then they went out of the city and came to him thirty one In the mean while the disciples prayed him saying Master eat thirty two But he said to them I have food to eat that ye know not of thirty three Therefore said the disciples one to another Has any one brought him aught to eat thirty four Jesus says to them My food is to do the will of him who sent me and to finish his work thirty five Do ye not say that there are yet four months and then comes the harvest Behold I say to you lift up your eyes and look on the fields that they are already white for harvest thirty six And he that reaps receives wages and gathers fruit unto life eternal that both he that sows and he that reaps may rejoice together thirty seven And herein is the true saying One sows and another reaps thirty eight I sent you to reap that whereon ye have not labored Other men have labored and ye have entered into their labor thirty nine And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman who testified He told me all that ever I did forty When therefore the Samaritans came to him they besought him to remain with them And he remained there two days forty one And far more believed because of his word forty two and said to the woman We no longer believe because of thy saying for we ourselves have heard and know that this is in truth the Savior of the world forty three And after the two days he departed thence and went into Galilee forty four For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country forty five When therefore he came into Galilee the Galilaeans received him having seen all that he did in Jerusalem at the feast for they also went to the feast forty six So he came again into Cana of Galilee where he made the water wine And there was a certain nobleman whose son was sick in Capernaum forty seven He having heard that Jesus is come out of Judaea into Galilee went to him and besought him that he would come down and heal his son for he was about to die forty eight Jesus therefore said to him Except ye see signs and wonders ye will not believe forty nine The nobleman says to him Sir come down ere my child die fifty Jesus says to him Go thy way thy son lives And the man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and he went his way fifty one And as he was now going down his servants met him and brought word saying Thy child lives fifty two He inquired of them therefore the hour when he began to amend And they said to him Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him fifty three The father knew therefore that it was in the same hour in which Jesus said to him Thy son lives And he himself believed and his whole house fifty four This second sign Jesus wrought when he had come out of Judaea into Galilee V AFTER these things there was a feast of the Jews and Jesus went up to Jerusalem two And there is in Jerusalem by the sheep gate a pool which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda having five porches three In these lay a multitude of the infirm of blind lame withered waiting for the moving of the water four For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool and troubled the water He therefore who first went in after the troubling of the water was made whole of whatever disease he had five four five And a certain man was there who had an infirmity thirty and eight years six Jesus seeing this man lying and knowing that he had been already a long time thus says to him Dost thou desire to be made whole seven The infirm man answered him Sir I have no man when the water is troubled to put me into the pool but while I am coming another goes down before me eight Jesus says to him Rise take up thy bed and walk nine And immediately the man was made whole and took up his bed and walked And on that day was the sabbath ten The Jews therefore said to him that was cured It is the sabbath it is not lawful for thee to carry the bed eleven He answered them He who made me whole the same said to me Take up thy bed and walk twelve They asked him therefore Who is the man that said to thee Take up thy bed and walk thirteen And he who was healed knew not who it was for Jesus conveyed himself away there being a multitude in the place fourteen Afterward Jesus finds him in the temple And he said to him Behold thou hast been made whole sin no more lest something worse befall thee fifteen The man departed and told the Jews that it was Jesus who made him whole sixteen And for this the Jews persecuted Jesus because he did these things on the sabbath seventeen But Jesus answered them My Father works hitherto and I work eighteen For this therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him because he not only broke the sabbath but also called God his Father making himself equal with God nineteen Jesus therefore answered and said to them Verily verily I say to you the Son can do nothing of himself but what he sees the Father do for what things soever he does these also does the Son in like manner twenty For the Father loves the Son and shows him all things that he himself does and greater works than these will he show him that ye may marvel twenty one For as the Father raises up the dead and quickens them so also the Son quickens whom he will twenty two For neither does the Father judge any one but all judgment he has given to the Son twenty three that all may honor the Son as they honor the Father He that honors not the Son honors not the Father who sent him twenty four Verily verily I say to you he that hears my word and believes him who sent me has everlasting life and comes not into judgment but has passed out of death into life twenty five Verily verily I say to you an hour is coming and now is when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God and they that hear shall live twenty six For as the Father has life in himself so he gave also to the Son to have life in himself twenty seven And he gave him authority to execute judgment also because he is a son of man twenty eight Marvel not at this for an hour is coming in which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice twenty nine and shall come forth they that did good to the resurrection of life and they that did evil to the resurrection of judgment thirty I can of myself do nothing As I hear I judge and my judgment is just because I seek not my own will but the will of him who sent me thirty one If I bear witness of myself my witness is not true thirty two There is another that bears witness of me and I know that the witness which he witnesses of me is true thirty three Ye have sent to John and he has borne witness to the truth thirty four But I receive the witness not from man but these things I say that ye might be saved thirty five He was the burning and shining lamp and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light thirty six But I have greater witness than that of John for the works which the Father gave me to finish the works themselves that I do bear witness of me that the Father has sent me thirty seven And the Father who sent me he has borne witness of me Ye have neither heard his voice at any time nor have ye seen his shape thirty eight And ye have not his word abiding in you for whom he sent him ye believe not thirty nine Search five thirty nine the Scriptures because in them ye think ye have eternal life and these are they that testify of me forty and ye will not come to me that ye may have life forty one I receive not honor from men forty two But I know you that ye have not the love of God in you forty three I have come in my Father s name and ye receive me not if another shall come in his own name him ye will receive forty four How can ye believe receiving honor from one another and the honor that is from God alone ye seek not forty five Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father there is one that accuses you Moses in whom ye have placed your hope forty six For if ye believed Moses ye would believe me for he wrote of me forty seven But if ye believe not his writings how shall ye believe my words VI AFTER these things Jesus went away beyond the sea of Galilee which is the sea of Tiberias two And a great multitude followed him because they saw the signs which he wrought on the sick three And Jesus went up into the mountain and there he sat with his disciples four And the passover the feast of the Jews was near five Jesus therefore lifting up his eyes and seeing that a great multitude is coming to him says to Philip Whence shall we buy bread that these may eat six And this he said to try him for he himself knew what he was about to do seven Philip answered him Two hundred denaries worth of bread is not sufficient for them that each one may take a little eight One of his disciples Andrew the brother of Simon Peter says to him nine There is a lad here who has five barley loaves and two small fishes but what are they among so many ten Jesus said Make the men lie down Now there was much grass in the place So the men lay down in number about five thousand eleven And Jesus took the loaves and having given thanks he distributed to those who were lying down and likewise of the fishes as much as they desired twelve When they were filled he said to his disciples Gather up the fragments that remain that nothing be lost thirteen Therefore they gathered them together and filled twelve baskets with fragments of the five barley loaves which remained over and above to those who had eaten fourteen The men therefore seeing the sign that Jesus wrought said This is of a truth the Prophet that comes into the world fifteen Jesus therefore knowing that they were about to come and take him by force to make him a king withdrew again into the mountain himself alone sixteen And when evening came his disciples went down to the sea seventeen and entering into the ship were going over the sea to Capernaum And it was now dark and Jesus had not come to them eighteen and as a strong wind was blowing the sea began to rise nineteen When therefore they had rowed about twenty five or thirty furlongs they see Jesus walking on the sea and drawing near to the ship and they were afraid twenty But he says to them It is I be not afraid twenty one They therefore willingly received him into the ship and immediately the ship was at the land whither they were going twenty two On the morrow the multitude that stood on the other side of the sea seeing that there was no other boat there but one and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the ship but his disciples went away alone twenty three but there came other boats from Tiberias near to the place where they ate bread when the Lord had given thanks twenty four when therefore the multitude saw that Jesus was not there nor his disciples they themselves entered into the boats and came to Capernaum seeking for Jesus twenty five And having found him on the other side of the sea they said to him Rabbi when camest thou hither twenty six Jesus answered them and said Verily verily I say to you ye seek me not because ye saw signs but because ye ate of the loaves and were filled twenty seven Work not for the food that perishes but for the food that endures unto everlasting life which the Son of man will give to you for him the Father God has sealed twenty eight Therefore they said to him What shall we do that we may work the works of God twenty nine Jesus answered and said to them This is the work of God that ye believe on him whom he sent thirty They therefore said to him What sign doest thou then that we may see and believe thee What dost thou work thirty one Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness as it is written He gave them bread from heaven to eat thirty two Jesus therefore said to them Verily verily I say to you Moses has not given you the bread from heaven but my Father gives you the true bread from heaven thirty three For the bread of God is that which six thirty three comes down out of heaven and gives life to the world thirty four They therefore said to him Lord evermore give us this bread thirty five Jesus said to them I am the bread of life He that comes to me shall never hunger and he that believes on me shall never thirst thirty six But I said to you that ye have also seen me and do not believe thirty seven All that the Father gives me will come to me and him that comes to me I will not cast out thirty eight Because I have come down from heaven not to do my own will but the will of him who sent me thirty nine And this is the will of him who sent me that of all which he has given me I should lose nothing but should raise it up at the last day forty For this is the will of my Father that every one who sees the Son and believes on him may have everlasting life and I will raise him up at the last day forty one The Jews therefore murmured at him because he said I am the bread that came down out of heaven forty two And they said Is not this Jesus the son of Joseph whose father and mother we know How then does this man say I have come down out of heaven forty three Jesus answered and said to them Murmur not among yourselves forty four No one can come to me except the Father who sent me draw him and I will raise him up at the last day forty five It is written in the prophets And they shall all be taught of God Every one that has heard from the Father and has learned comes to me forty six Not that any one has seen the Father save he who is from God he has seen the Father forty seven Verily verily I say to you he that believes on me has everlasting life forty eight I am the bread of life forty nine Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness and are dead fifty This is the bread that comes down out of heaven that one may eat thereof and not die fifty one I am the living bread that came down out of heaven If any one eat of this bread he shall live forever yea and the bread that I will give is my flesh which I will give for the life of the world fifty two The Jews therefore contended with one another saying How can this man give us his flesh to eat fifty three Jesus therefore said to them Verily verily I say to you except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man and drink his blood ye have no life in you fifty four He that eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life and I will raise him up at the last day fifty five For my flesh is true food and my blood is true drink fifty six He that eats my flesh and drinks my blood abides in me and I in him fifty seven As the living Father has sent me and I live because of the Father so he that eats me he also shall live because of me fifty eight This is the bread that came down out of heaven Not as your fathers ate the manna and are dead he that eats of this bread shall live forever fifty nine These things he said in the synagogue while teaching in Capernaum sixty Many therefore of his disciples when they heard it said This is a hard saying who can hear it sixty one But Jesus knowing in himself that his disciples murmured at this said to them Does this offend you sixty two What then if ye behold the Son of man ascending up where he was before sixty three It is the spirit that makes alive the flesh profits nothing the words which I have spoken to you are spirit and are life sixty four But there are some of you that believe not For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not and who it was that should betray him sixty five And he said For this cause I have said to you that no one can come to me except it be given him from the Father sixty six From this time many of his disciples went back and walked no more with him sixty seven Jesus said therefore to the twelve Will ye also go away sixty eight Simon Peter answered him Lord to whom shall we go Thou hast words of eternal life sixty nine And we believe and know that thou art the Holy One of God seventy Jesus answered them Did I not choose you the twelve and one of you is a devil seventy one He spoke of Judas Iscariot son of Simon for he it was that would betray him being one of the twelve VII AND after these things Jesus walked in Galilee for he would not walk in Judaea because the Jews were seeking to kill him two Now the feast of the Jews the feast of tabernacles was at hand three His brothers therefore said to him Depart hence and go into Judaea that thy disciples also may behold thy works that thou doest four For no one does anything in secret and he himself seeks to be known openly If thou doest these things manifest thyself to the world five For neither did his brothers believe on him six Jesus therefore says to them My time is not yet come but your time is always ready seven The world can not hate you but me it hates because I testify of it that its works are evil eight Go ye up to the feast I go not up to this feast because my time is not yet fully come nine Having said these things to them he remained in Galilee ten But when his brothers were gone up to the feast then he also went up not openly but as it were in secret eleven The Jews therefore sought him at the feast and said Where is he twelve And there was much murmuring among the multitudes concerning him Some said He is a good man others said Nay but he misleads the multitude thirteen No one however spoke openly of him for fear of the Jews fourteen But when it was already the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple and taught fifteen And the Jews wondered saying How knows this man letters having never learned sixteen Jesus therefore answered them and said My teaching is not mine but his who sent me seventeen If any one desires to do his will he shall know of the teaching whether it is of God or whether I speak from myself eighteen He that speaks from himself seeks his own glory but he that seeks the glory of him who sent him the same is true and there is no unrighteousness in him nineteen Has not Moses given you the law and none of you keeps the law Why do ye seek to kill me twenty The multitude answered and said Thou hast a demon who seeks to kill thee twenty one Jesus answered and said to them I did one work and ye all marvel twenty two Moses has for this cause given you circumcision not that it is of Moses but of the fathers and on the sabbath ye circumcise a man twenty three If a man receives circumcision on the sabbath that the law of Moses may not be broken are ye angry at me because I made a man altogether whole on the sabbath twenty four Judge not according to appearance but judge the righteous judgment twenty five Then said some of those of Jerusalem Is not this he whom they seek to kill twenty six But lo he speaks boldly and they say nothing to him Did the rulers know seven twenty six in truth that this is the Christ twenty seven But we know this man whence he is but when the Christ comes no one knows whence he is twenty eight Jesus therefore cried teaching in the temple and saying Ye both know me and ye know whence I am and I have not come of myself but he that sent me is true whom ye know not twenty nine I know him because I am from him and he sent me thirty Therefore they sought to seize him and no one laid hands on him because his hour had not yet come thirty one But of the multitude many believed on him and said When the Christ comes will he work more signs than these which this man wrought thirty two The Pharisees heard the multitude murmuring these things concerning him and the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to seize him thirty three Jesus therefore said Yet a little ye can not come thirty seven In the last day the great day of the feast Jesus stood and cried saying If any one thirst let him come to me and drink thirty eight He that believes on me as said the because Jesus was not yet glorified forty Some of the multitude therefore hearing the words said Of a truth this is the Prophet forty one Others said This is the Christ But some said Does the Christ then come out of Galilee forty two Did not the Scripture say that the Christ comes of the seed of David and from the town of Bethlehem where David was forty three A division therefore arose among the two fifty three seven fifty three And each one went to his house VIII JESUS went to the mount of the Olives two And early in the morning he came again into the temple and all the people came to him But Jesus having stooped down was writing with his finger in the ground seven And as they continued asking him raising himself up he said to them He that is without sin among you let him first cast She said No one Lord And Jesus said to her Neither do I condemn thee go and sin no more twelve Again therefore Jesus spoke to them saying I am the light of the world he that follows me shall not walk in the darkness but shall have the light of life thirteen The Pharisees therefore said to him Thou bearest witness of thyself thy witness is not true fourteen Jesus answered and said to them Though I even if I judge my judgment is true because I am not alone but I and the Father who sent me seventeen It is written also in your law that the witness of two men is true eighteen I am one that bear witness of myself and the Father who sent me bears witness of me nineteen They said therefore to him Where is thy Father Jesus answered Ye know neither me nor my Father If ye knew me ye would know my Father also twenty These words he spoke in the treasury while teaching in the temple and no one laid hands on him because his hour had not yet come twenty one Again therefore he said to them I go away and ye will seek me and shall die in your sin Whither I go ye can not come twenty two The Jews therefore said Will he kill himself because he says Whither I go ye can not come twenty three And he said you But he who sent me is true and the things which I heard from him these I speak to the world twenty seven They understood not that he spoke to them of the Father twenty eight Therefore Jesus said continue in my word ye are truly my disciples thirty two and ye shall know the truth and the truth will make you free thirty three They answered him We are Abraham s seed and have never been in Jesus says to them If ye were children of Abraham ye would do the works of Abraham forty But now ye seek to kill me a man who has spoken to you the truth which I heard from God This Abraham did not forty one Ye do the works of your father They said to him We were not born of fornication we have one father God forty two Jesus said to them If God were your father ye would love me for from God I Art thou greater than our father Abraham who is dead And the prophets are dead Whom makest thou thyself fifty four Jesus answered If I honor myself my honor is nothing It is my Father that honors me of whom ye say that he is your God fifty five And ye know him not but I know him And if I say I know him not I shall be a liar like to you But I know him and I keep his word fifty six Abraham your birth two And his disciples asked him saying Master who sinned this man or his parents that he should be born blind three Jesus answered Neither this man sinned nor his parents but that the works of God should be made manifest in him four I must work the works of him who sent me while it is day Night is coming when none can work five As long as I am in the world I am the light of the world six Having thus spoken he spit on the ground and made clay of the spittle and anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay seven and said to him Go wash in the pool of Siloam which is interpreted Sent He went away therefore and washed and came seeing eight The neighbors therefore and they who before had seen him that he was a beggar said Is not this he that sits and begs nine Some said This is he and others He is like him he said I am he ten Therefore they said to him How were thine eyes opened eleven He answered A man called Jesus made clay and anointed mine eyes and said to me Go to the pool of Siloam and wash And I went away and washed and received sight twelve They said to him Where is he He said I know not thirteen They bring to the Pharisees him who before was blind fourteen And it was the sabbath when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes fifteen Again therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he received sight He said to them He put clay upon mine eyes and I washed and do see sixteen Therefore some of the Pharisees said This man is not from God because he keeps not the sabbath Others said How can a man that is a sinner do such signs And there was a division among them seventeen They say to the blind man again What sayest thou of him seeing that he opened thine eyes He said He is a Prophet eighteen The Jews therefore did not believe concerning him that he was blind and received sight until they called the parents of him that received sight nineteen And they asked them saying Is this your son who ye say was born blind How then does he now see twenty His parents answered them and said We know that this is our son and that he was born blind twenty one But by what means he now sees we know not or who opened his eyes we know not He is of age ask him He shall speak for himself twenty two These words spoke his parents because they feared the Jews for the Jews had agreed already that if any one acknowledged him as Christ he should be put out of the synagogue twenty three Therefore his parents said He is of age ask him twenty four They therefore called a second time the man that was blind and said to him Give glory to God we know that this man is a sinner twenty five He answered therefore Whether he is a sinner I know not one thing I know that whereas I was blind now I see twenty six They therefore said to him What did he to thee How opened he thine eyes twenty seven He answered them I told you already and ye did not hear Wherefore would ye hear again Will ye also become his disciples twenty eight They reviled him and said Thou art his disciple but we are Moses disciples twenty nine We know that God has spoken to Moses but this man we know not whence he is thirty The man answered and said to them Why herein is a marvelous thing that ye know not heard that any one opened the eyes of one born blind thirty three If this man were not from God he could do nothing thirty four They answered and said to him Thou wast altogether born in sins and And Jesus said For judgment came I into this world that they who see not may see and that they who see may become blind forty And some of the Pharisees who were with him heard these words and said to him Are we also blind forty one Jesus said to them If ye were blind ye would not have sin But now ye say We see Your sin remains X VERILY verily I say to you He that enters not through the door into voice and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out four And when he has put forth all his own he goes before them and the sheep follow him for they know his voice five And a stranger they Therefore said Jesus to them again Verily verily I say to you I am the door of the sheep eight All who came before me are thieves and robbers but the sheep did not hear them nine I am the door If any one enter in through me he shall be saved and shall go in and out and find pasture ten The thief comes not but to steal and to kill and to destroy I came that they may have life and that they may have it abundantly eleven I am the good shepherd The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep twelve But he that is a hireling and not a shepherd whose own the sheep are not sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees and the wolf catches them and scatters the sheep thirteen The hireling flees because he is a hireling and cares not for the sheep fourteen I am the good shepherd and I know mine and am known by mine fifteen as the Father knows me and I know the Father and I lay down my life for the sheep sixteen And other sheep I have which are not of this fold Them also I must bring and they shall hear my voice and there shall be one flock one shepherd seventeen For this the Father loves me because I lay down my life that I may take it again eighteen No one takes it from me but I lay it down of myself I have authority to lay it down and I have authority to take it again This commandment I received from my Father nineteen Again there arose a division among the Jews because of these words twenty And many of them said He has a demon and is mad why do ye hear him twenty one Others said These are not the words of one that has a demon Can a demon open the eyes of the blind twenty two And there came the feast of the dedication in Jerusalem and it was winter twenty three And Jesus was walking in the temple in the porch of Solomon twenty four The Jews therefore came around him and for which of those works do ye stone me thirty three The Jews answered him For a good work we stone thee not but for blasphemy and because thou being man makest thyself God thirty four Jesus answered them Is it not written in your law I said Ye are gods thirty five If he called them gods to whom the word of God came and the Scripture can not be broken thirty six say ye of him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world Thou blasphemest because I said I am the Son of God thirty seven If I do not the works of my Father believe me not thirty eight But if I do though ye believe not me believe the works that ye may learn and know that the Father is in me and I in the Father thirty nine Therefore they sought again to seize him and he went forth out of their hand forty And he went away again beyond the Jordan to the place where John was at first immersing and there he abode forty one And many came to him and said John indeed wrought no sign but all things that John spoke of this man were true forty two And many believed on him there XI NOW a certain one was sick Lazarus of Bethany from the village of Mary and Martha her sister two It was the Mary who anointed the Lord with ointment and wiped his feet with her hair whose brother Lazarus was sick three The sisters therefore sent to him saying Lord behold he whom thou lovest is sick four And Jesus hearing it said This sickness is not for death but for the sake of the glory of God that the Son of God may be glorified thereby five Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus six When therefore he heard that he was sick he then abode two days in the place where he was seven Then after this he says to the disciples Let us go into Judaea again eight The disciples say to him Master the Jews of late sought to stone thee and goest thou thither again nine Jesus answered Are there not twelve hours in the day If any one walk in the day he stumbles not because he sees the light of this world ten But if any one walk in the night he stumbles because the light is not in him eleven These things said he and after this he says to them Lazarus our friend has fallen asleep but I go that I may awake him out of sleep twelve Therefore his disciples said Lord if he has fallen asleep he will be restored thirteen But Jesus had spoken of his death but they thought that he said it of taking rest in sleep fourteen Then therefore Jesus said to them plainly Lazarus is dead fifteen And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there that ye may believe But let us go to him sixteen Therefore said Thomas who is called Didymus to his fellow disciples Let us also go that we may die with him seventeen Having come therefore Jesus found that he had already been four days in the tomb eighteen Now Bethany was nigh to Jerusalem about fifteen furlongs off nineteen And many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary to comfort them concerning their brother twenty Therefore Martha when she heard that Jesus is coming went and met him but Mary sat in the house twenty one Then said Martha to Jesus Lord if thou hadst been here my brother had not died twenty two But even now I know that whatever thou shalt ask of God God says to him Yea Lord I believe that thou art the Christ the Son of God who comes into the world twenty eight And having said this she went away and called Mary her sister secretly saying The Teacher The Jews therefore who were with her in the house and comforting her when they saw that Mary rose up hastily and went out followed her saying She goes to the tomb to weep there thirty two Mary therefore when she came where Jesus was seeing him fell down at his feet saying to him Lord if thou hadst been here my brother had not died thirty three Jesus therefore when he saw her weeping and the Jews weeping who came with her groaned in spirit and was troubled thirty four And he said Where have ye laid him They say to him Lord come and see thirty five Jesus wept thirty six The Jews therefore said Behold how he loved him thirty seven And some of them said Could not this man who opened the eyes of the blind have caused even that this man should not have died thirty eight Jesus therefore again groaning in himself comes to the tomb It was a cave and a stone lay upon it thirty nine Jesus says Take away the stone The sister of him that was dead Martha says to him Lord by this time he is offensive for he has been dead four days forty Jesus says to her Said I not to thee that if thou believe thou shalt see the glory of God forty one So they took away the stone And Jesus raised his eyes upward and said Father I thank thee that thou didst hear me forty two And I knew that thou always hearest me but for the sake of the multitude standing around I said it that they might believe that thou didst send me forty three And having thus spoken he cried with a loud voice Lazarus come forth forty four And he that was dead came forth bound hand and foot with grave clothes and his face was bound about with a napkin Jesus says to them Loose him and let him go forty five Many therefore of the Jews who came to Mary and saw what he did believed on him forty six But some of them went away to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus did forty seven Therefore the chief priests and the Pharisees gathered a council and said What do we seeing that this man works many signs forty eight If we let him thus alone all will believe on him and the Romans will come and take away both our place and nation forty nine And a certain one of them Caiaphas being high priest that year said to them Ye know nothing fifty nor do ye consider that it is expedient for us that one man die for the people and not the whole nation perish fifty one And this he spoke not of himself but being high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus should die for the nation fifty two and not for the nation only but that also he should gather together into one the children of God that were scattered abroad fifty three Therefore from that day forth they took counsel together to put him to death fifty four Jesus therefore no longer walked openly among the Jews but departed thence to the country near to the wilderness to a city called Ephraim and there continued with his disciples fifty five And the passover of the Jews was at hand and many went up to Jerusalem out of the country before the passover that they might purify themselves fifty six They sought therefore for Jesus and said among themselves as they stood in the temple What think ye that he will not come to the feast fifty seven Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment that if any one knew where he was he should make it known that they might seize him XII THEREFORE Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany where Lazarus was who had been dead whom Jesus raised from the dead two They therefore made him a supper there and Martha served and Lazarus was one of those who reclined at table with him three Then Mary took a pound of ointment of pure spikenard very costly and anointed the feet of Jesus and wiped his feet with her hair and the house was filled with the odor of the ointment four Then says one of his disciples Judas Iscariot Simon s son who was about to betray him five Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred denaries twelve five and given to the poor six This he said not because he cared for the poor but because he was a thief and had the bag and bore twelve six what was put therein seven Then said Jesus Let her alone she has kept it twelve seven to the day of my preparation for burial eight For the poor ye have always with you but me ye have not always nine A great multitude of the Jews therefore knew that he was there And they came not because of Jesus only but that they might see Lazarus also whom he raised from the dead ten But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death eleven because by reason of him many of the Jews went away and believed on Jesus twelve On the morrow a great multitude that had come to the feast hearing that Jesus is coming to Jerusalem thirteen took branches of the palm trees and went forth to meet him and cried Hosanna blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord the King of Israel fourteen And Jesus having found a young ass sat thereon as it is written fifteen Fear not daughter of Zion Behold thy King comes Sitting on an ass s colt sixteen These things his disciples understood not at the first But when Jesus was glorified then they remembered that these things were written of him and that they did these things to him seventeen The multitude therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead bore witness eighteen For this the multitude also met him because they heard that he had wrought this sign nineteen The Pharisees therefore said among themselves Perceive ye that ye avail nothing Behold the world is gone after him twenty And there were certain Greeks of those who come up to worship at the feast twenty one These came therefore to Philip who was from Bethsaida of Galilee and desired him saying Sir we would see Jesus twenty two Philip comes and tells Andrew Andrew and Philip come and tell Jesus twenty three And Jesus answered them saying The hour has come that the Son of man should be glorified twenty four Verily verily I say to you except the grain of wheat fall into the ground and die it abides alone but if it die it brings forth much fruit twenty five He that loves his life shall lose it and he that hates his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal twenty six If any one serve me let him follow me and where I am there shall also my servant be If any one serve me him will the Father honor twenty seven Now is my soul troubled and what shall I say Father save me from this hour twelve twenty seven But for this cause came I unto this hour twenty eight Father glorify thy name Then there came a voice out of heaven I both have glorified it and will glorify it again twenty nine The multitude therefore that stood by and heard said that it thundered others said An angel has spoken to him thirty Jesus answered and said This voice came not for my sake but for your sakes thirty one Now is the judgment of this world now shall the prince of this world be cast out thirty two And I if I be lifted up from the earth will draw all men to me thirty three This he said signifying by what manner of death he should die thirty four The multitude answered him We heard out of the law that the Christ abides forever and how sayest thou The Son of man must be lifted up Who is this Son of man thirty five Jesus therefore said to them Yet a little while is the light among you Walk while ye have the light that darkness may not overtake you and he that walks in the darkness knows not whither he goes thirty six While ye have the light believe on the light that ye may become sons of light These things spoke Jesus and departed and hid himself from them thirty seven But though he had wrought so many signs before them they did not believe on him thirty eight that the saying of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled which he spoke Lord who believed our report And to whom was the arm of the Lord revealed thirty nine Therefore they could not believe because Isaiah said again forty He has blinded their eyes And has hardened their heart That they should not see with their eyes And understand with their heart And turn and I should heal them forty one These things said Isaiah because he saw his glory and spoke of him forty two Yet even of the rulers many believed on him but because of the Pharisees they did not acknowledge him lest they should be put out of the synagogue forty three for they loved the glory of men more than the glory of God forty four And Jesus cried and said He that believes on me believes not on me but on him who sent me forty five And he that beholds me beholds him who sent me forty six I have come a light into the world that whoever believes on me may not abide in the darkness forty seven And if any one hear my words and keep them not I do not judge him for I came not to judge the world but to save the world forty eight He that rejects me and receives not my words has one that judges him The word that I spokes that shall judge him in the last day forty nine Because I spoke not from myself but the Father who sent me he has given me a commandment what I should say and what I should speak fifty And I know that his commandment is everlasting life What things I speak therefore as the Father has said to me so I speak XIII AND before the feast of the passover Jesus knowing that his hour has come that he should depart out of this world to the Father having loved his own who were in the world loved them to the end two And supper being served the Devil having already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot Simon s son to betray him three knowing that the Father has given all things into his hands and that he came out from God and is going to God four he rises from the supper and lays aside his garments and taking a towel he girded himself five After that he pours water into the basin and began to wash the feet of his disciples and to wipe them with the towel with which he was girded six He comes therefore to Simon Peter and Peter says to him Lord dost thou wash my feet seven Jesus answered and said to him What I do thou knowest not now but thou shalt know hereafter eight Peter says to him Never shalt thou wash my feet Jesus answered him If I wash thee not thou hast no part with me nine Simon Peter says to him Lord not my feet only but also my hands and my head ten Jesus says to him He that has bathed has no need save to wash the feet but is wholly clean And ye are clean but not all eleven For he knew his betrayer therefore he said Ye are not all clean twelve When therefore he had washed their feet he took his garments and reclining again at table said to them Know ye what I have done to you thirteen Ye call me the Teacher and the Master and ye say well for so I am fourteen If I then the Master and the Teacher washed your feet ye also ought to wash one another s feet fifteen For I gave you an example that as I did to you ye also should do sixteen Verily verily I say to you a servant is not greater than his lord nor one that is sent thirteen sixteen greater than he who sent him seventeen If ye know these things happy are ye if ye do them eighteen I speak not of you all I know whom I chose but that the scripture might be fulfilled He that eats the loaf with me lifted up his heel against me nineteen Even now I tell you before it comes to pass that when it comes to pass ye may believe that I am he twenty Verily verily I say to you he that receives whomsoever I send receives me and he that receives me receives him who sent me twenty one Having said this Jesus was troubled in spirit and testified and said Verily verily I say to you that one of you will betray me twenty two The disciples therefore looked one on another doubting of whom he spoke twenty three And there was reclining in Jesus bosom one of his disciples whom Jesus loved twenty four To him therefore Simon Peter beckons and says to him Say who it is of whom he speaks twenty five And he leaning back on Jesus breast says to him Lord who is it twenty six Jesus answers He it is to whom I shall give the morsel when I have dipped it And having dipped the morsel he gives it to Judas Iscariot son of Simon twenty seven And after the morsel then entered Satan into him Jesus therefore says to him What thou doest do quickly twenty eight And no one at the table knew for what intent he spoke this to him twenty nine For some thought because Judas had the bag that Jesus said to him Buy what we need for the feast or that he should give something to the poor thirty He then having received the morsel went immediately out and it was night thirty one When therefore he was gone out Jesus says Now is the Son of man glorified and God is glorified in him thirty two If God is glorified in him God will also glorify him in himself and will straightway glorify him thirty three Children yet a little while I am with you Ye will seek me and as I said to the Jews whither I go ye can not come so now I say to you thirty four A new commandment I give to you that ye love one another as I loved you that ye also love one another thirty five By this shall all know that ye are my disciples if ye have love one toward another thirty six Simon Peter says to him Lord whither goest thou Jesus answered him Whither I go thou canst not follow me now but thou shalt follow me afterward thirty seven Peter says to him Lord why can not I follow thee now I will lay down my life for thee thirty eight Jesus answers Wilt thou lay down thy life for me Verily verily I say to thee a cock will not crow till thou hast denied me thrice XIV LET not your heart be troubled Believe on God and believe on me fourteen one two In my Father s house are many mansions if it were not so I would have told you because I go to prepare a place for you three And if I go and prepare a place for you I will come again and will receive you to myself that where I am ye may be also four And ye know the way whither I go five Thomas says to him Lord we know not whither thou goest and how do we and how sayest thou Show us the Father ten Believest thou not that I am in the Father and the Father in me The words that I speak to you I speak not of myself but the Father who dwells in me he does
