anything in my name I will do it fifteen If ye love me keep my commandments sixteen And I will ask of the Father and he will give you another Comforter that he may be with you forever seventeen the Spirit of truth whom the world can not receive because it sees him not neither knows him but ye know him because he abides with you and shall be in you eighteen I will not leave you bereaved fourteen eighteen I will come to you nineteen Yet a little while and the world sees me no more but ye see me because I live ye shall live also twenty In that day ye shall know that I am in my Father and ye in me and I in you twenty one He that has my commandments and keeps them he it is that loves me and he that loves me shall be loved by my Father and I will love him and will manifest myself to him twenty two Judas says to him not Iscariot Lord how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself to us and not to the world twenty three Jesus answered and said to him If any one loves me he will keep my word and my Father will love him and we will come to him and make our abode with him twenty four He that loves me not keeps not my words and the word which ye hear is not mine but the Father s who sent me twenty five These things have I spoken to you while abiding with you twenty six But the Comforter the Holy Spirit whom the Father will send in my name he will teach you all things and bring to your remembrance all things which I said to you twenty seven Peace I leave with you my peace I give to you not as the world gives give I to you Let not your heart be troubled neither let it be afraid twenty eight Ye heard how I said to you I go away and I come to you If ye loved me ye would have rejoiced that I go to the Father because the Father is greater than I twenty nine And now I have told you before it comes to pass that when it is come to pass ye may believe thirty I will no longer talk much with you for the prince of the world comes and in me he has nothing thirty one But that the world may know that I love the Father and as the Father gave me commandment so I do Arise let us go hence XV I AM the true vine and my Father is the husbandman two Every branch in me that bears not fruit he takes it away and every one that bears fruit he cleanses it that it may bear more fruit three Ye are already clean through the word which I have spoken to you four Abide in me and I in you As the branch can not bear fruit of itself if it abide not in the vine so neither can ye if ye abide not in me five I am the vine ye are the branches He that abides in me and I in him the same bears much fruit because without me ye can do nothing six If any one abide not in me he is cast forth as the branch and is withered and they gather them and cast them into the fire and they are burned seven If ye abide in me and my words abide in you ask whatever ye will and it shall be done to you eight Herein is my Father glorified that ye bear much fruit and ye shall become my disciples nine As the Father loved me I also loved you abide in my love ten If ye keep my commandments ye shall abide in my love as I have kept my Father s commandments and abide in his love eleven These things I have spoken to you that my joy may be in you and your joy be made full twelve This is my commandment that ye love one another as I loved you thirteen Greater love has no one than this that one lay down his life for his friends fourteen Ye are my friends if ye do whatever I command you fifteen No longer do I call you servants because the servant knows not what his lord does But I have called you friends because all things that I heard from my Father I made known to you sixteen Ye did not choose me but I chose you and appointed you that ye may go and bear fruit and that your fruit may remain that whatever ye shall ask of the Father in my name he may give it you seventeen These things I command you that ye love one another eighteen If the world hates you ye know that it has hated me before it hated you nineteen If ye were of the world the world would love its own but because ye are not of the world but I chose you out of the world for this the world hates you twenty Remember the word that I said to you A servant is not greater than his lord If they persecuted me they will also persecute you if they kept my saying they will keep yours also twenty one But all these things they will do to you for my name s sake because they know not him who sent me twenty two If I had not come and spoken to them they would not have sin but now they have no cloak for their sin twenty three He that hates me hates my Father also twenty four If I had not done among them the works which no other one has done they would not have sin but now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father twenty five But this comes to pass that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law They hated me without a cause twenty six But when the Comforter is come whom I will send to you from the Father the Spirit of truth which proceeds from the Father he will bear witness of me twenty seven And ye also shall bear witness because ye are with me from the beginning XVI THESE things I have spoken to you that ye should not be offended two They will put you out of the synagogues yea a time is coming that every one who kills you will think he makes an offering to God three And these things they will do to you because they have not known the Father nor me four But these things I have spoken to you that when the time shall come ye may remember that I told you And these things I told you not from the beginning because I was with you five And now I go to him who sent me and none of you asks me Whither goest thou six But because I have spoken these things to you sorrow has filled your heart seven But I tell you the truth it is expedient for you that I depart for if I depart not the Comforter will not come to you but if I go I will send him to you eight And when he is come he will convict the world in respect of sin and of righteousness and of judgment nine of sin in that they believe not on me ten of righteousness in that I go to my Father and ye behold me no more eleven of judgment in that the prince of this world has been judged twelve I have yet many things to say to you but ye can not bear them now thirteen But when he the Spirit of truth is come he will guide you into all the truth for he will not speak from himself but whatever he shall hear that will he speak and he will tell you the things to come fourteen He will glorify me because he will receive of mine and will tell it to you fifteen All things that the Father has are mine Therefore I said that he will receive of mine and will tell it to you sixteen A little while and ye behold me not and again a little while and ye shall see me seventeen Therefore some of his disciples said to one another What is this that he says to us A little while and ye behold me not and again a little while and ye shall see me and I go to the Father eighteen They said therefore What is this that he says A little while We know not what he says nineteen Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him and said to them Do ye inquire of this with one another that I said A little while and ye behold me not and again a little while and ye shall see me twenty Verily verily I say to you that ye will weep and lament but the world will rejoice and ye will be sorrowful but your sorrow shall be turned into joy twenty one A woman when she is in travail has sorrow because her hour is come but when she has borne the child she remembers no more the anguish for joy that a man is born into the world twenty two And so ye now have sorrow but I will see you again and your heart shall rejoice and your joy no one takes from you twenty three And in that day ye shall ask nothing of me Verily verily I say to you Whatever ye shall ask of the Father he will give it you in my name twenty four Hitherto ye asked nothing in my name Ask and ye shall receive that your joy may be made full twenty five These things I have spoken to you in parables A time is coming when I will no more speak to you in parables but I will tell you plainly of the Father twenty six In that day ye shall ask in my name And I say not to you that I will pray the Father for you twenty seven for the Father himself loves you because ye have loved me and have believed that I came forth from God twenty eight I came forth from the Father and have come into the world again I leave the world and go to the Father twenty nine His disciples say to him Lo now thou speakest plainly and speakest no parable thirty Now we know that thou knowest all things and needest not that any one should ask thee By this we believe that thou camest forth from God thirty one Jesus answered them Do ye now believe thirty two Behold an hour is coming and has come that ye will be scattered each one to his own and will leave me alone and I am not alone because the Father is with me thirty three These things I have spoken to you that in me ye may have peace In the world ye have tribulation but be of good cheer I have overcome the world XVII THESE words spoke Jesus and lifted up his eyes to heaven and said Father the hour has come glorify thy Son that thy Son may glorify thee two as thou gayest him authority over all flesh that as many as thou hast given to him to them he should give eternal life three And this is the eternal life that they know thee the only true God and Jesus Christ whom thou didst send four I glorified thee on the earth I finished the work which thou hast given me to do five And now O Father glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was six I manifested thy name to the men whom thou hast given me out of the world Thine they were and thou hast given them to me and they have kept thy word seven Now they know that all things whatever thou hast given me are from thee eight because the words which thou gayest me I have given to them and they received them and knew in truth that I came forth from thee and believed that thou didst send me nine I pray for them I pray not for the world but for those whom thou hast given me because they are thine ten And all things that are mine are thine and thine are mine and I am glorified in them eleven And I am no longer in the world and these are in the world and I come to thee Holy Father keep those in thy name whom thou hast given me that they may be one as we are twelve While I was with them I kept them in thy name Those whom thou hast given me I watched over and none of them perished except the son of perdition that the scripture might be fulfilled thirteen And now I come to thee and these things I speak in the world that they may have my joy made full in them fourteen I have given them thy word and the world hated them because they are not of the world as I am not of the world fifteen I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil sixteen They are not of the world as I am not of the world seventeen Sanctify them in the truth thy word is truth eighteen As thou didst send me into the world I also sent them into the world nineteen And for their sakes I sanctify myself that they also may be sanctified in the truth twenty And I pray not for these only but also for those who believe on me through their word twenty one that all may be one as thou Father in me and I in thee that they also may be in us that the world may believe that thou didst send me twenty two And the glory which thou hast given to me I have given to them that they may be one as we are one twenty three I in them and thou in me that they may be perfected into one that the world may know that thou didst send me and lovedst them as thou lovedst me twenty four Father those whom thou hast given me I will that where I am they also be with me that they may behold my glory which thou hast given me because thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world twenty five Righteous Father And the world knew thee not But I knew thee and these knew that thou didst send me twenty six and I made known to them thy name and will make it known that the love wherewith thou lovedst me may be in them and I in them XVIII HAVING spoken these words Jesus went out with his disciples beyond the brook Kedron where was a garden into which he entered and his disciples two And Judas also his betrayer knew the place because Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples three Judas therefore having received the band and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees comes thither with torches and lamps and weapons four Jesus therefore knowing all the things that were coming upon him went forth and said to them Whom do ye seek five They answered him Jesus the Nazarene Jesus says to them I am he And Judas also his betrayer was standing with them six When therefore he said to them I am he they went backward and fell to the ground seven Again therefore he asked them Whom do ye seek And they said Jesus the Nazarene eight Jesus answered I told you that I am he if therefore ye seek me let these go their way nine that the saying might be fulfilled which he spoke Of those whom thou hast given me I lost none ten Then Simon Peter having a sword drew it and smote the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear The servant s name was Malchus eleven Jesus therefore said to Peter Put up thy sword into the sheath The cup which my Father has given me shall I not drink it twelve So the band and the captain and the officers of the Jews took Jesus and bound him thirteen and led him away to Annas first for he was father in law of Caiaphas who was high priest that year fourteen And it was Caiaphas who counseled the Jews that it is expedient that one man should die for the people fifteen And Simon Peter and the other disciple followed Jesus That disciple was known to the high priest and went in with Jesus into the court of the high priest sixteen But Peter was standing at the door without Therefore the other disciple who was known to the high priest went out and spoke to her that kept the door and brought in Peter seventeen Then the damsel that kept the door says to Peter Art not thou also one of this man s disciples He says I am not eighteen And the servants and the officers were standing there having made a fire of coals because it was cold and were warming themselves and Peter was standing with them and warming himself nineteen The high priest therefore asked Jesus concerning his disciples and concerning his teaching twenty Jesus answered him I have spoken openly to the world I ever taught in the synagogue and in the temple where all the Jews assemble and I spoke nothing in secret twenty one Why askest thou me Ask those who have heard what I spoke to them Behold these know what things I said twenty two And when he had said this one of the officers who was standing by gave Jesus a blow on the face saying Answerest thou the high priest so twenty three Jesus answered him If I spoke evil bear witness of the evil but if well why dost thou smite me twenty four Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest twenty five And Simon Peter was standing and warming himself They said therefore to him Art thou also one of his disciples He denied and said I am not twenty six One of the servants of the high priest being a kinsman of him whose ear Peter cut off says Did not I see thee in the garden with him twenty seven Again therefore Peter denied and immediately a cock crowed twenty eight Then they lead Jesus from Caiaphas into the Governor s palace and it was early and they themselves went not into the palace that they might not be defiled but might eat the passover twenty nine Pilate therefore went out to them and said What accusation do ye bring against this man thirty They answered and said to him If this man were not a malefactor we would not have delivered him up to thee thirty one Pilate therefore said to them Do ye take him and judge him according to your law The Jews therefore said to him It is not lawful for us to put any one to death thirty two that the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled which he spoke signifying by what manner of death he should die thirty three Pilate therefore entered into the palace again and called Jesus and said to him Art thou the King of the Jews thirty four Jesus answered Dost thou say this of thyself or did others tell thee concerning me thirty five Pilate answered Am I a Jew Thine own nation and the chief priests delivered thee up to me What didst thou thirty six Jesus answered My kingdom is not of this world If my kingdom were of this world my servants would fight that I might not be delivered up to the Jews but now is my kingdom not from hence thirty seven Pilate therefore said to him Art thou a king then Jesus answered Thou sayest it because I am a king To this end have I been born and to this end have I come into the world that I may bear witness to the truth Every one that is of the truth hears my voice thirty eight Pilate says to him What is truth And having said this he went out again to the Jews and says to them I find no fault in him thirty nine But ye have a custom that I should release to you one at the passover Do ye desire therefore that I release to you the King of the Jews forty They all therefore cried out again saying Not this one but Barabbas Now Barabbas was a robber XIX THEN therefore Pilate took Jesus and scourged him two And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns and put it on his head and put on him a purple robe and they came to him three and said Hail King of the Jews And they gave him blows on the face four Pilate went forth again and says to them Behold I bring him forth to you that ye may know that I find no fault in him five Jesus therefore came forth wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe And he says to them Behold the man six When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw him they cried out saying Crucify him crucify him Pilate says to them Do ye take him and crucify him for I find no fault in him seven The Jews answered him We have a law and by our law he ought to die because he made himself the Son of God eight When therefore Pilate heard this saying he was the more afraid nine And he went again into the palace and says to Jesus Whence art thou But Jesus gave him no answer ten Then says Pilate to him Dost thou not speak to me Knowest thou not that I have power to release thee and have power to crucify thee eleven Jesus answered Thou wouldst have no power against me except it were given thee from above Therefore he that delivers me to thee has the greater sin twelve Thenceforth Pilate sought to release him But the Jews cried out saying If thou let this man go thou art not a friend of Caesar Whoever makes himself a king speaks against Caesar thirteen When therefore Pilate heard these words he brought Jesus forth and sat down on the judgment seat in a place called the Pavement and in Hebrew Gabbatha fourteen And it was the preparation of the passover and about the sixth hour And he says to the Jews Behold your king fifteen But they cried out Away with him away with him crucify him Pilate says to them Shall I crucify your king The chief priests answered We have no king but Caesar sixteen Then therefore he delivered him to them to be crucified And they took Jesus and led him away seventeen And bearing his cross he went forth into the place called Place of a skull which in Hebrew is called Golgotha eighteen where they crucified him and two others with him on either side one and Jesus in the midst nineteen And Pilate wrote also a title and put it on the cross And the writing was JESUS THE NAZARENE THE KING OF THE JEWS twenty This title therefore many of the Jews read because the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city and it was written in Hebrew and Greek and Latin twenty one Therefore said the chief priests of the Jews to Pilate Write not The King of the Jews but that he said I am King of the Jews twenty two Pilate answered What I have written I have written twenty three Then the soldiers when they crucified Jesus took his garments and made four parts to every soldier a part and also his coat And the coat was without a seam woven from the top throughout twenty four They said therefore to one another Let us not rend it but cast lots for it whose it shall be that the scripture might be fulfilled which says They parted my garments among them And for my vesture they cast lots These things the soldiers did twenty five And there were standing by the cross of Jesus his mother and his mother s sister Mary the wife of Clopas and Mary the Magdalene twenty six Jesus therefore seeing his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing by says to his mother Woman behold thy son twenty seven Then he says to the disciple Behold thy mother And from that hour the disciple took her to his own home twenty eight After this Jesus knowing that all things were now finished that the scripture might be accomplished says I thirst twenty nine Now there was set a vessel full of vinegar and they having filled a sponge with vinegar and put it on a hyssop stalk bore it to his mouth thirty When Jesus therefore received the vinegar he said It is finished and he bowed his head and gave up his spirit thirty one The Jews therefore since it was the preparation that the bodies might not remain upon the cross on the sabbath for that sabbath day was a great day besought Pilate that their legs might be broken and they be taken away thirty two The soldiers came therefore and broke the legs of the first and of the other who was crucified with him thirty three But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead they broke not his legs thirty four But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side and forthwith there came out blood and water thirty five And he that has seen has borne witness and his witness is true and he knows that he says what is true that ye also might believe thirty six For these things came to pass that the scripture might be fulfilled A bone of him shall not be broken thirty seven And again another scripture says They shall look on him whom they pierced thirty eight And after this Joseph from Arimathaea being a disciple of Jesus but secretly for fear of the Jews besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus and Pilate gave him leave He came therefore and took away the body of Jesus thirty nine And there came also Nicodemus who at the first came to Jesus by night bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes about a hundred pounds weight forty They took therefore the body of Jesus and wound it in linen cloths with the spices as is the custom of the Jews to prepare for burial forty one And in the place where he was crucified there was a garden and in the garden a new sepulchre wherein no one was yet laid forty two There they laid Jesus therefore on account of the preparation of the Jews because the sepulchre was nigh at hand XX AND on the first day of the week Mary the Magdalene comes early while it is yet dark to the sepulchre and sees the stone taken away out of the sepulchre two She runs therefore and comes to Simon Peter and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved and says to them They took away the Lord out of the sepulchre and we know not where they laid him three Peter therefore went forth and the other disciple and they went to the sepulchre four And the two ran together and the other disciple outran Peter and came first to the sepulchre five And stooping down he sees the linen cloths lying yet he went not in six Then comes Simon Peter following him and he went into the sepulchre and sees the linen cloths lying seven and the napkin that was about his head not lying with the linen cloths but wrapped together in a place by itself eight Then therefore the other disciple who came first to the sepulchre went in also and he saw and believed nine For not even yet did they know the scripture that he must rise from the dead ten The disciples therefore went away again to their own home eleven And Mary was standing by the sepulchre without weeping So as she wept she stooped clown into the sepulchre twelve and beholds two angels in white sitting the one at the head and the other at the feet where the body of Jesus lay thirteen And they say to her Woman why weepest thou She says to them Because they took away my Lord and I know not where they laid him fourteen Having said this she turned back and beholds Jesus standing and knew not that it was Jesus fifteen Jesus says to her Woman why weepest thou Whom dost thou seek She supposing that it was the gardener says to him Sir if thou didst bear him hence tell me where thou laidest him and I will take him away sixteen Jesus says to her Mary Turning she says to him in Hebrew Rabboni which is to say Teacher seventeen Jesus says to her Touch me not for I have not yet ascended to my Father but go to my brethren and say to them I ascend to my Father and your Father and my God and your God eighteen Mary the Magdalene comes bringing word to the disciples that she has seen the Lord and that he spoke these things to her nineteen When therefore it was evening on that day the first day of the week the doors having been shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews Jesus came and stood in the midst and he says to them Peace be to you twenty And having said this he showed them his hands and his side The disciples rejoiced therefore when they saw the Lord twenty one Jesus therefore said to them again Peace be to you As the Father has sent me I also send you twenty two And having said this he breathed on them and says to them Receive the Holy Spirit twenty three Whosesoever sins ye remit they are remitted to them and whosesoever ye retain they are retained twenty four But Thomas one of the twelve called Didymus was not with them when Jesus came twenty five The other disciples therefore said to him We have seen the Lord But he said to them Except I see in his hands the print of the nails and thrust my finger into the print of the nails and thrust my hand into his side I will not believe twenty six And after eight days again his disciples were within and Thomas with them Jesus comes the doors being shut and stood in the midst and said Peace be to you twenty seven After that he says to Thomas Reach hither thy finger and see my hands and reach thy hand and thrust it into my side and be not faithless but believing twenty eight Thomas answered and said to him My Lord and my God twenty nine Jesus says to him Because thou hast seen me thou hast believed Happy they who saw not and have believed thirty Many other signs also did Jesus in the presence of his disciples which are not written in this book thirty one But these are written that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ the Son of God and that believing ye may have life in his name XXI AFTER these things Jesus manifested himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias and he manifested himself in this manner two There were together Simon Peter and Thomas called Didymus and Nathanael from Cana of Galilee and the sons of Zebedee and two others of his disciples three Simon Peter says to them I go a fishing They say to him We also go with thee They went forth and entered into the ship and in that night they caught nothing four But when morning was now come Jesus stood on the beach yet the disciples knew not that it was Jesus five Jesus therefore says to them Children have ye anything to eat They answered him No six And he said to them Cast the net on the right side of the ship and ye shall find They cast it therefore and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of the fishes seven Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved says to Peter It is the Lord Simon Peter therefore hearing that it is the Lord girded on his outer garment for he was naked and cast himself into the sea eight And the other disciples came in the boat for they were not far from land but about two hundred cubits off dragging the net with the fishes nine When therefore they went out upon the land they see a fire of coals there and a fish lying thereon and bread ten Jesus says to them Bring of the fishes which ye just now caught eleven Simon Peter went on board and drew the net to land full of great fishes a hundred and fifty and three and though there were so many the net was not broken twelve Jesus says to them Come hither and break your fast And none of the disciples durst ask him Who art thou knowing that it is the Lord thirteen Jesus comes and takes the bread and gives to them and the fish likewise fourteen This the third time already Jesus manifested himself to his disciples after he was risen from the dead fifteen When therefore they had broken their fast Jesus says to Simon Peter Simon son of Jonah lovest thou me more than these He says to him Yea Lord thou knowest that I love thee He says to him Feed my lambs sixteen He says to him again a second time Simon son of Jonah lovest thou me He says to him Yea Lord thou knowest that I love thee He says to him Tend my sheep seventeen He says to him the third time Simon son of Jonah lovest thou me Peter was grieved because he said to him the third time Lovest thou me And he said to him Lord thou knowest all things thou knowest that I love thee Jesus says to him Feed my sheep eighteen Verily verily I say to thee when thou wast young thou didst gird thyself and walk whither thou wouldst but when thou shalt be old thou shalt stretch forth thy hands and another shall gird thee and lead thee whither thou wouldst not nineteen And this he spoke signifying by what manner of death he should glorify God And having spoken this he says to him Follow me twenty Peter turning about sees the disciple whom Jesus loved following who also at the supper leaned back on his breast and said Lord who is he that betrays thee twenty one Peter seeing him says to Jesus Lord and what shall this man do twenty two Jesus says to him If I will that he remain till I come what is it to thee Do thou follow me twenty three This saying therefore went abroad among the brethren that that disciple should not die And Jesus said not to him that he should not die but If I will that he tarry till I come what is it to thee twenty four This is the disciple who testifies of these things and wrote these things and we know that his testimony is true twenty five And there are also many other things which Jesus did and if they should be written every one I suppose that even the world itself would not contain the books that should be written THE ACTS OF THE APOSTLES I THE former narration I made O Theophilus concerning all things that Jesus began both to do and to teach two until the day when he was taken up after he had given commandment through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom he chose three to whom also he showed himself living after he had suffered by many infallible proofs during forty days appearing to them and speaking the things concerning the kingdom of God four And being assembled together with them he commanded them not to depart from Jerusalem but to wait for the promise of the Father which ye heard from me five for John indeed immersed in water but ye shall be immersed in the Holy Spirit not many days hence six They therefore having come together one six asked him saying Lord wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel seven And he said to them It is not yours to know times or seasons which the Father appointed by his own authority one seven eight But ye shall receive power when the Holy Spirit is come upon you and ye shall be my witnesses both in Jerusalem and in all Judaea and Samaria and unto the utmost part of the earth nine And having spoken these things while they beheld he was borne up and a cloud received him out of their sight ten And while they were looking intently into heaven as he went behold two men stood by them in white apparel eleven who also said Men of Galilee why stand ye looking into heaven This Jesus who was taken up from you into heaven shall so come in like manner as ye saw him going into heaven twelve Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet which is near Jerusalem a sabbath day s journey thirteen And when they came in they went up into the upper room where were abiding both Peter and James and John and Andrew Philip and Thomas Bartholomew and Matthew James the son of Alpheus and Simon Zelotes and Judas the brother of James fourteen These all continued with one accord in prayer with women and Mary the mother of Jesus and his brothers fifteen And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the brethren and said the number of names together was about a hundred and twenty sixteen Men brethren it was necessary that the scripture should be fulfilled which the Holy Spirit by the mouth of David spoke before concerning Judas who became guide to those who took Jesus seventeen Because he was numbered with us and obtained the office of this ministry eighteen Now this man purchased a field with the wages of iniquity and falling headlong he burst asunder in the midst and all his bowels gushed out nineteen And it became known to all who dwell at Jerusalem so that that field was called in their own tongue Aceldama that is Field of blood twenty For it is written in the book of Psalms Let his habitation be made desolate And let no one dwell therein And Let another take his office one twenty twenty one Therefore of these men who accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us twenty two beginning from John s immersion unto the day when he was taken up from us must one be made a witness with us of his resurrection twenty three And they appointed two Joseph called Barsabas who was surnamed Justus and Matthias twenty four And they prayed saying Thou Lord who knowest the hearts of all show which of these two thou didst choose twenty five that he may take part in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas by transgression fell away that he might go to his own place twenty six And they gave their lots one twenty six and the lot fell upon Matthias and he was numbered with the eleven apostles II AND when the day of Pentecost was fully come they were all with one accord in one place two And suddenly there came a sound out of heaven as of a rushing mighty wind and it filled all the house where they were sitting three And there appeared to them tongues as of fire distributed among them and it sat upon each of them four And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak with other tongues as the Spirit gave them utterance five Now there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews devout men from every nation under heaven six And this being noised abroad two six the multitude came together and were confounded because every man heard them speak in his own language seven And all were amazed and wondered saying one to another Behold are not all these who speak Galilaeans eight And how do we hear every man in our own tongue wherein we were born nine Parthians and Medes and Elamites and those who inhabit Mesopotamia Judaea and Cappadocia Pontus and Asia ten Phrygia and Pamphylia Egypt and the parts of Libya about Cyrene and strangers of Rome both Jews and proselytes eleven Cretes and Arabians hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of God twelve And all were amazed and were in doubt saying one to another What may this mean thirteen But others mocking said They are filled with sweet wine fourteen But Peter standing up with the eleven lifted up his voice and said to them Men of Judaea and all that dwell in Jerusalem be this known to you and hearken to my words fifteen For these are not drunken as ye suppose for it is the third hour of the day sixteen But this is what was spoken through the prophet Joel seventeen And it shall be in the last days saith God That I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh And your sons and your daughters shall prophesy And your young men shall see visions And your old men shall dream dreams eighteen And even on my servants and on my handmaids I will pour out of my Spirit in those days And they shall prophesy nineteen And I will show wonders in heaven above And signs in the earth beneath Blood and fire and vapor of smoke twenty The sun shall be turned into darkness And the moon into blood Before the great and notable day of the Lord shall come twenty one And it shall be that every one who shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved twenty two Men of Israel hear these words Jesus the Nazarene a man accredited to you from God by miracles and wonders and signs which God wrought by him in the midst of you as ye yourselves know twenty three this man delivered up according to the established counsel and foreknowledge of God ye slew crucifying him by the hand of lawless ones twenty four whom God raised up having loosed the pains of death because it was not possible that he should be held by it twenty five For David says concerning him I saw the Lord always before me Because he is on my right hand that I should not be moved twenty six For this my heart rejoiced and my tongue exulted Moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope twenty seven Because thou wilt not abandon my soul to the underworld Nor wilt thou suffer thy Holy One to see corruption twenty eight Thou didst make known to me the ways of life Thou wilt make me full of joy with thy presence twenty nine Men brethren I may speak freely to you of the patriarch David that he both died and was buried and his sepulchre is among us unto this day thirty Being a prophet therefore and knowing that God swore to him with an oath that of the fruit of his loins one should sit on his throne thirty one he foreseeing spoke of the resurrection of the Christ that neither was his soul abandoned to the underworld nor did his flesh see corruption thirty two This Jesus God raised up whereof we all are witnesses thirty three Being therefore exalted to the right hand of God and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit he poured forth this which ye now see and hear thirty four For David did not ascend into heaven but he says himself The Lord said to my Lord Sit on my right hand thirty five Until I make thy foes thy footstool thirty six Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly that God made him this Jesus whom ye crucified both Lord and Christ thirty seven And hearing this they were pierced to the heart and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles Men brethren what shall we do thirty eight And Peter said to them Repent and be each of you immersed upon the name of Jesus Christ unto remission of sins and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Spirit thirty nine For the promise is to you and to your children and to all those afar off as many as the Lord our God shall have called forty And with many other words did he bear witness and exhort saying Save yourselves from this perverse generation forty one They therefore having received two forty one his word were immersed and on that day there were added about three thousand souls forty two And they were constantly attending on the teaching of the apostles and the distribution and the breaking of bread and prayers forty three And fear came upon every soul and many wonders and signs were wrought through the apostles forty four And all that believed were together and had all things common forty five and sold their possessions and goods and divided them among all as any one had need forty six And daily attending with one accord in the temple and breaking bread from house to house they partook of food with gladness and singleness of heart forty seven praising God and having favor with all the people And the Lord added to the church daily those who are saved two forty seven III AND Peter and John were going up together into the temple at the hour of prayer being the ninth hour two And a certain man lame from his mother s womb was carried along whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple the one called Beautiful to ask alms of those entering into the temple three who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked alms four And Peter looking intently upon him with John said Look upon us five And he gave heed to them expecting to receive something from them six And Peter said Silver and gold have I none but what I have that I give thee In the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene rise up and walk seven And seizing him by the right hand he raised him up And immediately his feet and ankles received strength eight and leaping forth he stood and walked and entered with them into the temple walking and leaping and praising God nine And all the people saw him walking and praising God ten and they recognized him that this was he who sat for alms at the beautiful gate of the temple and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened to him eleven And as he held fast to Peter and John all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon s greatly wondering twelve And Peter seeing it answered to the people Men of Israel why wonder ye at this Or why look ye so intently on us as though by our own power or godliness we had made this man to walk thirteen The God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob the God of our fathers glorified his servant Jesus whom ye delivered up and denied him in the presence of Pilate when he decided to release him fourteen But ye denied the Holy and Just and demanded that a murderer should be granted to you fifteen But the Author of life ye killed whom God raised from the dead whereof we are witnesses three fifteen sixteen And his name upon the faith in his name made this man strong whom ye see and know and the faith which is through Him gave him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all seventeen And now brethren I know that ye acted in ignorance as also your rulers eighteen But thus God fulfilled what he before announced by the mouth of all his prophets that the Christ should suffer nineteen Repent therefore and turn that your sins may be blotted out in order that the times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord twenty and that he may send forth Jesus Christ before appointed for you twenty one whom the heavens indeed must receive until the times of the restoration of all things which God spoke of by the mouth of all his holy prophets from the beginning twenty two Moses said A Prophet will the Lord your God raise up to you of your brethren like unto me him shall ye hear in all things whatever he shall say to you twenty three And it shall be that every soul that will not hear that Prophet shall be utterly destroyed from among the people twenty four And also all the prophets from Samuel both he and they who followed as many as spoke also foretold these days twenty five Ye are sons of the prophets and of the covenant which God made with our fathers saying to Abraham And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed twenty six Unto you first God having raised up his servant Jesus sent him to bless you in turning away every one of you from your iniquities IV AND while they were speaking to the people the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came upon them two being indignant because they taught the people and announced in Jesus the resurrection from the dead three And they laid hands on them and put them in prison unto the morrow for it was now evening four But many of those who heard the word believed and the number of the men became about five thousand five And it came to pass on the morrow that their rulers and elders and scribes six and Annas the high priest and Caiaphas and John and Alexander and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest were gathered together unto Jerusalem seven And having set them in the midst they asked By what power or by what name did ye do this eight Then Peter filled with the Holy Spirit said to them Rulers of the people and elders of Israel nine if we are this day examined in respect to a good deed done to an impotent man by what means this person has been made whole ten be it known to you all and to all the people of Israel that by the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene whom ye crucified whom God raised from the dead by him does this man stand here before you whole eleven He is the stone that was set at naught by you the builders which is become the head of the corner twelve And there is salvation in no other for neither is there any other name under heaven that is given among men in which we must be saved thirteen And seeing the boldness of Peter and John and perceiving that they were unlearned and obscure men they wondered and they recognized them that they were with Jesus fourteen And beholding the man who had been healed standing with them they had nothing to say against it fifteen But having commanded them to go aside out of the council they conferred among themselves sixteen saying What shall we do to these men For that a notorious miracle has been done by them is manifest to all that dwell in Jerusalem and we are not able to deny it seventeen But that it spread no further among the people let us strictly threaten them that they speak henceforth to no man in this name eighteen And having called them they commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus nineteen But Peter and John answering said to them Whether it is right in the sight of God to hearken to you rather than to God judge ye twenty For we can not but speak the things which we saw and heard twenty one And they having further threatened them let them go finding no way to punish them on account of the people because all glorified God for that which was done twenty two for the man was above forty years old on whom this sign of the healing had been wrought twenty three And being dismissed they went to their own company and reported all that the chief priests and elders said to them twenty four And they hearing it lifted up their voice to God with one accord and said Lord thou art he who made heaven and earth and the sea and all things in them twenty five who by the mouth of thy servant David said Why did the heathen rage four twenty five And the peoples imagine vain things twenty six The kings of the earth stood near And the rulers assembled together Against the Lord and against his Christ twenty seven For in truth there assembled in this city against thy holy servant Jesus whom thou didst anoint both Herod and Pontius Pilate with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel twenty eight to do whatever thy hand and thy counsel before determined to be done twenty nine And now Lord behold their threatenings and grant to thy servants that with all boldness they may speak thy word thirty by stretching forth thy hand for healing and that signs and wonders may be wrought through the name of thy holy servant Jesus thirty one And when they had prayed the place was shaken where they were assembled and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and they spoke the word of God with boldness thirty two And the multitude of those who believed were of one heart and of one soul and not one said that aught of the things which he possessed was his own but they had all things common thirty three And with great power the apostles gave the testimony to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus and great grace was upon them all thirty four For there was no one among them that lacked for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them and brought the prices of the things sold thirty five and laid them at the feet of the apostles and distribution was made to each one according as he had need thirty six And Joseph who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas which is interpreted Son of consolation a Levite born in Cyprus thirty seven having land sold it and brought the money and laid it at the feet of the apostles V BUT a certain man named Ananias with Sapphira his wife sold a possession two and kept back part of the price his wife also being aware of it and brought a certain part and laid it at the feet of the apostles three But Peter said Ananias why did Satan fill thy heart that thou shouldst lie to the Holy Spirit and keep back part of the price of the land four While it remained was it not thine own And after it was sold was it not in thine own power Why didst thou conceive this thing in thy heart Thou didst not lie to men but to God five And Ananias hearing these words fell down and expired and great fear came on all that heard these things six And the young men arose wrapt him up and carried him out five six and buried him seven And it was about the space of three hours after when his wife not knowing what was done came in eight And Peter answered her Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much And she said Yes for so much nine And Peter said to her Why is it that ye agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord Behold the feet of those who buried thy husband are at the door and shall carry thee out ten And immediately she fell at his feet and expired and coming in the young men found her dead and carried her forth and buried her by her husband eleven And great fear came upon all the church and upon all that heard these things twelve And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people and they were all with one accord in Solomon s porch thirteen But of the rest no one dared to join himself to them but the people honored them fourteen and still more were believers added to the Lord multitudes both of men and women fifteen so that along the streets they brought forth the sick and laid them on beds and pallets that as Peter was passing the shadow at least might overshadow some one of them sixteen And the multitude also of the cities around came together to Jerusalem bringing sick persons and those who were vexed by unclean spirits and they were all healed seventeen But the high priest rose up and all that were with him which is the sect of the Sadducees and were filled with indignation eighteen and laid their hands on the apostles and put them in the public prison nineteen But an angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors and having brought them forth he said twenty Go stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life twenty one And hearing it they went into the temple at early dawn and taught And the high priest came and they that were with him and called the council together and all the eldership of the children of Israel and sent to the prison to have them brought twenty two But the officers when they came found them not in the prison and returning they reported twenty three saying The prison indeed we found shut with all security and the keepers standing without before the doors but when we opened them we found no one within twenty four And when the priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things they were at a loss concerning them to what this might grow twenty five But one came and told them saying Behold the men whom ye put in the prison are in the temple standing and teaching the people twenty six Then went the captain with the officers and brought them not with violence for they feared the people that they might not be stoned twenty seven And having brought them they set them before the council And the high priest asked them twenty eight saying Did we not strictly command you not to teach in this name And behold ye have filled Jerusalem with your teaching and intend to bring this man s blood upon us twenty nine And Peter answering and the apostles said We ought to obey God rather than men thirty The God of our fathers raised up Jesus whom ye slew hanging him on a tree thirty one Him as a prince and a Savior did God exalt to his right hand to give repentance to Israel and remission of sins thirty two And we are his witnesses of these things and the Holy Spirit also which God gave to those who obey him thirty three And they hearing it were convulsed with rage and took counsel to slay them thirty four But there stood up one in the council a Pharisee named Gamaliel a teacher of the law honored by all the people and commanded to put the men forth a little while thirty five and said to them Men of Israel take heed to yourselves what ye are about to do in respect to these men thirty six For before these days arose Theudas boasting himself to be somebody to whom a number of men about four hundred joined themselves who was slain and all as many as obeyed him were scattered and brought to naught thirty seven After this man arose Judas the Galilaean in the days of the registering and drew away much people after him he also perished and all as many as obeyed him were dispersed thirty eight And now I say to you refrain from these men and let them alone for if this counsel or this work be of men it will come to naught thirty nine but if it is of God ye can not overthrow them lest haply ye be found also fighting against God forty And to him they assented and having called the apostles they scourged them and commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus and let them go forty one They therefore went rejoicing from the presence of the council because for that name they were counted worthy to suffer shame forty two And every day in the temple and from house to house they ceased not to teach and to publish the glad tidings of Jesus the Christ VI AND in these days when the number of the disciples was multiplied there arose a murmuring of the Grecian Jews against the Hebrews because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration two And the twelve called the multitude of the disciples to them and said It is not proper that we should leave the word of God and serve tables three Therefore brethren look ye out among you seven men of good repute full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom whom we will appoint over this business four But we will give ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word five And the saying pleased the whole multitude And they chose Stephen a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit and Philip and Prochorus and Nicanor and Timon and Parmenas and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch six whom they set before the apostles and having prayed they laid their hands on them seven And the word of God increased and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith eight And Stephen full of grace and of power did great wonders and signs among the people nine And there arose certain ones of the synagogue so called of the Freedmen six nine and Cyrenians and Alexandrians and of those from Cilicia and Asia disputing with Stephen ten And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit with which he spoke eleven Then they suborned men who said We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and against God twelve And they stirred up the people and the elders and the scribes and coming upon him they seized him and brought him to the council thirteen and set up false witnesses Who said This man ceases not to speak words against this holy place and the law fourteen For we have heard him say that this Jesus the Nazarene will destroy this place and will change the customs which Moses delivered to us fifteen And all that sat in the council looking intently upon him saw his face as the face of an angel VII AND the high priest said Are then these things so two And he said Brethren and fathers hearken The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia before he dwelt in Haran three and said to him Go forth from thy country and from thy kindred and come into the land which I shall show thee four Then he went forth from the land of the Chaldaeans and dwelt in Haran and from thence after his father was dead he caused him to remove into this land wherein ye now dwell five And he gave him no inheritance in it not even a foot breadth and he promised to give it to him for a possession and to his seed after him when he had no child six And God spoke after this manner that his seed shall be a sojourner in a strange land and they will bring them into bondage and afflict them four hundred years seven And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage I will judge said God and after that they shall come forth and shall serve me in this place eight And he gave him the covenant of circumcision and thus he begot Isaac and circumcised him the eighth day and Isaac Jacob and Jacob the twelve patriarchs nine And the patriarchs moved with envy sold Joseph into Egypt And God was with him ten and delivered him out of all his afflictions and gave him favor and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house eleven And there came a famine over all the land of Egypt and Canaan and a great affliction and our fathers found no sustenance twelve But Jacob hearing that there was grain in Egypt first sent out our fathers thirteen And at the second time Joseph was recognized by his brothers and the race of Joseph was made known to Pharaoh fourteen Then Joseph sent and called for Jacob his father and all his kindred threescore and fifteen souls fifteen And Jacob went down into Egypt and died he and our fathers sixteen and were removed to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem seventeen But as the time of the promise drew near which God declared to Abraham the people grew and multiplied in Egypt eighteen until another king arose who knew not Joseph nineteen He dealing subtly with our race afflicted our fathers so that they should cast out their infants that they might not be preserved alive twenty In which time Moses was born and was exceeding fair seven twenty who was nourished three months in his father s house twenty one And when he was cast out Pharaoh s daughter took him up and nourished him for herself as a son twenty two And Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was mighty in words and in deeds twenty three And when he was forty years old it came into his heart to visit his brethren the sons of Israel twenty four And seeing one of them suffer wrong he defended him and avenged the one oppressed by smiting the Egyptian twenty five For he supposed his brethren would understand that God by his hand would deliver them but they understood not twenty six And on the following day he showed himself to them as they were contending and urged them to peace saying Ye are brethren why wrong ye one another twenty seven But he who was wronging his neighbor thrust him away saying Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us twenty eight Wilt thou kill me as thou didst kill the Egyptian yesterday twenty nine And Moses fled at this saying and became a sojourner in the land of Midian where he begot two sons thirty And when forty years were completed there appeared to him in the wilderness of the mount Sinai an angel in a flame of fire in a bush thirty one And Moses seeing it wondered at the sight and as he drew near to behold it the voice of the Lord came to him saving thirty two I am the God of thy fathers the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob And Moses trembled and durst not behold thirty three And the Lord said to him Loose the sandals from thy feet for the place where thou standest is holy ground thirty four Truly I saw the affliction of my people in Egypt and I heard their groaning and came down to deliver them And now come I will send thee into Egypt thirty five This Moses whom they denied saying Who made thee a ruler and a judge him did God send as a ruler and a redeemer by the hand seven thirty five of the angel who appeared to Sinai and with our fathers who received the living oracles to give to us thirty nine to whom our fathers would not be obedient but thrust him from them and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt forty saying to Aaron Make us gods who shall go before us for as for this Moses who brought us out of the land of Egypt we know not what is become of him forty one And they made a calf in those days and offered sacrifice to the idol and rejoiced in the works of their own hands forty two And God turned away and gave them up to worship the host of heaven as it is written in the book of the prophets Did ye offer to me slain beasts and sacrifices Forty years in the wilderness O house of Israel forty three And ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch And the star of the god Remphan The figures which ye made to worship them And I will carry you away beyond Babylon forty four Our fathers had the tabernacle of the testimony in the wilderness as he who spoke to Moses commanded that he should make it according to the pattern that he had seen forty five which also our fathers received and brought in with Joshua into the possession of the heathen whom God drove out before our fathers unto the days of David forty six who found favor before God and asked that he might find a habitation for the God of Jacob forty seven But Solomon built a house for him forty eight Yet the Most High dwells not in temples made with hands as says the prophet forty nine Heaven is my throne And the earth is my footstool What house will ye build for me saith the Lord Or what is my place of rest fifty Did not my hand make all these things fifty one Stiff necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears Ye always resist the Holy Spirit as your fathers did so do ye fifty two Which of the prophets did not your fathers persecute And they slew those who announced beforehand concerning the coming of the Just One of whom ye have now become the betrayers and murderers fifty three who received the law as the ordinances of angels and kept it not fifty four Hearing these things they were enraged in their hearts and gnashed their teeth against him fifty five But being full of the Holy Spirit he looked intently into heaven and saw the glory of God and Jesus standing on the right hand of God and said fifty six Behold I see the heavens opened and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God fifty seven And crying out with a loud voice they stopped their ears and rushed upon him with one accord fifty eight and having cast him out of the city they stoned him And the witnesses laid off their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul fifty nine and stoned Stephen calling and saying Lord Jesus receive my spirit sixty And kneeling down he cried with a loud voice Lord lay not this sin to their charge And saying this he fell asleep VIII AND Saul was consenting to his death And on that day there arose a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem and all were scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria except the apostles two And devout men carried Stephen to his burial and made great lamentation over him three But Saul laid waste the church entering house after house and dragging both men and women committed them to prison four They therefore that were scattered went abroad preaching the word five And Philip went down to the city eight five of Samaria and preached to them the Christ six And the multitudes with one accord gave heed to the things said by Philip when they heard and saw the signs which he wrought seven For out of many who had unclean spirits they went forth crying with loud voice and many that were palsied and that were lame were healed eight And there was great joy in that city nine But a certain man named Simon was in the city before using sorcery and bewitching the people of Samaria saying that he was some great one ten to whom all gave heed from the least to the greatest saying This man is the great power of God eight ten eleven And to him they gave heed because for a long time they were bewitched by his sorceries twelve But when they believed Philip publishing the good news concerning the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ they were immersed both men and women thirteen And Simon also himself believed and having been immersed he continued with Philip and wondered beholding the miracles and signs which were wrought fourteen And the apostles in Jerusalem hearing that Samaria has received the word of God sent to them Peter and John fifteen who having come down prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit sixteen for he had not yet fallen upon any of them but they had only been immersed in the name of the Lord Jesus seventeen Then they laid their hands on them and they received the Holy Spirit eighteen And Simon seeing that through the laying on of the apostles hands the Holy Spirit was given offered them money nineteen saying Give me also this power that on whomsoever I lay hands he may receive the Holy Spirit twenty But Peter said to him Thy money perish with thee because thou didst think to obtain the gift of God with money twenty one Thou hast no part nor lot in this matter eight twenty one for thy heart is not right in the sight of God twenty two Repent therefore of this thy wickedness and pray the Lord if perhaps the thought of thy heart shall be forgiven thee twenty three For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness and the bond of iniquity twenty four And Simon answering said Pray ye to the Lord for me that none of the things which ye have spoken come upon me twenty five They therefore having testified and spoken the word of the Lord were returning to Jerusalem and publishing the good news to many villages of the Samaritans twenty six But an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip saying Arise and go down to the south to the way that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza This is desert twenty seven And he arose and went And behold a man of Ethiopia a eunuch an officer of state of Candace queen of the Ethiopians who was over all her treasure and had come to Jerusalem to worship twenty eight was returning and sitting in his chariot and he was reading the prophet Isaiah twenty nine And the Spirit said to Philip Go near and join thyself to this chariot thirty And Philip ran thither and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet And he said Understandest thou then what thou art reading thirty one And he said How could I except some one should guide me And he entreated Philip to come up and sit with him thirty two And the contents of the Scripture which he was reading was this He was led as a sheep to the slaughter And as a lamb dumb before his shearer So he opens not his mouth thirty three In his humiliation his judgment was taken away And his generation eight thirty three who shall fully declare For his life is taken away from the earth thirty four And the eunuch answering said to Philip I pray thee of whom does the prophet speak this Of himself or of some other man thirty five And Philip opened his mouth and beginning from this Scripture made known to him the good news of Jesus thirty six And as they went along the way they came to a certain water And the eunuch said See here is water what hinders that I should be immersed thirty seven eight thirty seven And Philip said If thou believest with all thy heart thou mayest And answering he said I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God thirty eight And he commanded that the chariot should stop And they went down both into the water both Philip and the eunuch and he immersed him thirty nine And when they came up out of the water the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip and the eunuch saw him no more for he went on his way rejoicing forty But Philip was found at Azotus and passing through he published the good news to all the cities till he came to Caesarea IX BUT Saul yet breathing threatening and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord went to the high priest two and asked of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues that if he found any of this way whether they were men or women he might bring them bound to Jerusalem three And as he journeyed he came near Damascus And suddenly there flashed around him a light from heaven four and he fell to the earth and heard a voice saying to him Saul Saul why persecutest thou me five And he said Who art thou Lord And the Lord said I am Jesus whom thou persecutest six But arise and go into the city and it shall be told thee what thou must do seven And the men who journeyed with him were standing speechless hearing the voice but seeing no one eight And Saul arose from the earth and his eyes being opened he saw nothing and leading him by the hand they brought him into Damascus nine And he was three days without sight and neither ate nor drank ten And there was a certain disciple at Damascus named Ananias and to him the Lord said in a vision Ananias And he said Behold I am here Lord eleven And the Lord said to him Arise and go into the street which is called Straight and inquire in the house of Judas for one called Saul of Tarsus For behold he prays twelve and in a vision he saw a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hand on him that he might receive sight thirteen And Ananias answered Lord I have heard from many concerning this man how great evils he did to thy saints at Jerusalem fourteen And here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name fifteen But the Lord said to him Go for he is to me a chosen vessel to bear my name before Gentiles and kings and the sons of Israel sixteen for I will show him how great things he must suffer for my name s sake seventeen And Ananias went and entered into the house and putting his hands on him he said Brother Saul the Lord has sent me Jesus who appeared to thee in the way thou camest that thou mayest receive sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit eighteen And immediately there fell off from his eyes as it were scales and he received sight and arose and was immersed nineteen and having taken food he was strengthened And Saul was certain days with the disciples at Damascus twenty And straightway he preached Jesus in the synagogues that he is the Son of God twenty one And all that heard him were amazed and said Is not this he who destroyed in Jerusalem those who call on this name And he came hither for this purpose that he might bring them bound to the chief priests twenty two But Saul was more strengthened and confounded the Jews who dwelt at Damascus proving that this is the Christ twenty three And when many days were completed the Jews took counsel to kill him twenty four But their lying in wait became known to Saul And they were watching the gates day and night to kill him twenty five But the disciples took him by night and let him down through the wall lowering him in a basket twenty six And Saul having come to Jerusalem attempted to join himself to the disciples and all were afraid of him not believing that he was a disciple twenty seven But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles and related fully to them how he saw the Lord in the way and that he spoke to him and how he preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus twenty eight And he was with them going in and out at Jerusalem twenty nine and speaking boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus and was speaking and disputing against the Grecian Jews but they were attempting to slay him thirty And the brethren learning it brought him down to Caesarea and sent him forth to Tarsus thirty one The church therefore throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria had peace being built up and walking in the fear of the Lord and in the consolation of the Holy Spirit was multiplied thirty two And it came to pass that Peter going through them all came down also to the saints who dwelt at Lydda thirty three And there he found a certain man named Aeneas who had lain upon a pallet eight years who was palsied thirty four And Peter said to him Aeneas Jesus the Christ makes thee whole arise and make thy bed And immediately he arose thirty five And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him and they turned to the Lord thirty six And there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha which interpreted is called Dorcas This woman was full of good works and of alms which she did thirty seven And it came to pass in those days that she was sick and died And having washed her they laid her in an upper chamber thirty eight And as Lydda was near to Joppa the disciples having heard that Peter was there sent to him two men entreating that he would not delay to come to them thirty nine And Peter arose and went with them When he was come they brought him into the upper chamber and all the widows stood by him weeping and showing coats and garments which Dorcas made while she was with them forty But Peter put them all forth and kneeled down and prayed and turning to the body he said Tabitha arise And she opened her eyes and seeing Peter she sat up forty one And he gave her his hand and raised her up and calling the saints and widows he presented her alive forty two And it became known throughout all Joppa and many believed on the Lord forty three And it came to pass that he remained many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner X THERE was a certain man in Caesarea named Cornelius a centurion of the band called the Italian band two devout and one that feared God with all his house giving many alms to the people and praying to God always three He saw in a vision distinctly about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him and saying to him Cornelius four And fixing his eyes on him he was afraid and said What is it Lord And he said to him Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God five And now send men to Joppa and call for Simon who is surnamed Peter six He lodges with one Simon a tanner whose house is by the seaside seven And when the angel who spoke to Cornelius was gone he called two of his household servants and a devout soldier of those who waited on him eight and having told them all these things he sent them to Joppa nine On the morrow as they were journeying and drawing near to the city Peter went up upon the house top to pray about the sixth hour ten And he became very hungry and desired to eat While they now were making ready there fell upon him a trance eleven and he beholds heaven opened and a certain vessel descending upon him as a great sheet bound by four corners and let down upon the earth twelve wherein were all the fourfooted beasts and creeping things of the earth and birds of the air thirteen And there came a voice to him Arise Peter slay and eat fourteen But Peter said Not so Lord for I never ate anything common or unclean fifteen And a voice came to him again the second time What God cleansed call not thou common sixteen This was done thrice and the vessel was taken up again into heaven seventeen And while Peter was doubting in himself what the vision might be which he saw behold the men who were sent from Cornelius having made inquiry for Simon s house came and stood before the gate eighteen and calling they asked whether Simon who is surnamed Peter lodges here nineteen While Peter was earnestly considering the vision the Spirit said to him Behold men are seeking thee twenty But arise and go down and go with them making no scruple because I have sent them twenty one Peter went down to the men and said Behold I am he whom ye seek What is the cause for thee to his house and to hear words from thee twenty three He called them in therefore and lodged them And on the morrow Peter went forth with them and certain brethren from Joppa went with him twenty four And on the morrow after they entered into Caesarea And Cornelius was expecting them having called together his kinsmen and near friends twenty five And as Peter was coming in Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and did reverence to him twenty six But Peter raised him saying Stand up I myself also am a man twenty seven And while talking with him he went in and found many that were hour and at the ninth hour was praying in my house and behold a man stood before me in bright clothing thirty one and said Cornelius thy prayer was heard and thine alms were remembered before God seven Can any one forbid the water that these should not be immersed who received the Holy Spirit even as we also forty eight And he commanded that they should be immersed in the name of the Lord Then five I was in the city of Joppa praying and in a trance I saw a vision a certain vessel descending as a great sheet let down out of heaven by four corners and it came even to me six On which fixing my Claudius Caesar twenty nine And the disciples according as any one was prospered determined each of them to send relief to the brethren dwelling in Judaea thirty which also they did sending it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul XII AND about that time Herod the king stretched forth his hands to oppress twelve one certain of the church two And he slew James the brother of John with the sword three And seeing that it pleased the Jews he proceeded further to take Peter also then were the days of unleavened bread four whom he also seized and put in prison delivering him to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him intending after the passover to bring him forth to the people five Peter therefore was kept guarded in the prison but earnest prayer was made by the church to God on his behalf six And when Herod was about to bring him forth in that night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers bound with two chains and keepers before the door were guarding the prison seven And behold an angel of the Lord stood by him and a light shined in the prison and he smote Peter on the side and raised him saying Rise up quickly And his chains fell from off his hands eight And the angel said to him Gird thyself and bind on thy sandals and he did so And he said to him Cast thy garment about thee and follow me nine And he went out and followed him and knew not that what was done by the angel was true but thought he saw a vision ten And having passed the first and the second watch they came to the iron gate that leads into the city which opened to them of its own accord and they went out and passed on through one street and immediately the angel departed from him eleven And Peter having come to himself said Now I know truly that the Lord sent forth his angel and delivered me out of the hand of Herod and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews twelve And becoming fully conscious of it he went to the house of Mary the mother of John who was surnamed Mark where many were gathered together and praying thirteen And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate a maidservant came to hearken named Rhoda fourteen And recognizing Peter s voice she opened not the gate for gladness but ran in and told that Peter was standing before the gate fifteen And they said to her Thou art mad But she confidently affirmed that it was even so And they said It is his angel sixteen But Peter continued knocking and opening the door they saw him and were amazed seventeen And beckoning to them with the hand to be silent he related to them how the Lord brought him out of the prison And he said Go tell these things to James and to the brethren And he departed and went to another place eighteen And when it was day there was no small commotion among the soldiers as to what was become of Peter nineteen And Herod when he had sought for him and found him not after examining the keepers commanded that they should be led away to death And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea and there abode twenty And Herod was highly displeased with the Tyrians and Sidonians But they came with one accord to him and having made Blastus the king s chamberlain their friend desired peace because their country was nourished by that of the king twenty one And on a set day Herod arrayed in royal apparel sat upon his throne and made a speech to them twenty two And thereupon the
