in his own order Christ the first fruits afterward they who are Christ s at his coming twenty four Then comes the end when he delivers up the kingdom to God the Father when he shall have done away all rule and all authority and power twenty five For he must reign till he has put all enemies under his feet twenty six As the last enemy Death shall be done away For he subjected all things under his feet twenty seven But when he says All things are subjected it is manifest that he is excepted who subjected all things to him twenty eight And when all things shall be subjected to him then will also the Son himself be subject to him who subjected all things to him that God may be all in all twenty nine Else what shall they do who are immersed for the dead If the dead rise not at all why are they then immersed for them thirty Why also are we in peril every hour thirty one I protest by my glorying in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord I die daily thirty two If after the manner of men I fought with wild beasts at Ephesus what is the profit to me if the dead rise not Let us eat and drink For to morrow we die thirty three Be not deceived evil communications corrupt good manners thirty four Awake to righteousness and sin not for some have not the knowledge of God I say it to your shame thirty five But some one will say How do the dead rise And with what kind of body do they come thirty six Thou fool that which thou sowest is not quickened except it die thirty seven and what thou sowest not the body that shall be sowest thou but bare grain perchance of wheat or of some other grain thirty eight But God gives it a body as it pleased him and to each of the seeds its own body thirty nine All flesh is not the same flesh but there is one flesh of men another flesh of beasts another of fishes another of birds forty There are also heavenly bodies and earthly bodies but the glory of the heavenly is one and that of the earthly is another forty one There is one glory of the sun and another glory of the moon and another glory of the stars for star differs from star in glory forty two So also is the resurrection of the dead It is sown in corruption it rises in incorruption forty three It is sown in dishonor it rises in glory It is sown in weakness it rises in power forty four It is sown a natural body it rises a spiritual body If there is a natural body there is also a spiritual forty five So also it is written The first man Adam was made a living soul the last Adam a life giving spirit forty six But the spiritual is not first but the natural and afterward the spiritual forty seven The first man was of the earth earthy the second man is from heaven forty eight As was the earthy such are they also that are earthy and as is the heavenly such are they also that are heavenly forty nine And as we bore the image of the earthy we shall also bear the image of the heavenly fifty And this I say brethren that flesh and blood can not inherit the kingdom of God nor does corruption inherit incorruption fifty one Behold I tell you a mystery We shall not all sleep but we shall all be changed fifty two in a moment in the twinkling of an eye at the last trump for the trumpet will sound and the dead will be raised incorruptible and we shall be changed fifty three For this corruptible must put on incorruption and this mortal must put on immortality fifty four And when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption and this mortal shall have put on immortality then will be brought to pass the saying that is written Death is swallowed up in victory fifty five Where O death is thy sting Where O death is thy victory fifty six The sting of death is sin and the strength of sin is the law fifty seven But thanks be to God who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ fifty eight Therefore my beloved brethren be steadfast immovable always abounding in the work of the Lord knowing that your labor is not in vain in the Lord XVI NOW concerning the collection for the saints as I gave order to the churches of Galatia so also do ye two On each first day of the week let every one of you lay by him in store according as he is prospered that there may be no collections when I come three And when I come whomsoever ye shall approve them I will send with letters to carry your benefaction to Jerusalem four And if it be worthy of my going also they shall go with me five And I will come to you when I shall pass through Macedonia For I pass through Macedonia six and it may be that I will remain or even pass the winter with you that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go seven For I wish not to see you now in passing for I hope to remain some time with you if the Lord permit eight But I shall remain at Ephesus until the Pentecost nine For a great and effectual door is open to me and there are many adversaries ten Now if Timothy come see that he may be with you without fear for he works the work of the Lord as I also do eleven Let no one therefore despise him but send him forward in peace that he may come to me for I look for him with the brethren twelve And concerning Apollos the brother I besought him much to come to you with the brethren and it was not at all his will to come at this time but he will come when he shall have a convenient time thirteen Watch stand fast in the faith acquit you like men be strong fourteen Let all your acts be done in love fifteen And I beseech you brethren ye know the house of Stephanas that it is the first fruits of Achaia and that they devoted themselves to the service of the saints sixteen that ye also submit yourselves to such and to every one that works with us and labors seventeen I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus for what was lacking on your part they supplied eighteen For they refreshed my spirit and yours therefore acknowledge those who are such nineteen The churches of Asia salute you Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord with the church that is in their house twenty All the brethren salute you Salute one another with a holy kiss twenty one The salutation of me Paul with my own hand twenty two If any one loves not the Lord Jesus Christ let him be accursed Maran atha sixteen twenty two twenty three The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you twenty four My love be with you all in Christ Jesus Amen THE SECOND LETTER OF PAUL TO THE CORINTHIANS I PAUL an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God and Timothy the brother to the church of God which is at Corinth with all the saints who are in all Achaia two Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ three Blessed be God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ the Father of mercies and the God of all consolation four who consoles us in all our affliction that we may be able to console those who are in any affliction by the consolation wherewith we ourselves are consoled by God five Because as the sufferings of Christ abound toward us so through Christ abounds also our consolation six But whether we are afflicted it is for your consolation and salvation which is effective in the endurance of the same sufferings which we also suffer or whether we are consoled it is for your consolation and salvation seven And our hope of you is steadfast knowing that as ye are partakers of the sufferings so are ye also of the consolation eight For we would not brethren that ye should be ignorant of our affliction which befell us in Asia that we were exceedingly oppressed above our strength so that we despaired even of life nine Yea we ourselves had in ourselves the sentence of death that we should not trust in ourselves but in God who raises the dead ten who delivered us from so great a death and does deliver in whom is our hope that he will still deliver eleven ye also helping together on our behalf by your supplication that for the mercy bestowed on us through many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf twelve For our glorying is this the testimony of our conscience that in simplicity and godly sincerity not in fleshly wisdom but in the grace of God did we deport ourselves in the world and more abundantly toward you thirteen For we write no other things to you than what ye read or even acknowledge and I trust ye will acknowledge even to the end fourteen as also ye did acknowledge us in part that we are your glorying even as ye also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus fifteen And in this confidence I was desirous to come to you before that ye might have a second benefit sixteen and to pass by you into Macedonia and from Macedonia to come again to you and by you to be brought on my way to Judea seventeen When therefore I purposed this did I act with levity Or the things that I purpose do I purpose according to the flesh that with me there should be the yea yea and the nay nay eighteen But God is faithful our word to you is not yea and nay nineteen For the Son of God Jesus Christ who was preached among you by us by me and Silvanus and Timothy was not made yea and nay but has been made yea in him twenty For however many are the promises of God in him is the yea and in him the Amen to the glory of God through us twenty one Now he who establishes us with you in Christ and anointed us is God twenty two he who also sealed us and gave the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts twenty three But I invoke God for a witness upon my soul that to spare you I came not yet to Corinth twenty four Not that we have dominion over your faith but are helpers of your joy for in faith ye stand fast II AND I determined this with myself that I would not come again to you in sorrow two For if I make you sorry who then is he that makes me glad but the same who is made sorry by me three And I wrote this very thing to you that I might not when I came have sorrow from those of whom I ought to have joy having confidence in you all that my joy is the joy of you all four For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears not that ye might have sorrow but that ye might know the love which I have more abundantly toward you five But if any has caused sorrow he has not caused sorrow to me but in part that I be not too severe on him to you all six Sufficient for such a one is this punishment which was inflicted by the many seven So that on the contrary ye ought rather to forgive and console him lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with overmuch sorrow eight Wherefore I beseech you to confirm your love toward him nine For to this end also I wrote that I might know the proof of you whether ye are obedient in all things ten To whom ye forgive anything I forgive also for what I have forgiven if I have forgiven anything for your sakes I forgave it in the person of Christ eleven that no advantage might be gained over us by Satan for we are not ignorant of his devices twelve And when I came to Troas to preach the good news of Christ and a door was opened to me in the Lord thirteen I had no rest in my spirit because I found not Titus my brother but taking leave of them I went forth into Macedonia fourteen But thanks be to God who always causes us to triumph in Christ and makes manifest by us in every place the savor of the knowledge of him fifteen Because we are to God a sweet savor of Christ in those who are saved and in those who perish sixteen to the one a savor of death unto death to the other a savor of life unto life And who is sufficient for these things seventeen For we are not as the many corrupting the word of God but as of sincerity but as of God in the sight of God we speak in Christ III DO we again begin to commend ourselves Or need we as some letters of commendation to you or of commendation from you two Ye are our letter written in our hearts known and read by all men three being made manifest that ye are a letter of Christ ministered by us written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God not in tablets of stone but in fleshly tablets of the heart four And such confidence have we through Christ toward God five Not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think anything as of ourselves but our sufficiency is of God six who also made us sufficient as ministers of a new covenant not of the letter but of the spirit for the letter kills but the spirit makes alive seven But if the ministration of death engraven with letters in stones was made glorious so that the sons of Israel could not look steadfastly on the face of Moses for the glory of his countenance which glory was to be done away eight how shall not the ministration of the spirit be more glorious nine For if the ministration of condemnation is glory much more does the ministration of righteousness abound in glory ten For even that which was made glorious has no glory in this respect on account of the glory that excels eleven For if that which is done away was glorious much more that which abides is glorious twelve Having therefore such hope we use great plainness of speech thirteen and not as Moses put a vail over his face that the children of Israel might not steadfastly look on the end of that which was to be done away fourteen But their understandings were hardened for until this day the same vail on the reading of the old covenant remains not being taken away which vail is done away in Christ three fourteen fifteen But even unto this day when Moses is read a vail lies upon their heart sixteen But whenever it turns to the Lord the vail is taken away seventeen Now the Lord is the Spirit and where the Spirit of the Lord is there is liberty eighteen But we all with unvailed face beholding in a mirror the glory of the Lord are transformed into the same image from glory to glory as by the Spirit of the Lord IV THEREFORE having this ministry as we received mercy we faint not two But we renounced the hidden things of shame not walking in craftiness nor falsifying the word of God but by the manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man s conscience in the sight of God three But if our gospel is vailed it is vailed in those who perish four in whom the god of this world blinded the understandings of the unbelieving that they should not discern the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ who is the image of God four four five For we preach not ourselves but Christ Jesus as Lord and ourselves as your servants for Jesus sake six Because it is God who commands light to shine out of darkness who shined in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Christ seven But we have this treasure in earthen vessels that the exceeding greatness of the power may be God s and not of us eight being pressed in every way yet not straitened perplexed yet not despairing nine persecuted yet not forsaken cast down yet not destroyed ten always bearing about in the body the dying of Jesus that also the life of Jesus might be made manifest in our body eleven For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus sake that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our mortal flesh twelve So that death works in us but life in you thirteen But having the same spirit of faith according to what is written I believed therefore did I speak we also believe therefore also speak fourteen knowing that he who raised up the Lord Jesus will raise up us also with Jesus and will present us with you fifteen For all things are for your sakes that the grace abounding through the greater number might make the thanksgiving more abundant to the glory of God sixteen For which cause we faint not but though our outward man perishes yet the inward man is renewed day by day seventeen For our light affliction which is but for a moment works out for us a far more exceeding an eternal weight of glory eighteen while we look not at the things which are seen but at the things which are not seen for the things which are seen are temporal but the things which are not seen are eternal V FOR we know that if our earthly house of the tabernacle five one were dissolved we have a building of God a house not made with hands eternal in the heavens two For in this we groan longing to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven three seeing that we shall be found clothed not naked five three four For we who are in the tabernacle groan being burdened in that we do not desire to be unclothed but to be clothed upon that what is mortal might be swallowed up by life five Now he who wrought us out for this very thing is God who also gave to us the earnest of the Spirit six Being therefore always confident and knowing that while at home in the body we are absent from the Lord seven for we walk by faith not by sight eight we are confident and are well pleased rather to be absent from the body and to be at home with the Lord nine Wherefore we also strive that whether at home or absent we may be well pleasing to him ten For we must all be made manifest before the judgment seat of Christ that each one may receive the things done in the body according to the things which he did whether good or bad eleven Knowing therefore the fear of the Lord we persuade men but to God we have been made manifest and I hope that we have been made manifest also in your consciences twelve For we are not again commending ourselves to you but giving you occasion of glorying on our behalf that ye may have somewhat to answer those who glory in appearance and not in heart thirteen For whether we were beside ourselves it was for God or whether we are of sound mind it is for you fourteen For the love of Christ constrains us because we thus judged that if one died for all then they all died fifteen And he died for all that they who live should live no longer to themselves but to him who for them died and rose again sixteen So that we henceforth know no one according to the flesh and if also we have known Christ according to the flesh yet now we no longer know him seventeen So that if any one is in Christ he is a new creature the old things passed away behold all things have become new eighteen And all things are of God who reconciled us to himself through Christ and gave to us the ministry of reconciliation nineteen as that God was in Christ reconciling a world to himself not reckoning to them their trespasses and having committed to us the word of reconciliation twenty We are then ambassadors on behalf of Christ five twenty as though God were beseeching by us on behalf of Christ we pray Be reconciled to God twenty one Him who knew not sin he made to be sin for us that we might become God s righteousness in him VI AND as workers together with him we also beseech you that ye receive not the grace of God in vain two for he says In an accepted time I heard thee And in the day of salvation I helped thee behold now is the well accepted time behold now is the day of salvation three giving no cause of offense in anything that the ministry be not blamed four but as God s ministers commending ourselves in everything in much patience in afflictions in necessities in distresses five in stripes in imprisonments in tumults in labors in watchings in fastings six in pureness in knowledge in long suffering in kindness in the Holy Spirit in love unfeigned seven in the word of truth in the power of God by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left eight through glory and dishonor through evil report and good report as deceivers and true nine as unknown and well known as dying and behold we live as chastened and not killed ten as sorrowful yet always rejoicing as poor yet making many rich as having nothing and possessing all things eleven O Corinthians our mouth is open to you our heart is enlarged twelve Ye are not straitened in us but ye are straitened in your own bowels thirteen Now as a recompense in the same kind I speak as to my children be ye also enlarged fourteen Be not yoked unequally with unbelievers for what fellowship has righteousness with lawlessness And what communion has light with darkness fifteen And what concord has Christ with Belial Or what part has a believer with an unbeliever sixteen And what agreement has the temple of God with idols For ye are a temple of the living God as God said I will dwell in them and walk among them and I will be their God and they shall be to me a people seventeen Wherefore come out from among them and be separated saith the Lord and touch not anything unclean and I will receive you eighteen and will be to you a Father and ye shall be to me sons and daughters saith the Lord Almighty VII HAVING therefore these promises dearly beloved let us cleanse ourselves from every pollution of flesh and spirit perfecting holiness in the fear of God two Receive us we wronged no one we corrupted no one we defrauded no one three I say it not for condemnation for I have before said that ye are in our hearts to die together and to live together four Great is my confidence toward you great is my glorying on account of you I am filled with the consolation I am made to abound with the joy in all our affliction five For indeed when we were come into Macedonia our flesh had no rest but we were afflicted in every way without were fightings within were fears six But God who consoles those who are cast down consoled us by the coming of Titus seven and not by his coming only but also by the consolation with which he was consoled in you when he told us your earnest desire your mourning your zeal for me so that I rejoiced the more eight Because though I made you sorry with the letter I do not regret it though I did regret it for I perceive that that letter made you sorry though but for a season nine Now I rejoice not that ye were made sorry but that ye were made sorry unto repentance for ye were made sorry after a godly manner that ye might in nothing receive harm from us ten For godly sorrow works repentance unto salvation not to be regretted but the sorrow of the world works out death eleven For behold this very thing that ye were made sorry after a godly manner what earnestness it wrought in you yea what clearing of yourselves yea what indignation yea what fear yea what longing desire yea what zeal yea what avenging In every thing ye commended yourselves as pure in the matter twelve So then though I wrote to you it was not on account of him who did the wrong nor of him who suffered wrong but that your care for us might be made manifest to you in the sight of God thirteen For this cause we were consoled but in our consolation seven thirteen we rejoiced abundantly more at the joy of Titus because his spirit has been refreshed by you all fourteen For if in any thing I have boasted to him of you I was not made ashamed but as we spoke all things to you in truth so also our boasting before Titus was found to be truth fifteen And his tender affection is more abundantly toward you while he remembers the obedience of you all how with fear and trembling ye received him sixteen I rejoice that in every thing I have confidence in you VIII AND we made known to you brethren the grace of God which has been bestowed on the churches of Macedonia two that in much trial of affliction was the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty abounded to the riches of their liberality three For according to their power I bear witness and beyond their power they were willing of themselves four with much entreaty beseeching of us the grace and the participation in the ministering to the saints five and not as we expected but themselves they gave first to the Lord and to us by the will of God six So that we exhorted Titus that as he had before begun so he would also finish among you this grace also seven But as in everything ye abound in faith and utterance and knowledge and all diligence and your love to us see that ye abound in this grace also eight I say it not by way of command but through the forwardness of others proving also the sincerity of your love nine For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ that though he was rich yet for your sakes he became poor that ye through his poverty might be rich ten And I give an opinion in this matter for this is expedient for you who began before others not only to do but also to will a year ago eleven And now perform the doing of it also that as there was the readiness to will so there may be the performance according to what ye have twelve For if there be first the willing mind it is accepted according to what a man has not according to what he has not thirteen For it is not that others may be eased and ye burdened fourteen but by the rule of equality at this present time your abundance being a supply for their want that also their abundance may be a supply for your want that there may be equality as it is written fifteen He that gathered much had nothing over and he that gathered little did not lack sixteen But thanks be to God who put the same earnest care for you into the heart of Titus seventeen For he accepted indeed the exhortation but being very zealous he went to you of his own accord eighteen And together with him we sent the brother whose praise in the gospel is throughout all the churches nineteen and not that only but who was also appointed by the churches as our fellow traveler with this gift eight nineteen which is administered by us to further the glory of the Lord and our zeal twenty being careful of this that no one should blame us in this abundance which is administered by us twenty one for we provide for what is honorable not only in the sight of the Lord but also in the sight of men twenty two And we sent with them our brother whom we have often in many things proved to be diligent but now much more diligent through the great confidence which he has toward you twenty three As to Titus he is my partner and in regard to you a fellow laborer as to our brethren they are messengers of the churches the glory of Christ twenty four Therefore show toward them and before the churches the proof of your love and of our boasting on your behalf IX FOR concerning the ministering to the saints it is superfluous for me to write to you two For I know your readiness of mind of which I boast for you to the Macedonians that Achaia has been prepared since a year ago and your zeal stirred up the greater part of them three But I sent the brethren that our boasting of you might not be made in vain in this respect that as I said ye may be prepared four lest haply if Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared we that we say not ye should be put to shame in respect to this confidence five I thought it necessary therefore to exhort the brethren that they should go before to you and make up beforehand your bounty before promised that this may be ready in manner as a bounty and not as covetousness six But as to this he that sows sparingly shall also reap sparingly and he that sows with blessings shall also reap with blessings seven but each as he purposes in his heart not grudgingly or of necessity for God loves a cheerful giver eight And God is able to make every grace abound toward you that ye always having all sufficiency in everything may abound toward every good work nine as it is written He dispersed abroad he gave to the poor His righteousness abides forever ten and he who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food will supply and multiply your seed sown and increase the fruits of your righteousness eleven being enriched in everything to all liberality which works through us thanksgiving to God twelve Because the ministration of this service not only supplies the wants of the saints but also abounds through many thanksgivings to God thirteen while by the proof of this ministration they glorify God for the obedience to your profession of the gospel of Christ and for the liberality of the contribution to them and to all fourteen they also with supplication for you longing after you on account of the exceeding grace of God in you fifteen Thanks be to God for his unspeakable gift X NOW I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ who in presence indeed am lowly among you but being absent am bold toward you two but I entreat that I may not when I am present be bold with that confidence wherewith I think to be bold against some who think of us as walking according to the flesh three For though walking in the flesh we do not war after the flesh four for the weapons of our warfare are not fleshly but mighty before God to the pulling down of strongholds five casting down imaginations and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God and bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ six and being in readiness to punish every disobedience when your obedience is made perfect seven Do ye look on things after the outward appearance If any man trusts to himself that he is Christ s let him of himself consider this again that as he is Christ s so also are we eight For even if I should boast somewhat more abundantly of our authority which the Lord gave us for edification and not for your destruction ten eight I shall not be put to shame nine that I may not seem as if I would terrify you by my letters ten For his letters says one are weighty and strong but his bodily presence is weak and his speech contemptible eleven Let such a one consider this that such as we are in word by letters when absent such will we be also in deed when present twelve For we venture not to reckon ourselves among or to compare ourselves with some of those who commend themselves but they measuring themselves among themselves and comparing themselves with themselves are not wise thirteen But we will not boast of things without measure but according to the measure of the line which God apportioned to us a measure to reach even to you fourteen For we do not stretch ourselves beyond our measure as though we reached not to you for as far as to you also did we come in the gospel of Christ fifteen not boasting of things without measure in other men s labors but having hope when your faith increases that we shall be enlarged among you according to our line abundantly sixteen to preach the gospel in the regions beyond you not to make our boast in another s line of things made ready to our hand seventeen But he that boasts let him boast in the Lord eighteen For not he that commends himself is approved but he whom the Lord commends XI WOULD that ye could bear with me in a little folly Nay ye do bear with me two For I am jealous over you with a godly jealousy for I espoused you to one husband that I may present a chaste virgin to Christ three But I fear lest by any means as the serpent beguiled Eve by his subtlety so your minds should be corrupted from your simplicity toward Christ four For if indeed he that comes preaches another Jesus whom we preached not or if ye receive a different spirit which ye received not or a different gospel which ye accepted not ye might well bear with it five For I reckon that I am in no respect behind these overmuch apostles six And though I be rude in speech yet not in knowledge but in everything we have been made manifest among all in respect to you seven Did I commit an offense in abasing myself that ye might be exalted because I preached to you the gospel of God without charge eight I robbed other churches taking wages of them in order to do you service nine And when I was present with you and in want I was a charge to no one for what was lacking to me the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied and in every thing I kept myself from being burdensome to you and so will keep myself ten As the truth of Christ is in me this boasting shall not be shut up against me in the regions of Achaia eleven Wherefore Because I love you not God knows twelve But what I do and will do is that I may cut off the occasion of those who desire an occasion that wherein they boast they may be found even as we thirteen For such are false apostles deceitful workers transforming themselves into apostles of Christ fourteen And no wonder for Satan himself transforms himself into an angel of light fifteen It is no great thing then if also his ministers transform themselves as ministers of righteousness whose end shall be according to their works sixteen I say again let no one think me foolish but if it can not be so yet receive me even if as foolish that I too may boast myself a little seventeen What I speak I speak not after the Lord but as in foolishness in this confidence of boasting eighteen Seeing that many boast after the flesh I also will boast nineteen For ye gladly bear with the foolish being yourselves wise twenty For ye bear with it if one brings you into bondage if one devours you if one takes you if one exalts himself if one smites you on the face twenty one I say it as a reproach that we were weak But in whatever any one is bold I say it in foolishness I also am bold twenty two Are they Hebrews So am I Are they Israelites So am I Are they Abraham s seed So am I twenty three Are they ministers of Christ I speak as beside myself I am more in labors more abundantly in stripes above measure in prisons more abundantly in deaths often twenty four of the Jews five times I received forty stripes save one twenty five thrice I was beaten with rods once I was stoned thrice I suffered shipwreck a night and a day I have spent in the deep twenty six by journeyings often by perils of rivers by perils of robbers by perils from my countrymen by perils from the heathen by perils in the city by perils in the wilderness by perils in the sea by perils among false brethren twenty seven by weariness and painfulness in watchings often in hunger and thirst in fastings often in cold and nakedness twenty eight Beside those things that are without there is that which comes upon me daily the care of all the churches twenty nine Who is weak and I am not weak Who is offended and I do not burn thirty If I must needs boast I will boast of things which belong to my infirmity thirty one God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ who is blessed forevermore knows that I lie not thirty two In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept guard over the city of the Damascenes wishing to apprehend me thirty three and through a window I was let down in a basket through the wall and escaped his hands XII TO boast is surely not expedient for me for I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord two I know a man in Christ above fourteen years ago whether in the body I know not or whether out of the body I know not God knows such a one caught up even to the third heaven three And I know such a man whether in the body or without the body I know not God knows four that he was caught up into paradise and heard unspeakable words which it is not lawful for a man to utter five Of such a one I will boast but of myself I will not boast save in my infirmities six For if I should desire to boast I shall not be foolish for I shall speak truth but I forbear lest any one should reckon of me above what he sees me to be or hears from me seven And that I might not be exalted overmuch through the abundance of the revelations there was given to me a thorn in the flesh a messenger of Satan to buffet me that I might not be exalted overmuch eight Concerning this I besought the Lord thrice that it might depart from me nine And he said to me My grace is sufficient for thee for my power is made perfect in weakness Most gladly therefore will I rather boast in my infirmities that the power of Christ may abide upon me ten Wherefore I take pleasure in infirmities in reproaches in necessities in persecutions in distresses for Christ s sake for when I am weak then I am powerful eleven I have become foolish ye compelled me For I ought to have been commended by you for in nothing was I behind these overmuch apostles though I am nothing twelve Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience by signs and wonders and miracles thirteen For what is there wherein ye were inferior to the rest of the churches except that I myself was not a charge to you Forgive me this wrong fourteen Behold I am ready to come to you the third time and I will not be a charge to you for I seek not yours but you for the children ought not to lay up for the parents but the parents for the children fifteen And I will most gladly spend and be spent for your souls though the more abundantly I love you the less I am loved sixteen But be it so I was not myself a charge to you twelve sixteen but yet being crafty I caught you with guile seventeen Did I make gain of you by any of those whom I have sent to you eighteen I exhorted Titus to go and sent with him the brother Did Titus make gain of you Did we not walk in the same spirit did we not in the same steps nineteen Do ye again suppose that we are excusing ourselves to you twelve nineteen Before God in Christ we speak and all beloved for your edification twenty For I fear lest haply when I come I shall find you not such as I would and I too shall be found by you such as ye would not lest there be wranglings envyings wraths rivalries backbitings whisperings swellings tumults twenty one lest when I come again my God shall humble me among you and I shall bewail many of those who have sinned before and repented not of the uncleanness and fornication and wantonness which they committed XIII THIS third time I am coming to you In the mouth of two witnesses and of three shall every word be established two I have before said and now say beforehand as when present the second time so also now when absent to those who heretofore have sinned and to all the rest that if I come again I will not spare three since ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me who toward you is not weak but is mighty in you four For even if he was crucified through weakness yet he lives by the power of God For we also are weak in him but we shall live with him by the power of God toward you five Try your own selves whether ye are in the faith prove your own selves Know ye not your own selves that Jesus Christ is in you except ye are reprobate six But I trust that ye shall know that we are not reprobate seven Now I pray to God that ye do no evil not that we should appear approved but that ye may do what is good though we be as reprobate eight For we have no power against the truth but for the truth nine For we are glad when we are weak and ye are powerful this also we pray for even your perfection ten For this cause I write these things being absent that when present I may not use sharpness according to the power which the Lord gave me for edification and not for destruction eleven Finally brethren farewell Be perfect be of good comfort be of the same mind be at peace and the God of love and peace will be with you twelve Salute one another with a holy kiss thirteen All the saints salute you fourteen The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ and the love of God and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all THE LETTER OF PAUL TO THE GALATIANS I PAUL an apostle not from men neither through man but through Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised him from the dead two and all the brethren who are with me to the churches of Galatia three Grace to you and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ four who gave himself for our sins that he might deliver us out of the present evil world according to the will of God and our Father five to whom be the glory forever and ever Amen six I marvel that ye are so soon removing from him who called you in the grace of Christ to a different gospel seven which is not another except that there are some who trouble you and wish to pervert the gospel of Christ eight But even if we or an angel from heaven should preach a gospel to you contrary to that which we preached to you let him be accursed nine As we have said before so I now say again if any one preaches a gospel to you contrary to that which ye received let him be accursed ten For do I now seek the favor of men or of God Or am I seeking to please men If I were still pleasing men I should not be Christ s servant eleven Now I make known to you brethren that the gospel which was preached by me is not according to man twelve for I also did not receive it from man nor was I taught it but through the revelation of Jesus Christ thirteen For ye heard of my conduct formerly in Judaism that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God and was destroying it fourteen and pressed forward in Judaism beyond many companions of the same age in my nation being more exceedingly a zealot for the traditions of my fathers fifteen But when it pleased God who set me apart from my mother s womb and called me through his grace sixteen to reveal his Son in me that I should make known the glad news of him among the Gentiles immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood seventeen neither went up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me but went away one seventeen into Arabia and returned again to Damascus eighteen Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to become acquainted with Cephas and remained with him fifteen days nineteen But no other of the apostles did I see save James the brother of the Lord twenty Now as to the things which I write to you behold before God I lie not twenty one Afterward I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia twenty two and was unknown by face to the churches of Juda which were in Christ twenty three but they were only hearing that he who was once our persecutor now preaches the faith which once he was destroying twenty four and they glorified God in me II THEN after fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas taking also Titus with me two And I went up by revelation and communicated to them the gospel which I preach among the Gentiles but privately to those of reputation lest by any means I should run or had run in vain three But not even Titus who was with me being a Greek was compelled to be circumcised four and that because of the false brethren stealthily brought in who crept in to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus that they might bring us into bondage five to whom not even for an hour did we yield by the required submission that the truth of the gospel might continue with you six But from those reputed to be something whatever they were two six it matters not to me God accepts not man s person for to me those of reputation communicated nothing in addition seven But on the contrary seeing that I have been entrusted with the gospel of the uncircumcision as Peter was with that of the circumcision eight for he who wrought for Peter in behalf of the apostleship of the circumcision wrought also for me in behalf of the Gentiles nine and having learned the grace that was given to me James and Cephas and John who were reputed to be pillars gave to me and Barnabas right hands of fellowship that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the circumcision ten only that we should remember the poor which very thing also I was forward to do eleven But when Cephas came to Antioch I withstood him to the face because he was blamed twelve For before certain ones came from James he ate with the Gentiles but when they came he withdrew and separated himself fearing those who were of the circumcision thirteen And the other Jews also dissembled with him so that Barnabas also was carried away with their dissimulation fourteen But when I saw that they walk not uprightly according to the truth of the gospel I said to Peter in the presence of all If thou being a Jew livest after the manner of Gentiles and not that of Jews how dost thou compel the Gentiles to become as Jews fifteen We are Jews by nature and not sinners from among the Gentiles sixteen but knowing that a man is not justified by works of law but through faith in Jesus Christ we also believed on Christ Jesus that we might be justified by faith in Christ and not by works of law because by works of law no flesh shall be justified seventeen But if while seeking to be justified in Christ we ourselves also were found sinners is then Christ a minister of sin Far be it eighteen For if the things which I pulled down these I build up again I make myself a transgressor nineteen For I through law died to law that I might live to God twenty I have been crucified with Christ and no longer do I live but Christ lives in me and the life which I now live in the flesh I live in the faith of the Son of God who loved me and gave himself for me twenty one I do not set aside the grace of God for if there be righteousness through law then Christ died without cause III O FOOLISH Galatians who bewitched you before whose eyes Jesus Christ was evidently set forth three one crucified among you two This only I desire to learn from you Was it from works of law that ye received the Spirit or from the hearing of faith three Are ye so foolish Having begun with the Spirit are ye now being made perfect three three with the flesh four Did ye suffer so many things in vain If indeed it be in vain five Does he therefore who supplies to you the Spirit and works miracles among you three five do it from works of law or from the hearing of faith six As Abraham believed God and it was reckoned to him for righteousness seven Know then that they who are of faith these are sons of Abraham eight And the Scripture foreseeing that God justifies the Gentiles by faith announced beforehand the glad tidings to Abraham saying In thee shall all the nations be blessed nine So that they who are of faith are blessed with the faithful Abraham ten For as many as are of works of law are under a curse for it is written Cursed is every one that continues not in all the things written in the book of the law to do them eleven And that in the law no one is justified with God is evident because the just shall live by faith twelve Now the law is not of faith but he that has done them shall live in them thirteen Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law having become a curse for us because it is written Cursed is every one that is hanged on a tree fourteen that unto the Gentiles the blessing of Abraham might come in Christ Jesus that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith fifteen Brethren I speak after the manner of men If a covenant has been confirmed though it be a man s no one sets it aside or adds thereto sixteen Now to Abraham were the promises spoken and to his seed He says not and to seeds as concerning many but as concerning one and to thy seed which is Christ seventeen But this I say that a covenant before confirmed by God the law which came four hundred and thirty years after does not annul to make the promise of no effect eighteen For if the inheritance is of law it is no more of promise but God has freely given it to Abraham by promise nineteen What then is the law It was added because of the transgressions until the seed should come to whom the promise has been made having been ordained through angels by the hand of a mediator twenty Now the mediator is not of one but God is one twenty one Is then the law against the promises of God Far be it For if a law had been given which is able to make alive truly righteousness would have been of law twenty two But the Scripture shut up all under sin that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe twenty three But before faith came we were guarded under law shut up unto the faith which was to be revealed twenty four So that the law has become our schoolmaster unto Christ that we might be justified by faith twenty five But faith having come we are no longer under a schoolmaster twenty six For ye are all sons of God by faith in Christ Jesus twenty seven For all ye who were immersed unto Christ three twenty seven did put on Christ twenty eight There is neither Jew nor Greek there is neither bond nor free there is no male and female for ye are all one in Christ Jesus twenty nine And if ye are Christ s then are ye Abraham s seed heirs according to the promise IV NOW I say as long as the heir is a child he differs in nothing from a servant though he is lord of all two but is under guardians and stewards until the time appointed by the father three So also we when we were children were held in bondage under the elements four three of the world four But when the fullness of the time came God sent forth his son born of a woman born under law five that he might redeem those under law that we might receive the adoption of sons six And because ye are sons God sent forth the Spirit of his Son into our hearts crying Abba Father seven So that thou art no longer a servant but a son and if a son also an heir through God eight But at that time indeed when ye knew not God ye served those which are not in their nature gods nine But now after having known God or rather having been known by God how is it that ye turn back again to the weak and poor elements four nine to which ye desire to be in bondage again anew ten Do ye carefully observe days and months and seasons and years eleven I am afraid of you lest by any means I have bestowed labor upon you in vain twelve Become as I am for I also became as ye are brethren I beseech you Ye injured me in nothing thirteen Nay ye know that by reason of weakness of the flesh I preached the glad tidings to you the former time fourteen and my trial four fourteen which was in my flesh ye despised not nor spurned but received me as an angel of God as Christ Jesus fifteen Where is four fifteen then the happiness of which ye spoke For I bear you witness that if possible ye would have plucked out your eyes and given them to me sixteen So then have I become your enemy because I tell you the truth seventeen They zealously seek you not well but they wish to exclude you that ye may zealously seek them eighteen But it is good to be zealously sought in a good cause always and not only when I am present with you nineteen My little children of whom I travail again in birth until Christ be formed in you twenty And I could wish to be present with you now and to change my voice for I am perplexed on account of you twenty one Tell me ye who desire to be under law do ye not hear the law twenty two For it is written that Abraham had two sons one by the bondwoman and one by the freewoman twenty three But the one by the bondwoman was born after the flesh and the one by the freewoman through the promise twenty four Which things are an allegory four twenty four For these women are two covenants one from mount Sinai bearing children into bondage twenty five which is Hagar for the word Hagar is mount Sinai in Arabia and answers to the Jerusalem that now is for she is in bondage with her children twenty six But the Jerusalem that is above is free which is the mother of us all four twenty six twenty seven For it is written Rejoice thou barren that bearest not Break forth and cry thou that travailest not Because many are the children of the desolate rather than of her who has the husband twenty eight But ye brethren after the manner of Isaac are children of promise twenty nine But as then the one born after the flesh persecuted the one born after the spirit so also is it now thirty But what says the Scripture Cast out the bondwoman and her son for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the free woman thirty one So then brethren we are not children of a bondwoman but of the freewoman V STAND fast therefore in the liberty with which Christ made us free and be not again entangled with the yoke of bondage two Behold I Paul say to you that if ye be circumcised Christ shall profit you nothing three Now I testify again to every man who becomes circumcised that he is a debtor to keep the whole law four Ye are separated from Christ whoever of you are justified in the law ye are fallen away from grace five For we through the Spirit wait for the hope of righteousness by faith six For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision avails any thing nor uncircumcision but faith working by love seven Ye were running well who hindered you that ye should not obey the truth eight The persuasion is not from him who calls you nine A little leaven leavens the whole lump ten I have confidence toward you in the Lord that ye will be no otherwise minded but he that troubles you shall bear his judgment whoever he may be eleven But as for me brethren if I still preach circumcision why am I still persecuted Then has the offense of the cross ceased twelve I would that they were even cut off who unsettle you thirteen For ye were called unto liberty brethren only use not the liberty for an occasion to the flesh but by love serve one another fourteen For all the law is fulfilled in one word in this Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself fifteen But if ye bite and devour one another beware lest ye be consumed by one another sixteen But I say walk by the Spirit and ye will not fulfill the desire of the flesh seventeen For the flesh has desires against the Spirit and the Spirit against the flesh and these are contrary the one to the other that ye may not do those things that ye would eighteen But if ye are led by the Spirit ye are not under law nineteen Now the works of the flesh are manifest which are fornication uncleanness wantonness twenty idolatry sorcery hatreds strife emulation wraths contentions divisions factions twenty one envyings murders drunkenness revelings and things like these of which I tell you beforehand as I also said before that they who do such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God twenty two But the fruit of the Spirit is love joy peace long suffering kindness goodness faith twenty three meekness temperance against such things there is no law twenty four And they that are Christ s crucified the flesh with its passions and desires twenty five If we live by the Spirit let us also walk by the Spirit twenty six Let us not become vainglorious provoking one another envying one another VI BRETHREN even if a man be overtaken in a fault ye who are spiritual restore such a one in the spirit of meekness considering thyself lest thou also be tempted two Bear one another s burdens and so fulfill six two the law of Christ three For if a man thinks himself to be something when he is nothing he deceives himself four But let each one prove his own work and then shall he have ground of glorying in reference to himself alone and not to another five For each one shall bear his own load six But let him that is taught in the word share with him that teaches in all good things seven Be not deceived God is not mocked for whatever a man sows that shall he also reap eight Because he that sows to his flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption but he that sows to the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap life everlasting nine And let us not be weary in well doing for in due season we shall reap if we faint not ten So then as we have opportunity let us do good to all especially to those who are of the household of faith eleven See with what large letters I wrote to you with my own hand twelve As many as desire to make a fair show in the flesh these constrain you to be circumcised only that they may not suffer persecution for the cross of Christ thirteen For neither do they themselves who are circumcised keep the law but they desire that ye should be circumcised that they may glory in your flesh fourteen But far be it from me to glory save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ through whom the world is crucified to me and I to the world fifteen For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision avails anything nor uncircumcision but a new creation sixteen And as many as walk by this rule peace be on them and mercy and on the Israel of God seventeen Henceforth let no one trouble me for I bear the marks of Jesus in my body eighteen The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit brethren Amen THE LETTER OF PAUL TO THE EPHESIANS I PAUL an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God to the saints who are in Ephesus and believers in Christ Jesus two Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ three Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ four as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world that we should be holy and blameless before him in love five having predestined us unto the adoption of sons by Jesus Christ to himself according to the good pleasure of his will six to the praise of the glory of his grace which he freely bestowed on us in the beloved seven in whom we have the redemption through his blood the remission of our trespasses according to the riches of his grace eight which he made to abound toward us in all wisdom and understanding nine making known to us the mystery of his will according to his good pleasure which he purposed in himself ten in reference to the dispensation of the fullness of times to gather for himself into one all things in the Christ the things which are in the heavens and the things on the earth eleven in him in whom we obtained also the inheritance one eleven being predestined according to the purpose of him who works all things after the counsel of his own will twelve that we should be to the praise of his glory who before have hoped in the Christ thirteen in whom ye also after having heard the word of truth the good news of your salvation in whom I say having also believed one thirteen ye were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise fourteen which is an earnest of our inheritance until the redemption one fourteen of the purchased possession to the praise of his glory fifteen For this cause I also having heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and love to all the saints sixteen cease not to give thanks for you making mention of you in my prayers seventeen that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ the Father of glory would give to you the spirit of wisdom and of revelation in the full knowledge of him eighteen the eyes of your heart being enlightened that ye may know what is the hope of his calling and what the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints nineteen and what the exceeding greatness of his power toward us who believe according to the working of his mighty power twenty which he wrought in Christ when he raised him from the dead and seated him at his own right hand in the heavenly places twenty one far above all principality and power and might and dominion and every name that is named not only in this world but also in that which is to come twenty two and subjected all things under his feet and gave him to be head over all things to the church twenty three which is his body the fullness of him who fills all in all one twenty three II YOU also being dead in trespasses and sins two in which ye once walked according to the course of this world according to the prince of the power of the air the spirit that is now working in the sons of disobedience three among whom we also all walked in time past in the desires of our flesh doing the will of the flesh and of the mind and were by nature children of wrath even as others four but God being rich in mercy on account of his great love wherewith he loved us made us five even when we were dead in sins alive with Christ by grace ye are saved six and raised us with him and made us sit with him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus seven that he might show in the ages to come the exceeding richness of his grace in his kindness toward us in Christ Jesus eight For by grace ye are saved through faith and that not of yourselves it is the gift of God nine not of works lest any one should boast ten For we are his workmanship created in Christ Jesus unto good works which God before prepared that we should walk in them eleven Wherefore remember that in time past ye the Gentiles in the flesh who are called Uncircumcision by that which is called Circumcision in the flesh made by hand twelve that at that time ye were without Christ being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel and strangers from the covenants of the promise having no hope and without God in the world thirteen But now in Christ Jesus ye who in time past were afar off were made near by the blood of Christ fourteen For he is our peace who made both one and broke down the middle wall of partition fifteen having abolished in his flesh the enmity the law of commandments contained in ordinances that he might make the two one new man in himself making peace sixteen and might reconcile both to God in one body by the cross having slain the enmity thereby seventeen And he came and brought the good news of peace to you who were afar off and to those who were near eighteen Because through him we both have the access in one Spirit to the Father nineteen So then ye are no longer strangers and sojourners but ye are fellow citizens with the saints and of the household of God twenty having been built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets Christ Jesus himself being the chief corner stone twenty one in whom all the building fitly framed together grows unto a holy temple in the Lord twenty two in whom ye also are builded together for a habitation of God in the Spirit III FOR this cause I Paul the prisoner of Jesus Christ for you Gentiles two if indeed ye heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which was given me toward you three that by revelation the mystery was made known to me as I wrote before in few words four whereby when ye read ye can perceive my understanding in the mystery of Christ five which in other generations was not made known to the sons of men as it has now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit six that the Gentiles are fellow heirs and of the same body and partakers with us of the promise in Christ Jesus through the gospel seven whereof I was made a minister according to the gift of the grace of God which was given to me according to the working of his power eight To me who am less than the least of all the saints was this grace given to preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ nine and to make all see what is the dispensation of the mystery which from ages has been hidden in God who created all things ten that now to the principalities and powers in the heavenly places might be made known through the church the manifold wisdom of God eleven according to the eternal purpose which he made three eleven in Christ Jesus our Lord twelve in whom we have boldness and access three twelve with confidence through faith in him thirteen Wherefore I entreat that ye faint not at my afflictions for you which is your glory fourteen For this cause I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ three fourteen fifteen from whom the whole family in heaven and on earth is named sixteen that he would grant to you according to the riches of his glory to be strengthened with might through his Spirit as to the inner man seventeen that Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith having been rooted and grounded in love eighteen that ye may be able to comprehend with all the saints what is the breadth and length and depth and height nineteen and to know the love of Christ which passes knowledge that ye may be filled unto all the fullness of God twenty Now to him who is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think according to the power that works in us twenty one to him be the glory in the church in Christ Jesus throughout all ages world without end Amen IV I THE prisoner in the Lord exhort you therefore to walk worthy of the calling with which ye were called two with all lowliness and meekness with long suffering bearing with one another in love three endeavoring to keep the unity of the Spirit in the bond of peace four There is one body and one Spirit as also ye were called in one hope of your calling five one Lord one faith one immersion six one God and Father of all who is over all and through all and in all seven But to each one of us the grace was given according to the measure of the gift of Christ eight Wherefore he says When he ascended on high He led captivity captive And gave gifts to men nine Now this he ascended what is it but that he also descended into the lower parts of the earth ten The one who descended he is also the one who ascended above all the heavens that he may fill all things eleven And he gave some as apostles some as prophets some as evangelists some as pastors and teachers twelve for the perfecting of the saints for the work of the ministry for the building up of the body of Christ thirteen till we all attain to the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God to a perfect man to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ fourteen that we may no longer be children tossed to and fro and carried about with every wind of doctrine by the sleight of men by cunning craftiness after the wily manner of error fifteen but holding the truth may in love grow up into him in all things who is the head Christ sixteen from whom all the body fitly framed together and compacted by means of every joint of the supply according to the working in the measure of each single part effects the increase of the body to the upbuilding of itself in love seventeen This therefore I say and testify in the Lord that ye no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles walk four seventeen in the vanity of their mind eighteen having the understanding darkened being alienated from the life of God because of the ignorance that is in then because of the hardness of their heart nineteen who as being past feeling gave themselves up to wantonness to work all uncleanness in greediness four nineteen twenty But ye did not so learn Christ twenty one if indeed ye heard him and were taught in him as the truth is in Jesus twenty two that ye put off as concerns your former deportment the old man who is corrupted according to the lusts of deceit twenty three and be renewed in the spirit of your mind twenty four and put on the new man who was created after God in the righteousness and holiness of the truth twenty five Wherefore having put away falsehood speak truth each one with his neighbor because we are members one of another twenty six Be angry and sin not let not the sun go down upon your wrath twenty seven neither give place to the Devil twenty eight Let him that stole steal no more but rather let him labor working with his hands that which is good that he may have to impart to him that has need twenty nine Let no corrupt discourse proceed out of your mouth but whatever is good for needful edification that it may impart grace to the hearers thirty And grieve not the Holy Spirit of God in whom ye were sealed unto the day of redemption thirty one Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamor and evil speaking be put away from you with all malice thirty two and be kind to one another tender hearted forgiving one another as also God in Christ forgave you V BECOME therefore followers of God as beloved children two and walk in love as also Christ loved us and gave himself up for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for an odor of sweet smell three But fornication and all uncleanness or covetousness let it not even be named among you as becomes saints four and filthiness and foolish talking and jesting which are not becoming but rather giving of thanks five For this ye know being aware that no fornicator nor unclean person nor covetous man who is an idolater has an inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God six Let no one deceive you with vain words for because of these things comes the wrath of God upon the sons of disobedience seven Become not therefore partakers with them eight For ye were once darkness but now light in the Lord Walk as children of light nine for the fruit of the light is in all goodness and righteousness and truth ten proving what is acceptable to the Lord eleven and have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness but rather also reprove them twelve For it is a shame even to speak of the things done by them in secret thirteen But all things when reproved are by the light made manifest for whatever makes manifest is light fourteen Wherefore he says Awake thou that sleepest and arise from the dead and Christ will give thee light fifteen See to it then how ye walk with exactness not as unwise but as wise sixteen redeeming the time because the days are evil seventeen Therefore be not foolish but understanding what is the will of the Lord eighteen And be not drunk with wine wherein is excess but be filled with the Spirit nineteen speaking to one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord twenty giving thanks always for all things to God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ twenty one submitting yourselves to one another in the fear of Christ twenty two wives to their own husbands as to the Lord twenty three Because a husband is the head of the wife as also Christ is the head of the church himself the Savior of the body twenty four But as the church is subjected to Christ so also are the wives to their own husbands in everything twenty five Husbands love your wives as also Christ loved the church and gave himself up for it twenty six that he might sanctify it having cleansed it by the bathing of water in the word twenty seven that he might himself present to himself the church glorious having no spot or wrinkle or any such thing but that it may be holy and blameless twenty eight So husbands ought to love their wives as their own bodies He that loves his wife loves himself twenty nine For no one ever hated his own flesh but nourishes and cherishes it as also Christ the church thirty because we are members of his body being of his flesh and of his bones thirty one For this cause shall a man leave father and mother and shall cleave to his wife and the two shall be one flesh thirty two This mystery is great but I am speaking of Christ and of the church thirty three Nevertheless do ye also severally each so love his wife even as himself and let the wife see that she reverence her husband VI CHILDREN obey your parents in the Lord for this is right two Honor thy father and mother which is the first commandment with promise three that it may be well with thee and thou mayest live long on the earth four And fathers do not provoke your children to anger but bring them up in the nurture and admonition of the Lord five Servants obey your masters according to the flesh with fear and trembling in singleness of your heart as to Christ six not with eye service as men pleasers but as servants of Christ doing the will of God from the heart seven with good will doing service as to the Lord and not to men eight knowing that whatever good thing each may have done that shall he receive from the Lord whether bond or free nine And masters do the same things to them forbearing threatening knowing that both their Master and yours is in heaven and there is no respect of persons with him ten Finally be strong in the Lord and in the power of his might eleven Put on the whole armor of God that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the Devil twelve For to us the contest is not against flesh and blood but against principalities against powers against the rulers of the darkness of this world against the spiritual powers of evil in the heavenly places six twelve thirteen Therefore take on the whole armor of God that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day and having fully done all to stand fourteen Stand therefore having girded your loins about with truth and having put on the breastplate of righteousness fifteen and having shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace sixteen in addition to all having taken on the shield of faith in which ye will be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked one seventeen And receive the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit which is the word of God eighteen praying at every fitting season in the Spirit with all prayer and supplication and watching thereunto with all perseverance and supplication for all the saints nineteen and for me that utterance may be given to me in the opening of my mouth with boldness to make known the mystery of the gospel twenty for which I am an ambassador in bonds that therein I may speak boldly as I ought to speak twenty one But that ye also may know my affairs how I do Tychicus the beloved brother and a faithful minister in the Lord will make all known to you twenty two whom I sent to you for this very thing that ye might know our affairs and that he might encourage your hearts twenty three Peace be to the brethren and love with faith from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ twenty four Grace be with all who love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity THE LETTER OF PAUL TO THE PHILIPPIANS I PAUL and Timothy servants of Jesus Christ to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi with the overseers one one and deacons two Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ three I thank my God on every remembrance of you four always in every supplication of mine making the supplication for you all with joy five for your fellowship in respect to the gospel one five from the first day until now six being confident of this very thing that he who began a good work in you will complete it until the day of Jesus Christ seven As it is just for me to think this of you all because I have you in my heart one seven being all of you both in my bonds and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel partakers of the grace with me eight For God is my witness how greatly I long for you all with the tender affection of Jesus Christ nine And this I pray that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and all discernment ten in order that ye may approve the things that are most excellent one ten that ye may be pure and without offense unto the day of Christ eleven being filled with the fruit of righteousness which is by Jesus Christ to the glory and praise of God twelve But I desire that ye should know brethren that the things which befell me have resulted rather in the furtherance of the gospel thirteen so that my bonds have become manifest in Christ in all the Praetorium and to all the rest fourteen and that the greater part of the brethren made confident in the Lord by my bonds are much more bold to speak the word without fear fifteen Some indeed preach Christ also from envy and strife but some also from good will sixteen the one out of love knowing that I am set for the defense of the gospel seventeen the other out of contentiousness proclaim Christ not with pure intent supposing that they shall add affliction one seventeen to my bonds eighteen What then Notwithstanding in every way whether in pretense or in truth Christ is proclaimed and therein I rejoice yea and shall rejoice nineteen For I know that this will turn out for my salvation through your supplication and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ twenty according to my earnest expectation and hope that I shall in nothing be put to shame but that with all boldness as always so also now Christ shall be magnified in my body whether by life or by death twenty one For to me to live is Christ and to die is gain twenty two But if it be to live in the flesh this to me is fruit of labor and which I shall choose I know not twenty three but am constrained by the two having the desire to depart and to be with Christ for it is far better twenty four but to remain in the flesh is more needful for your sakes twenty five And being persuaded of this I know that I shall remain and shall continue with you all for your furtherance and joy in the faith twenty six that your glorying may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me through my coming to you again twenty seven Only let your deportment be as becomes the gospel of Christ that whether I come and see you or remain absent I may hear of your affairs that ye stand fast in one spirit with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel twenty eight and in nothing terrified by the adversaries which is to them an evident token of perdition but to you of salvation one twenty eight and that from God twenty nine Because to you it was granted in behalf of Christ not only to believe on him but in his behalf to suffer also thirty having the same conflict as ye saw in me and now hear of in me II IF then there is any consolation two one in Christ if any comfort from love if any communion of the Spirit if any tender affection and compassion two make my joy complete that ye be of the same mind having the same love being of one accord of the one mind three doing nothing through contentiousness or vainglory but in lowliness of mind each esteeming others better than himself four regarding not each one his own but each one also the things of others five Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus six who being in the form of God did not account it robbery to be equal with God seven but emptied himself taking the form of a servant being made in the likeness of men eight And being found in fashion as a man he humbled himself becoming obedient unto death even the death of the cross nine Wherefore also God highly exalted him and gave him a name which is above every name ten that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow of beings in heaven and of beings on earth and of beings under the earth eleven and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord to the glory of God the Father twelve Wherefore my beloved as ye always obeyed not as in my presence only but now much more in my absence work out your own salvation with fear and trembling thirteen for it is God who works in you both to will and to perform of his good pleasure fourteen Do all without murmurings and disputings fifteen that ye may become blameless and simple children of God unreproachable in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation among whom ye appear as do the heavenly lights in the world sixteen holding forth one sixteen the word of life for a ground of glorying to me at the day of Christ that I did not run in vain or labor in vain seventeen But even if I am poured out on the sacrifice and ministration of your faith I rejoice and I rejoice with you all eighteen For the same cause two eighteen do ye also rejoice and rejoice with me nineteen But I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy shortly to you that I also may be cheered when I know your state twenty For I have no one like minded who will sincerely care for your state twenty one For all seek their own not the things of Jesus Christ twenty two But ye know the proof of him that as a child with a father he served with me for the gospel twenty three Him therefore I hope to send without delay so soon as I shall see how it will go with me twenty four but I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly twenty five Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus my brother and companion in labor and fellow soldier but your messenger and minister to my wants twenty six For he was longing after you all and was much distressed because ye heard that he was sick twenty seven For indeed he was sick near to death but God had mercy on him and not on him only but on me also that I might not have sorrow upon sorrow twenty eight I sent him therefore with the more haste that seeing him again ye might rejoice and that I may be less sorrowful twenty nine Receive him therefore in the Lord with all gladness and hold such in honor thirty because for the work of Christ he came near to death hazarding his life that he might supply what things were lacking on your part of the ministration to me III FINALLY my brethren rejoice in the Lord To write the same things to you to me is not
