burdensome and for you it is safe two Beware of the dogs beware of the evil workers beware of the concision three For we are the circumcision who worship by the Spirit of God and glory in Christ Jesus and have no confidence in the flesh four Though I have confidence also in the flesh If any other thinks that he has confidence in the flesh I more five circumcised the eighth day of the stock of Israel of the tribe of Benjamin a Hebrew of Hebrews as to the law a Pharisee six as to zeal persecuting the church as to the righteousness which is in the law blameless seven But what things were gain to me these I have accounted loss for Christ eight Nay more and I account all things to be loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord for whom I suffered the loss of all things and account them refuse that I may gain Christ nine and be found in him not having my own righteousness which is of law but that which is through faith in Christ the righteousness which is of God upon faith ten that I may know him and the power of his resurrection and the fellowship of his sufferings three ten being conformed to his death eleven if by any means I may attain to the resurrection from the dead twelve Not that I already obtained the prize three twelve or have already been perfected but I pursue onward if I may lay hold of that for which I was laid hold of by Christ Jesus thirteen Brethren I do not count myself to have laid hold of it but one thing I do forgetting the things behind and reaching forth to the things before fourteen I pursue on toward the mark for the prize of the heavenly calling of God in Christ Jesus fifteen Let us therefore as many as are perfect be of this mind and if in any thing ye are otherwise minded this also God will reveal to you sixteen Nevertheless whereto we have attained in the same let us walk seventeen Brethren be followers together of me and mark those who so walk as ye have us for an example eighteen For many walk of whom I told you often and now tell you even weeping that they are the enemies of the cross of Christ nineteen whose end is destruction whose God is their belly and whose glory is in their shame who mind earthly things twenty For our citizenship three twenty is in heaven from whence we also look for a Savior the Lord Jesus Christ twenty one who will transform the body of our humiliation that it may be conformed to the body of his glory according to the working with which he is able also to subject all things to himself one Therefore my brethren beloved and longed for my joy and crown so stand fast in the Lord beloved two I beseech Euodia and I beseech Syntyche to be of the same mind in the Lord three Yea I entreat thee also true yoke fellow help these women who labored with me in the gospel with Clement also and the rest of my fellow laborers whose names are in the book of life four Rejoice in the Lord always again I will say rejoice five Let your forbearance be known to all men The Lord is at hand six Be anxious for nothing but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God seven And the peace of God which passes all understanding will keep your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus eight Finally brethren whatever things are true whatever things are honorable whatever things are just whatever things are pure whatever things are lovely whatever things are of good report if there be any virtue and if there be any praise think on these things nine The things also which ye learned and received and heard and saw in me these do and the God of peace will be with you ten But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly that now at length ye revived again in your care for my welfare for which ye were also careful but lacked opportunity eleven Not that I speak in respect of want for I learned in whatever state I am to be content twelve I both know how to be abased and I know how to abound in every thing and in all things I am instructed both to be full and to be hungry both to abound and to be in want thirteen I can do all things in him who strengthens me fourteen Notwithstanding ye did well to share with me in my affliction fifteen And ye also know Philippians that in the beginning of the gospel when I went forth from Macedonia no church communicated with me in an account of giving and receiving four fifteen but ye only sixteen that also in Thessalonica ye sent once and again to my necessity seventeen Not that I seek for the gift but I seek for the fruit that abounds to your account eighteen But I have all and abound I am full having received of Epaphroditus the things sent from you an odor of sweet smell a sacrifice acceptable well pleasing to God nineteen But my God will supply all your need according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus twenty Now to God and our Father be the glory forever and ever Amen twenty one Salute every saint in Christ Jesus The brethren who are with me salute you twenty two All the saints salute you but especially they that are of Caesar s household twenty three The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirits THE LETTER OF PAUL TO THE COLOSSIANS I PAUL an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God and Timothy the brother two to the saints in Colosse and faithful brethren in Christ Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ three We give thanks to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ praying always for you four having heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and of the love which ye have toward all the saints five because of the hope which is laid up for you in heaven of which ye heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel six which is come to you as also in all the world and is bringing forth fruit and increasing also in you since the day ye heard it and knew the grace of God in truth seven as ye learned from Epaphras our beloved fellow servant who is for you a faithful minister of Christ eight who also made known to us your love in the Spirit nine For this cause we also since the day we heard it do not cease to pray for you and to ask that ye may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding ten that ye may walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing bringing forth fruit in every good work and increasing in the knowledge of God eleven being strengthened with all strength according to his glorious power unto all patience and long suffering with joy twelve giving thanks to the Father who made us meet for the portion of the inheritance of the saints in light thirteen who delivered us out of the power of darkness and translated us into the kingdom of the Son of his love fourteen in whom we have the redemption the remission of our sins fifteen who is the image of the invisible God the first born of every creature sixteen because in him were all things created the things in the heavens and the things on the earth the visible and the invisible whether thrones or dominions or principalities or powers all things have been created by him and for him seventeen and he is before all things and in him all things subsist eighteen And he is the head of the body the church who is the beginning the first born from the dead that he may become in all things pre eminent nineteen For He was pleased that in him should all the fullness dwell twenty and through him to reconcile all things to himself having made peace through the blood of his cross through him whether the things on the earth or the things in the heavens twenty one And you also being in time past alienated and enemies in your mind in wicked works yet now has he reconciled twenty two in the body of his flesh through death to present you holy and blameless and unaccused before him twenty three if indeed ye continue in the faith grounded and settled and not moved away from the hope of the gospel which ye heard which was preached in the whole creation which is under heaven of which I Paul was made a minister twenty four Now I rejoice in my sufferings for you and fill up that which is behind of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body which is the church twenty five of which I was made a minister according to the dispensation of God which was given to me for you to fulfill the word of God twenty six the mystery which has been hidden from ages and from generations but now has been manifested to his saints twenty seven to whom God willed to make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles which is Christ in you the hope of glory twenty eight whom we announce warning every man and teaching every man in all wisdom that we may present every man perfect in Christ twenty nine to which end I also labor striving according to his working which works in me with power II FOR I would have you know how great a conflict I have for you and for those in Laodicea and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh two that their hearts might be encouraged they being knit together in love and unto all the riches of the full assurance of the understanding unto the full knowledge of the mystery of God even Christ three in whom are all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge hidden four And this I say that no one may beguile you with enticing words five For though I am absent in the flesh yet in the spirit I am with you rejoicing and beholding your order and the steadfastness of your faith toward Christ six As therefore ye received Christ Jesus the Lord so walk in him seven having been rooted and being built up in him and being established in the faith as ye were taught abounding therein with thanksgiving eight Beware lest there shall be any one that despoils you through philosophy and vain deceit after the tradition of men after the rudiments of the world and not after Christ nine Because in him dwells all the fullness of the Godhead bodily ten And ye are made complete in him two ten who is the head of all principality and power eleven in whom ye were also circumcised with a circumcision not made with hands in the putting off of the body of the flesh in the circumcision of Christ twelve being buried with him in the immersion wherein ye were also raised with him through faith in the working of God who raised him from the dead thirteen And you also being dead in your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh he made alive together with him graciously forgiving us all our trespasses fourteen blotting out the handwriting in ordinances that was against us which was opposed to us and he has taken it out of the way nailing it to the cross fifteen despoiling principalities and powers two fifteena he made a show of them openly triumphing over them in it two fifteenb sixteen Let not any one therefore judge you in food or in drink or in respect of a feast day or of a new moon or of a sabbath seventeen which are a shadow of the things to come but the body is of Christ eighteen Let no one defraud you of the prize seeking it two eighteen in humiliation and worship of the angels intruding into things which he has not seen vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind nineteen and not holding fast the head from whom all the body by means of the joints and bands having nourishment ministered and being knit together increases with the increase of God twenty If ye died with Christ from the rudiments of the world why as though living in the world are ye subject to ordinances twenty one Handle not nor taste nor touch twenty two which are all to perish with the using after the commandments and teachings of men twenty three Which things have indeed a show of wisdom in self chosen worship and humiliation and neglecting of the body not in any honor for the satisfying of the flesh III IF then ye were raised together with Christ seek the things above where Christ is sitting on the right hand of God two Set your mind on the things above not on the things upon the earth three For ye died and your life is hid with Christ in God four When Christ our life shall be manifested then will ye also with him be manifested in glory five Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth fornication uncleanness passion evil desire and covetousness which is idolatry six on account of which things the wrath of God comes on the sons of disobedience seven in which ye also once walked when ye lived in these things eight But now do ye also put all away anger wrath malice reviling filthy communication out of your mouth nine Lie not one to another seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds ten and have put on the new man who is being renewed unto knowledge after the image of him who created him eleven where there is no Greek and Jew circumcision and uncircumcision Barbarian Scythian bondman freeman but Christ is all and in all twelve Put on therefore as God s chosen holy and beloved bowels of compassion kindness lowliness of mind meekness long suffering thirteen forbearing one another and freely forgiving each other if any one have a complaint against any even as Christ freely forgave you so also do ye fourteen and over all these love which is the bond of perfectness fifteen And let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts to which ye were also called in one body and be thankful sixteen Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another with psalms hymns spiritual songs in grace singing in your hearts to God seventeen And whatever ye do in word or deed do all in the name of the Lord Jesus giving thanks to God the Father through him eighteen Wives submit yourselves to your own husbands as is fitting in the Lord nineteen Husbands love your wives and be not bitter toward them twenty Children obey your parents in all things for this is well pleasing in the Lord twenty one Fathers provoke not your children that they be not discouraged twenty two Servants obey in all things your masters according to the flesh not with eye service as men pleasers but in singleness of heart fearing the Lord twenty three Whatever ye do do it heartily as to the Lord and not to men twenty four knowing that from the Lord ye will receive the recompense of the inheritance Serve the Lord Christ twenty five For he that does wrong will receive that which he did wrongfully and there is no respect of persons one Masters render to your servants that which is just and equal knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven two Persevere in prayer being watchful therein with thanksgiving three at the same time praying also for us that God would open to us a door for the word to speak the mystery of Christ for the sake of which I am also in bonds four that I may make it manifest as I ought to speak five Walk in wisdom toward those without redeeming the time six Let your speech be always with grace seasoned with salt that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man seven All my affairs will Tychicus make known to you the beloved brother and a faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord eight whom I sent to you for this very purpose that he may know your condition and may comfort your hearts nine together with Onesimus the faithful and beloved brother who is one of you They will make known to you all the things here ten Aristarchus my fellow prisoner salutes you and Mark the cousin of Barnabas concerning whom ye received commands if he come to you receive him eleven and Jesus who is called Justus who are of the circumcision These only are my fellow workers for the kingdom of God who have been a comfort to me twelve Epaphras who is one of you a servant of Christ Jesus salutes you always striving for you in his prayers that ye may stand perfect and fully assured in all the will of God thirteen For I bear him witness that he has much concern four thirteen for you and those in Laodicea and those in Hierapolis fourteen Luke the beloved physician and Demas salute you fifteen Salute the brethren in Laodicea and Nymphas and the church in his house sixteen And when the letter has been read among you cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans and that ye also read that from Laodicea seventeen And say to Archippus Take heed to the ministry which thou didst receive in the Lord that thou fulfill it eighteen The salutation by the hand of me Paul Remember my bonds Grace be with you THE FIRST LETTER OF PAUL TO THE THESSALONIANS I PAUL and Silvanus and Timothy to the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ Grace to you and peace two We give thanks to God always for you all making mention of you in our prayers three remembering without ceasing your work of faith and labor of love and patience of the hope of our Lord Jesus Christ before God and our Father four knowing brethren beloved of God your election five because our gospel came not to you in word only but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and in much assurance as ye know what manner of men were we among you for your sake six And ye became followers of us and of the Lord having received the word in much affliction with joy of the Holy Spirit seven so that ye became an example to all that believe in Macedonia and Achaia eight For from you has sounded forth the word of the Lord not only in Macedonia and Achaia but also in every place your faith toward God has gone forth so that we have no need to speak anything nine For they themselves report concerning us what manner of entrance we had to you and how ye turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God ten and to wait for his Son from heaven whom he raised from the dead Jesus who delivers us from the wrath to come II FOR yourselves brethren know our entrance to you that it has not become vain two But having before suffered and been shamefully treated as ye know at Philippi we were bold in our God to speak to you the gospel of God in much conflict three For our exhortation is not of error nor of uncleanness nor in guile four but as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel so we speak not as pleasing men but God who proves our hearts five For neither at any time used we flattering words as ye know nor a cloak of covetousness God is witness six nor of men sought we glory neither from you nor from others though able to use authority as Christ s apostles seven But we were gentle among you as a nurse cherishes her children eight so being affectionately desirous of you we were willing to impart to you not only the gospel of God but also our own souls because ye were dear to us nine For ye remember brethren our labor and toil night and day working in order not to burden any of you we preached to you the gospel of God ten Ye are witnesses and God how holily and justly and unblamably we behaved ourselves to you that believe eleven as ye know how we exhorted and encouraged and charged every one of you as a father his children twelve that ye should walk worthy of God who is calling you into his kingdom and glory thirteen For this cause we also thank God without ceasing that when ye received the word of God heard from us ye received not the word of men but as it is in truth the word of God which also works in you that believe fourteen For ye brethren became followers of the churches of God which are in Judaea in Christ Jesus for ye also suffered the same things of your own countrymen as they have of the Jews fifteen who both killed the Lord Jesus and the prophets and drove us forth and please not God and are contrary to all men sixteen hindering us from speaking to the Gentiles that they might be saved to fill up their sins always and the wrath came upon them to the utmost seventeen But we brethren having been severed from you for a short time in presence not in heart endeavored the more abundantly to see your face with great desire eighteen Wherefore we would fain have come to you even I Paul once and again and Satan hindered us nineteen For what is our hope or joy or crown of glorying Are not also ye in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at his coming twenty For ye are our glory and joy III WHEREFORE when we could no longer forbear we thought it good to be left behind at Athens alone two and sent Timothy our brother and a fellow worker with God in the gospel of Christ to establish you and to exhort you concerning your faith three that no one should be shaken by these afflictions for yourselves know that unto this we are appointed four For even when we were with you we told you before that we are to suffer affliction as also it came to pass and ye know five For this cause when I too could no longer forbear I sent to know your faith lest by some means the tempter tempted you and our labor should be in vain six But now when Timothy came to us from you and brought us good tidings of your faith and love and that ye have good remembrance of us always desiring greatly to see us as we also to see you seven for this cause we were consoled brethren over you in all our affliction and distress through your faith eight because now we live if ye stand fast in the Lord nine For what thanks can we render to God for you for all the joy wherewith we rejoice for your sakes before our God ten night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face and may perfect that which is lacking in your faith eleven Now God and our Father himself and our Lord Jesus Christ direct our way to you twelve And the Lord make you increase and abound in love toward one another and toward all as we also do toward you thirteen to the end he may establish your hearts unblamable in holiness before God and our Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ with all his saints IV FURTHERMORE then brethren we beseech you and exhort you in the Lord Jesus that as ye received from us how ye ought to walk and to please God as also ye are walking ye would abound yet more two For ye know what commands we gave you through the Lord Jesus three For this is the will of God your sanctification that ye abstain from fornication four that each one of you know how to possess four four his vessel in sanctification and honor five not in lustful passion as also the Gentiles who know not God six That no one go beyond and defraud his brother in any matter four six because the Lord is the avenger for all these things as we also told you before and testified seven For God did not call us to uncleanness but in sanctification eight Therefore he that rejects rejects not man but God who also gave to you his Holy Spirit nine But concerning brotherly love ye need not that I write to you for ye yourselves are taught of God to love one another ten For indeed ye do it toward all the brethren who are in all Macedonia But we beseech you brethren to abound yet more eleven and to study to be quiet and to do your own business and to work with your own hands as we commanded you twelve that ye may walk becomingly toward those without and may have need of nothing thirteen But we desire that you should not be ignorant brethren concerning those who are sleeping that ye sorrow not as others who have no hope fourteen For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again so also those who fell asleep through Jesus will God bring with him fifteen For this we say to you in the word of the Lord that we the living who remain unto the coming of the Lord shall not precede those who fell asleep sixteen Because the Lord himself will descend from heaven with a shout with the voice of the archangel and with the trump of God and the dead in Christ will first rise seventeen Then we the living who remain will be caught up together with them in clouds to meet the Lord in the air and so shall we ever be with the Lord eighteen Wherefore encourage one another with these words V BUT of the times and the seasons brethren ye have no need that I write to you two For yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord so comes as a thief in the night three For when they shall say Peace and safety then sudden destruction comes upon them as travail upon a woman with child and they shall not escape four But ye brethren are not in darkness that the day should overtake you as a thief five For all ye are sons of light and sons of day we are not of night nor of darkness six So then let us not sleep as others but let us watch and be sober seven For they that sleep sleep in the night and they that are drunken are drunken in the night eight But let us being of the day be sober putting on the breastplate of faith and love and for a helmet the hope of salvation nine because God did not appoint us to wrath but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ ten who died for us that whether we wake or sleep we should live together with him eleven Wherefore encourage each other and edify one the other as also ye do twelve And we beseech you brethren to know those who labor among you and preside over you in the Lord and admonish you thirteen and to esteem them very highly in love for their work s sake Be at peace among yourselves fourteen Now we exhort you brethren admonish the unruly comfort the feeble minded support the weak be long suffering toward all fifteen See that none render evil for evil to any one but ever follow that which is good both toward one another and toward all sixteen Rejoice always seventeen Pray without ceasing eighteen In everything give thanks for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus toward you nineteen Quench not the Spirit twenty Despise not prophesyings twenty one but prove all things hold fast that which is good twenty two Abstain from every form of evil twenty three And the God of peace himself sanctify you wholly and may your spirit and soul and body be preserved whole without blame at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ twenty four Faithful is he who calls you who also will do it twenty five Brethren pray for us twenty six Salute all the brethren with a holy kiss twenty seven I adjure you by the Lord that this letter be read to all the holy brethren twenty eight The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you THE SECOND LETTER OF PAUL TO THE THESSALONIANS I PAUL and Silvanus and Timothy to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ two Grace to you and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ three We are bound to thank God always for you brethren as it is meet because your faith grows exceedingly and the love of each one of you all toward one another abounds four so that we ourselves glory in you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and the afflictions which ye endure five a token of the righteous judgment of God that ye may be counted worthy of the kingdom of God for which ye also suffer six since it is a righteous thing with God to recompense affliction to those who afflict you seven and to you who are afflicted rest with us at the revelation of the Lord Jesus from heaven with the angels of his power eight in flaming fire taking vengeance on those who know not God and those who obey not the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ nine who shall suffer justice eternal destruction from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of his power ten when he shall come to be glorified in his saints and to be admired in all who believed because our testimony to you was believed in that day eleven To which end we also pray for you always that our God may count you worthy of the calling and accomplish all the good pleasure of goodness and the work of faith with power twelve that the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you and ye in him according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ II NOW we beseech you brethren concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering together to him two that ye be not hastily shaken in mind two twoa or be troubled neither by spirit nor by word nor by letter as through us as that the day of the Lord is at hand two twob three Let not any one deceive you in any manner because that day will not come except there come first the falling away and the man of sin be revealed the son of perdition four he that opposes and exalts himself against all that is called God or that is worshiped so that he sits in the temple of God showing himself that he is God five Remember ye not that when I was yet with you I told you these things six And now ye know what withholds in order that he may be revealed in his own time seven For the mystery of iniquity is already working only until he who now withholds shall be out of the way eight And then will the Lawless One be revealed whom the Lord Jesus will consume with the breath of his mouth and will destroy with the manifestation of his coming nine him whose coming is after the working of Satan in all power and signs and lying wonders ten and in all deceit of unrighteousness for those who perish because they received not the love of the truth that they might be saved eleven And for this cause God sends them a working of delusion in order that they may believe the lie twelve that they may all be judged who believed not the truth but had pleasure in unrighteousness thirteen But we are bound to give thanks to God always for you brethren beloved of the Lord because God from the beginning chose you to salvation in sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth fourteen whereunto he called you by our gospel to the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ fifteen So then brethren stand fast and hold the traditions two fifteen which ye were taught whether by word or by our letter sixteen Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God and our Father who loved us and gave us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace seventeen encourage your hearts and establish you in every good work and word III FINALLY brethren pray for us that the word of the Lord may run and be glorified as also with you two and that we may be delivered from perverse and evil men for all have not the faith three But faithful is the Lord who will establish you and guard you from evil three three four And we have confidence in the Lord concerning you that ye both do and will do the things which we command you five And the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God and into the patience of Christ six Now we command you brethren in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ that ye withdraw yourselves from every brother walking disorderly and not after the tradition three six which they received from us seven For yourselves know how ye ought to follow us that we were not disorderly among you eight nor did we eat bread of any one for naught but with labor and toil working night and day that we might not be burdensome to any of you nine not because we have not power but to make ourselves an example to you that ye should follow us ten For also when we were with you this we commanded you If any will not work neither let him eat eleven For we hear of some who walk among you disorderly working not at all but are busy bodies twelve Now such we command and exhort in the Lord Jesus Christ that with quietness working they eat their own bread thirteen But ye brethren be not weary in well doing fourteen And if any one obeys not our word by this letter mark that man and keep not company with him that he may be shamed fifteen And count him not as an enemy but admonish him as a brother sixteen Now the Lord of peace himself give you peace always in every way The Lord be with you all seventeen The salutation of Paul with my own hand which is a token in every letter so I write eighteen The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all THE FIRST LETTER OF PAUL TO TIMOTHY I PAUL an apostle of Christ Jesus according to the commandment of God our Savior and Christ Jesus our hope two to Timothy a true child in the faith Grace mercy peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord three As I besought thee to remain still in Ephesus when I was going into Macedonia that thou mightest charge certain ones not to teach other doctrine four nor to give heed to fables and endless genealogies which further disputes rather than God s dispensation which is in faith so do five Now the end of the commandment is love out of a pure heart and a good conscience and faith unfeigned six from which some swerving turned aside to idle prattling seven desiring to be teachers of the law understanding neither what they say nor whereof they affirm eight But we know that the law is good if a man use it lawfully nine knowing this that the law is not made for a righteous man but for the lawless and unruly for the ungodly and sinful for the unholy and profane for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers one nine for man slayers ten for fornicators for those who defile themselves with mankind for enslavers of men for liars for false swearers and whatever else is contrary to the sound teachings eleven according to the glorious gospel of the blissful God with which I was entrusted twelve And I thank him who gave me strength Christ Jesus our Lord that he accounted me faithful putting me into the ministry thirteen who was formerly a blasphemer and a persecutor and overbearing But I obtained mercy because I did it ignorantly in unbelief fourteen and the grace of our Lord abounded exceedingly with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus fifteen Faithful is the saying and worthy of all acceptance that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners of whom I am chief sixteen But for this cause I obtained mercy that in me first one sixteena Christ Jesus might show forth all his long suffering one sixteenb for a pattern to those who should hereafter believe on him to life everlasting seventeen Now to the King eternal the imperishable invisible only God be honor and glory forever and ever Amen eighteen This charge I commit to thee my child Timothy according to the prophecies which went before concerning thee that thou mayest wage in them the good warfare nineteen having faith and a good conscience which some thrusting away made shipwreck concerning the faith twenty Of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander whom I delivered over to Satan that they might be taught not to blaspheme II I EXHORT then first of all that supplications prayers intercessions thanksgivings be made for all men two for kings and all that are in authority that we may lead a quiet and peaceful life in all godliness and decorum three For this is good and acceptable in the sight of our Savior God four who desires that all should be saved and come to the knowledge of the truth five For there is one God one mediator also between God and men the man Christ Jesus six who gave himself a ransom for all to be testified in due time seven whereunto I was appointed a preacher and an apostle I speak truth I lie not a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth eight I desire therefore that the men pray in every place lifting up holy hands without wrath and disputing nine in like manner also that women in becoming apparel adorn themselves with modesty and sobriety not in braided hair or gold or pearls or costly raiment ten but which becomes women professing godliness by means of good works eleven Let the woman learn in silence with all subjection twelve But I permit not the woman to teach nor to have authority over the man but to be in silence thirteen For Adam was first formed then Eve fourteen And Adam was not deceived but the woman being deceived has fallen into transgression fifteen But she shall be saved through child bearing if they continue in faith and love and holiness with sobriety III FAITHFUL is the saying if any one desires the office of overseer three one he desires a good work two The overseer then must be blameless the husband of one wife sober discreet orderly hospitable apt in teaching three not given to wine not a striker but forbearing averse to strife not a lover of money four presiding well over his own house having his children in subjection with all decorum five but if one knows not how to preside over his own house how shall he take care of the church of God six not a novice three six lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the Devil seven But he must also have a good testimony from those without lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the Devil eight Deacons in like manner must be grave not double tongued not given to much wine not greedy of gain nine holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience ten And let these also first be proved then let them serve as deacons being without reproach eleven Their wives in like manner must be grave not slanderers sober faithful in all things twelve Let the deacons be husbands of one wife presiding well over their children and their own houses thirteen For they that have served well as deacons obtain for themselves a good degree three thirteen and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus fourteen These things I write to thee hoping to come to thee shortly fifteen but if I tarry long that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to conduct thyself in the house of God which is the church of the living God the pillar and ground of the truth sixteen And confessedly great is the mystery of godliness God was manifested three sixteen in the flesh was justified in the Spirit was seen by angels was preached among the Gentiles was believed on in the world was received up in glory IV NOW the Spirit says expressly that in after times some will depart from the faith giving heed to seducing spirits and teachings of demons two of those who speak lies in hypocrisy having their conscience seared with a hot iron three forbidding to marry commanding to abstain from food which God created to be received with thanksgiving for those four three who believe and know the truth four For every creature of God is good and nothing to be refused if it be received with thanksgiving five for it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer six If thou put the brethren in mind of these things thou shalt be a good minister of Christ Jesus nurtured in the words of the faith and of the good teaching which thou hast strictly followed seven But the profane and silly fables four seven avoid and exercise thyself unto godliness eight For bodily exercise is profitable for little but godliness is profitable for all things having promise of the life that now is and of that which is to come nine Faithful is the saying and worthy of all acceptance ten For to this end we both labor and suffer reproach because we have hoped in the living God who is the Savior of all men especially of believers eleven These things command and teach twelve Let no one despise thy youth but become an example of the believers in word in deportment in love in faith in purity thirteen Till I come give attention to reading to exhortation to teaching fourteen Neglect not the gift that is in thee which was given thee through prophecy with the laying on of the hands of the eldership fifteen Meditate on these things four fifteen give thyself wholly to them that thy progress may be manifest to all sixteen Give heed to thyself and to the teaching continue in them for in doing this thou wilt save both thyself and those who hear thee V REBUKE not an elder but entreat him as a father younger men as brethren two elder women as mothers the younger as sisters with all purity three Honor as widows those who are widows indeed four But if any widow has children or grand children let these learn first to show piety to their own household and to requite their parents for this is acceptable before God five Now she that is a widow indeed and left alone has set her hope on God and continues in supplications and prayers night and day six But she that lives in pleasure is dead while she lives seven And these things command that they may be blameless eight But if any one provides not for his own and especially for those of his own house he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever nine Let not one be enrolled as a widow under threescore years old having been the wife of one husband ten well reported of for good works if she brought up children if she lodged strangers if she washed the feet of the saints if she relieved the afflicted if she diligently followed every good work eleven But younger widows refuse for when they have become wanton against Christ they desire to marry twelve having condemnation because they broke their first faith thirteen And at the same time they also learn to be idle going about from house to house and not only idle but tattlers also and busy bodies speaking things which they ought not fourteen I desire therefore that younger widows marry bear children guide the house give no occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully fifteen For already some turned aside after Satan sixteen If any believing man or woman has widows let them relieve them and let not the church be burdened that it may relieve those who are widows indeed seventeen Let elders who preside well be counted worthy of double honor especially they who labor in the word and teaching eighteen For the Scripture says Thou shalt not muzzle an ox while treading out the grain and The laborer is worthy of his hire nineteen Against an elder receive not an accusation except before two or three witnesses five nineteen twenty Those who sin rebuke before all that the rest also may fear twenty one I charge thee before God and Christ Jesus and the elect angels that thou observe these things without prejudging doing nothing with partiality twenty two Lay hands hastily on no one neither share in other men s sins Keep thyself pure twenty three No longer drink water only but use a little wine for thy stomach s sake and for thy frequent infirmities twenty four The sins of some men are openly manifest going before to judgment and some men they follow after twenty five In like manner also the good works are openly manifest and those that are otherwise can not be hidden VI LET as many as are servants under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honor that the name of God and the teaching be not blasphemed two And they that have believing masters let them not despise them because they are brethren but the rather do them service because they who receive the benefit are faithful and beloved These things teach and exhort three If any one teaches otherwise and assents not to sound words the words of our Lord Jesus Christ and to the teaching which is according to godliness four he is puffed up with pride knowing nothing but doting about questions and strifes of words whereof comes envy strife railings evil surmisings five vain disputings of men corrupted in mind and robbed of the truth supposing that godliness is a means of gain six But godliness with contentment is a great means of gain seven For we brought nothing into the world it is certain we can also carry nothing out eight and having food and raiment let us be therewith content nine But they who desire to be rich fall into temptation and a snare and many foolish and hurtful lusts which sink men into destruction and perdition ten For the love of money is a root of all evils which some coveting after wandered away from the faith and pierced themselves through with many sorrows eleven But thou O man of God flee these things and follow after righteousness godliness faith love patience meekness of spirit twelve Fight the good fight of the faith lay hold on the eternal life unto which thou wast called and didst make the good profession before many witnesses thirteen I charge thee in the sight of God who preserves all alive and of Jesus Christ who before Pontius Pilate witnessed the good profession fourteen that thou keep the commandment without spot blameless until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ fifteen which in his own times six fifteen he will show who is the blissful and only Potentate the King of kings and Lord of lords sixteen who only has immortality dwelling in light unapproachable whom no man has seen or can see to whom be honor and power everlasting Amen seventeen Charge those who are rich in this world that they be not high minded nor place their hope on the uncertainty of riches but in God who gives us all things richly for enjoyment eighteen that they do good be rich in good works be free in imparting willing to communicate nineteen laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come that they may lay hold on the true life twenty O Timothy keep that which is committed to thy trust avoiding the profane babblings and oppositions of that which is falsely called knowledge twenty one which some professing erred concerning the faith Grace be with thee THE SECOND LETTER OF PAUL TO TIMOTHY I PAUL an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus two to Timothy a beloved child Grace mercy peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord three I thank God whom I serve from my forefathers with pure conscience that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day four longing to see thee remembering thy tears that I may be filled with joy five calling to remembrance the unfeigned faith that is in thee which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois and thy mother Eunice and I am persuaded that it dwells in thee also six For which cause I put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of God which is in thee by the laying on of my hands seven For God did not give us a spirit of fear but of power and of love and of chastisement eight Be not then ashamed of the testimony of our Lord nor of me his prisoner but endure hardship with me for the gospel according to the power of God nine who saved us and called us with a holy calling not according to our works but according to his own purpose and the grace which was given us in Christ Jesus before eternal ages ten but now made manifest by the appearing of our Savior Jesus Christ who abolished death and brought life and incorruption to light through the gospel eleven for which I was appointed a preacher and an apostle and a teacher of the Gentiles twelve For which cause I suffer also these things But I am not ashamed for I know whom I have believed and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed to him unto that day thirteen Hold fast the form of sound words which thou heardest from me in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus fourteen The good thing committed to thee keep through the Holy Spirit who dwells in us fifteen Thou knowest this that all those in Asia turned away from me of whom are Phygellus and Hermogenes sixteen The Lord give mercy to the house of Onesiphorus because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chain seventeen but when he was in Rome he sought me out very diligently and found me eighteen The Lord grant to him that he may find mercy of the Lord in that day And in how many things he ministered to me at Ephesus thou knowest very well II THOU therefore my child be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus two And the things that thou heardest from me by many witnesses two two the same commit thou to faithful men who will be able to teach others also three Endure hardship with me as a good soldier of Jesus Christ four No one serving as a soldier entangles himself with the affairs of life that he may please him who chose him to be a soldier five And if a man also contends in the games he is not crowned unless he contends lawfully six The husbandman that labors must first partake of the fruits seven Consider what I say for the Lord will give thee understanding in all things eight Remember Jesus Christ raised from the dead of the seed of David according to my gospel nine in which I endure hardship even unto bonds as an evil doer but the word of God is not bound ten For this cause I endure all things for the sake of the chosen that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory eleven Faithful is the saying For if we died with him we shall also live with him twelve if we endure we shall also reign with him if we shall deny him he also will deny us thirteen if we are faithless he remains faithful for he can not deny himself fourteen Of these things put them in remembrance charging them before the Lord not to strive about words to no profit to the subverting of the hearers fifteen Endeavor to present thyself approved to God a workman not made ashamed rightly dividing two fifteen the word of truth sixteen But shun the profane babblings for they will go on to more ungodliness seventeen And their word will eat as does a canker of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus eighteen who erred concerning the truth saying that the resurrection has already taken place and overturn the faith of some nineteen Nevertheless God s firm foundation stands having this seal The Lord knew those who are his and Let every one that names the name of the Lord depart from iniquity twenty But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver but also of wood and of earth and some for honor and some for dishonor twenty one If a man therefore cleanse himself from these he shall be a vessel for honor sanctified useful for the master prepared for every good work twenty two But flee youthful lusts and follow righteousness faith love peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart twenty three But the foolish and ignorant questionings avoid knowing that they beget strifes twenty four And a servant of the Lord must not strive but be gentle toward all apt in teaching patient of evil twenty five in meekness admonishing those who oppose themselves if haply God may give them repentance unto the full knowledge of the truth twenty six and that they may awake to soberness out of the snare of the Devil being taken captive by him to do his will two twenty six III BUT know this that in the last days perilous times will come two For men will be lovers of themselves lovers of money boasters proud blasphemers disobedient to parents unthankful unholy three without natural affection implacable false accusers incontinent fierce without love to the good four betrayers headlong puffed up lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God five having a form of godliness but denying the power thereof and from these turn away six For of these are they who creep into houses and lead captive silly women laden with sins led away with divers lusts seven ever learning and never able to come to the full knowledge of the truth eight Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses so also do these withstand the truth men corrupted in mind reprobate concerning the faith nine But they shall proceed no further for their folly shall be fully manifest to all as was also theirs ten But thou didst strictly follow my teaching manner of life purpose faith long suffering love patience eleven persecutions afflictions what things came upon me at Antioch at Iconium at Lystra what persecutions I endured and out of all the Lord delivered me twelve Yea and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution thirteen But evil men and seducers will grow worse and worse deceiving and being deceived fourteen But do thou continue in the things which thou learnedst and wast assured of knowing of whom thou didst learn fifteen and that from a child thou didst know the Holy Scriptures which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus sixteen All Scripture is inspired by God and is profitable three sixteen for teaching for reproof for correction for instruction in righteousness seventeen that the man of God may be perfect thoroughly furnished unto all good works IV I CHARGE thee before God and Christ Jesus who will judge the living and the dead and by his appearing and his kingdom two preach the word apply thyself in season out of season reprove rebuke exhort with all long suffering and teaching three For the time will come when they will not endure the sound teaching but according to their own desires will to themselves heap up teachers having itching ears four and they will turn away their ears from the truth and will turn aside to fables five But be thou watchful in all things endure hardship do the work of an evangelist fully accomplish thy ministry six For I am now about to be offered and the time of my departure is at hand seven I have fought the good fight I have finished my course I have kept the faith eight henceforth there is laid up for me the crown of righteousness which the Lord the righteous judge will give me in that day and not to me only but also to all those who have loved his appearing nine Endeavor to come to me shortly ten For Demas forsook me having loved the present world and departed to Thessalonica Crescens to Galatia Titus to Dalmatia eleven Luke alone is with me Take Mark and bring him with thee for he is useful to me for the ministry twelve But Tychicus I sent to Ephesus thirteen The cloak which I left at Troas with Carpus when thou comest bring and the books especially the parchments fourteen Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil the Lord reward him according to his works fifteen Of whom do thou also beware for he has greatly withstood our words sixteen At my first answer no one came forward with me but all forsook me May it not be laid to their charge seventeen But the Lord stood by me and strengthened me that through me the preaching might be fully accomplished and all the Gentiles might hear and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion eighteen The Lord will deliver me from every evil work and will bring me safe to his heavenly kingdom to whom be the glory forever and ever Amen nineteen Salute Prisca and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus twenty Erastus remained in Corinth but Trophimus I left at Miletus sick twenty one Endeavor to come before winter Eubulus salutes thee and Pudens and Linus and Claudia and all the brethren twenty two The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit Grace be with you THE LETTER OF PAUL TO TITUS I PAUL a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ for the faith of God s chosen and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness two upon hope of eternal life which God who can not lie promised before eternal ages three but in its own one three times manifested his word in the preaching with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of our Savior God four to Titus a true child according to the common faith Grace mercy peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior five For this cause I left thee behind in Crete that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting and appoint elders in each city as I directed thee six if any one is without reproach the husband of one wife having believing children not accused of rioting or unruly seven For the overseer one seven must be without reproach as God s steward not self willed not soon angry not given to wine not a striker not greedy of gain eight but hospitable a lover of the good discreet just holy temperate nine holding fast the faithful word according to the teaching that he may be able with the sound teaching both to exhort and to refute the gainsayers ten For there are many unruly vain talkers and deceivers chiefly they of the circumcision eleven whose mouths must be stopped who overturn whole houses teaching things which they ought not for the sake of base gain twelve One of themselves a prophet of their own said Cretans are always liars evil beasts lazy gluttons thirteen This testimony is true For which cause reprove them sharply that they may be sound in the faith fourteen not giving heed to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth fifteen To the pure all things are pure but to the defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure but both their mind and conscience are defiled sixteen They profess that they know God but by their works they deny him being abominable and disobedient and for every good work reprobate II BUT do thou speak the things which become the sound teaching two that aged men be sober grave discreet sound in the faith in love in patience three that aged women likewise be in behavior as becomes holiness not false accusers not enslaved to much wine teachers of that which is good four that they may teach the young women to love their husbands to love their children five to be discreet chaste keepers at home good obedient to their own husbands that the word of God be not blasphemed six The younger men likewise exhort to be sober minded seven In all things showing thyself a pattern of good works in teaching showing uncorruptness gravity eight sound speech that can not be condemned that he that is of the contrary part may be put to shame having no evil thing to say of us nine Exhort servants to submit themselves to their own masters to be well pleasing in all things not contradicting ten not purloining but showing all good faith that they may adorn the teaching of our Savior God in all things eleven For the saving grace of God appeared to all men twelve teaching us that having denied ungodliness and worldly lusts we should live soberly righteously and godly in this present world thirteen looking for the blissful hope and appearing of the glory of the great God and our Savior Jesus Christ fourteen who gave himself for us that he might redeem us from all iniquity and cleanse for himself a people to be his own zealous of good works fifteen These things speak and exhort and reprove with all authority Let no one despise thee III PUT them in mind to submit themselves to governments to authorities to obey magistrates to be ready to every good work two to speak evil of no one to be averse to strife forbearing showing all meekness to all men three For we ourselves also were once foolish disobedient going astray serving divers lusts and pleasures living in malice and envy hateful hating one another four But when the kindness and the love toward man of our Savior God appeared five not by works of righteousness which we did but according to his mercy he saved us through the bathing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Spirit six which he poured out on us richly through Jesus Christ our Savior seven that having been justified by his grace we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life eight Faithful is the saying and concerning these things I will that thou affirm constantly that they who have believed God may be careful to take the lead in good works These things are good and profitable to men nine But avoid foolish questionings and genealogies and strifes and contentions about the law for they are unprofitable and vain ten A man that causes divisions after a first and second admonition avoid three ten eleven knowing that he that is such is perverted and sins being self condemned twelve When I shall send Artemas to thee or Tychicus endeavor to come to me to Nicopolis for I have determined there to winter thirteen Zenas the lawyer and Apollos send forward on their journey zealously that nothing may be wanting to them fourteen And let ours also learn to take the lead in good works for necessary wants that they may not be unfruitful fifteen All that are with me salute thee Salute those who love us in the faith Grace be with you all THE LETTER OF PAUL TO PHILEMON PAUL a prisoner of Christ Jesus and Timothy the brother to Philemon the beloved and our fellow laborer two and to Apphia the beloved one two and Archippus our fellow soldier and to the church in thy house three Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ four I thank my God always making mention of thee in my prayers five hearing of thy love and faith which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus and unto all the saints six that the fellowship of thy faith one six may become effectual in the knowledge of every good thing which is in us unto Christ Jesus seven For I had one seven much joy and consolation in thy love because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed by thee brother eight Wherefore though having much boldness in Christ to enjoin upon thee that which is becoming nine yet for love s sake I beseech rather being such a one as Paul an old man and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ ten I beseech thee for my child whom I begot in my bonds Onesimus eleven who in time past was unprofitable to thee but is now profitable to thee and to me twelve whom I sent back to thee But do thou receive him that is my own flesh thirteen whom I would have retained with myself that in thy stead he might minister to me in the bonds of the gospel fourteen But without thy consent I desired to do nothing that thy benefit may not be as it were of necessity but willingly fifteen For perhaps he departed for a season to this end that thou shouldest receive him as thine forever sixteen no longer as a servant but above a servant a brother beloved specially to me but how much more to thee both in the flesh and in the Lord seventeen If thou countest me therefore a partner receive him as myself eighteen But if he wronged thee in any thing or owes aught put that to my account nineteen I Paul wrote it with my own hand I will repay Not to say to thee that to me thou owest also thine own self besides twenty Yea brother let me have joy of thee in the Lord Refresh my heart in Christ twenty one Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote to thee knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say twenty two But at the same time be preparing for me also a lodging for I hope that through your prayers I shall be given to you twenty three There salute thee Epaphras my fellow captive in Christ Jesus twenty four Mark Aristarchus Demas Luke my fellow laborers twenty five The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit LETTER TO THE HEBREWS I GOD who in many parts and in many ways spoke of old to the fathers by the prophets two in these last days spoke to us by his Son whom he appointed heir of all things by whom he also made the worlds three who being the brightness of his glory and the impress of his substance and upholding all things by the word of his power when he had by himself one three made a cleansing of sins sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high four having become so much superior to the angels as he has inherited a more excellent name than they five For to whom of the angels said he ever Thou art my Son I this day have begotten thee and again I will be to him a Father and he shall be to me a Son six But when he has again brought in one six the first begotten into the world he says And let all the angels of God worship him seven And of the angels he says Who makes his angels winds And his ministers a flame of fire eight but of the Son Thy throne O God is forever and ever A sceptre of righteousness is the sceptre of thy kingdom nine Thou lovedst righteousness and hatedst iniquity Therefore God thy God anointed thee With the oil of gladness above thy fellows ten and Thou Lord in the beginning didst found the earth And the heavens are the works of thy hands eleven They will perish but thou remainest And they all will become old as does a garment twelve And as a vesture thou wilt fold them up and they will be changed But thou art the same And thy years will not fail thirteen But to whom of the angels has he ever said Sit on my right hand Until I make thine enemies thy footstool fourteen Are they not all ministering spirits sent forth for ministration for the sake of those who are to inherit salvation II ON this account we ought to give the more earnest heed to the things heard lest haply we should let them slip two one two For if the word spoken through angels proved steadfast and every transgression and disobedience received just retribution three how shall we escape having neglected so great a salvation which began to be spoken by the Lord and was confirmed to us by those who heard four God also bearing witness with signs and wonders and divers miracles and distributions of the Holy Spirit according to his own will five For not to the angels did he put in subjection the world to come of which we are speaking six But one in a certain place testified saying What is man that thou art mindful of him Or the son of man that thou visitest him seven Thou madest him a little lower than the angels Thou crownedst him with glory and honor eight Thou didst put all things in subjection under his feet For in that he put all in subjection under him he left nothing that is not put under him But now we do not yet see all things put under him nine But we behold him who was made a little lower than the angels Jesus on account of the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor in order that he by the grace of God might taste death for every one ten For it became him for whom are all things and by whom are all things in bringing many sons to glory to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings eleven For both he that sanctifies and they who are sanctified are all of one for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren twelve saying I will declare thy name to my brethren In the midst of the congregation I will sing praise to thee thirteen And again I will put my trust in him And again Behold I and the children whom God gave me fourteen Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood he also himself in like manner took part in the same that through death he might destroy him who had the power of death that is the Devil fifteen and might deliver those who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage sixteen For surely he does not succor angels but he succors the seed of Abraham seventeen Wherefore in all things it became him to be made like to his brethren that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God to make propitiation for the sins of the people eighteen For in that he himself has suffered being tempted he is able to help those who are tempted III WHEREFORE holy brethren partakers of the heavenly calling consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession Jesus two who was faithful to him who appointed him as also was Moses in all His house three For he has been accounted worthy of more glory than Moses inasmuch as he who has built the house has more honor than the house four For every house is builded by some one but he who built all things is God five And Moses indeed was faithful in all His house as a servant as a testimony of the things which were to be afterward spoken six but Christ as son over His house whose house are we if we hold fast the boldness and the joyousness of the hope firm unto the end three six seven Wherefore as the Holy Spirit says To day if ye will hear his voice eight Harden not your hearts as in the provocation In the day of the temptation in the wilderness nine Where your fathers tempted me Proved me and saw my works forty years ten Wherefore I was offended with that generation And I said They always go astray in their heart And they knew not my ways eleven As I swore in my wrath They shall not enter into my rest twelve Take heed brethren lest there shall be in any one of you an evil heart of unbelief in departing from the living God thirteen But exhort one another daily as long as it is called To day that no one of you may be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin fourteen For we have become partakers of Christ if we hold fast the beginning of our confidence firm unto the end fifteen When it is said To day if ye will hear his voice harden not your hearts as in the provocation sixteen who then when they had heard provoked Nay was it not all who came forth out of Egypt by Moses seventeen But with whom was he offended forty years Was it not with those who sinned whose carcasses fell in the wilderness eighteen And to whom did he swear that they should not enter into his rest but to those who believed not nineteen And we see that they were not able to enter in because of unbelief IV LET us fear therefore lest a promise being still left us of entering into his rest any one of you should seem to have come short of it two For to us were the glad tidings preached as also to them but the word which they heard did not profit them not being mingled with faith in those who heard three For we who believed enter into the rest as he said As I swore in my wrath they shall not enter into my rest although the works were finished from the foundation of the world four For he has spoken in a certain place of the seventh day thus And God rested on the seventh day from all his works five and in this again They shall not enter into my rest six Since then it remains that some do enter into it and they to whom the glad tidings were first preached entered not in because of unbelief again seven he limits a certain day To day saying in David after so long a time as has before been said To day if ye will hear his voice Harden not your hearts eight For if Joshua had given them rest he would not after this have spoken of another day nine So then there remains a Sabbath rest to the people of God ten For he that entered into his rest himself rested from his works as God did from his own eleven Let us therefore endeavor to enter into that rest that no one may fall into the same example of unbelief twelve For the word of God is living and powerful and sharper than any two edged sword piercing even to the dividing of soul and spirit of joints and marrow and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart thirteen And there is no creature that is not manifest in his sight but all things are naked and opened to the eyes of him with whom we have to do fourteen Having therefore a great high priest who has passed through the heavens Jesus the Son of God let us hold fast our profession fifteen For we have not a high priest who can not be touched with the feeling of our infirmities but who has in all points been tempted in like manner without sin sixteen Let us therefore come boldly to the throne of grace that we may obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need V FOR every high priest being taken from among men is appointed for men in things pertaining to God that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins two being able to bear with the ignorant and erring since he himself also is encompassed with infirmity three and on account of it he ought as for the people so also for himself to make offering for sins four And no one takes to himself the honor but being called by God as was also Aaron five So also Christ did not glorify himself to be made high priest but he who spoke to him Thou art my Son I this day have begotten thee six as also in another place he says Thou art a priest forever After the order of Melchizedek seven who in the days of his flesh offering up prayers and supplications with strong crying and tears to him who was able to save him from death and being heard on account of his godly fear eight though a Son yet learned from what he suffered the required obedience nine and being perfected became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey him ten called by God High Priest five ten after the order of Melchizedek eleven Of whom we have much to say and hard to be explained since ye have become dull of hearing twelve For though ye ought on account of the time to be teachers ye again have need that some one teach you the first principles of the oracles of God and are become such as have need of milk and not of solid food thirteen For every one who partakes of milk is inexperienced in the word of righteousness for he is a child fourteen But solid food belongs to those who are of full age who by use have their senses exercised to discern good and evil VI WHEREFORE leaving the first principles of the doctrine of Christ let us go on to perfection not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works and of faith toward God two of the doctrine of immersions and of the laying on of hands and of the resurrection of the dead and of eternal judgment three And this we will do six three if God permit four For it is impossible that they who have once been enlightened and have tasted of the heavenly gift and been made partakers of the Holy Spirit five and have tasted the good word of God and the powers of the world to come six and have fallen away should again be renewed to repentance seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh and put him to open shame seven For the earth which has drunk in the rain oft coming upon it and brings forth herbs fit for those for whose sake it is tilled receives blessing from God eight but if it bears thorns and briers it is rejected and is near to cursing whose end is to be burned nine But beloved we are persuaded of better things concerning you and things that accompany salvation though we thus speak ten For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and the love which ye showed toward his name in that ye ministered and still do minister to the saints eleven But we desire that each one of you show the same diligence for the full assurance of the hope unto the end twelve that ye may not become slothful but followers of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises thirteen For when God made the promise to Abraham because he could swear by none greater he swore by himself fourteen saying Surely blessing I will bless thee and multiplying I will multiply thee fifteen And so having patiently endured he obtained the promise sixteen For men indeed swear by the greater and the oath is to them an end of all gainsaying for a confirmation seventeen Wherein God wishing more abundantly to show to the heirs of the promise the immutability of his counsel interposed with an oath eighteen that by two immutable things in which it is impossible that God should lie we may have strong encouragement who fled for refuge to lay hold on the hope set before us nineteen which we have as an anchor of the soul sure and steadfast and entering within the vail twenty where as forerunner for us Jesus entered having become a high priest forever after the order of Melchizedek VII FOR this Melchizedek king of Salem priest of the most high God who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him two to whom also Abraham apportioned a tenth of all first indeed being interpreted King of righteousness and then also King of Salem which is King of peace three without father without mother without table of descent having neither beginning of days nor end of life seven three but likened to the Son of God remains a priest continually four Now consider how great this man was to whom Abraham the patriarch also gave a tenth of the spoils five And they indeed that are of the sons of Levi who receive the office of the priesthood have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law that is of their brethren though they have come out of the loins of Abraham six but he whose descent is not reckoned from them has taken tithes of Abraham and has blessed him who had the promises seven And without any contradiction the less is blessed by the better eight And here indeed men who die receive tithes but there one of whom it is testified that he lives nine And so to speak Levi also who receives tithes has paid tithes in Abraham ten for he was yet in the loins of his father when Melchizedek met him eleven If therefore perfection were by the Levitical priesthood for under it the people have received the law what further need was there that a different priest should arise after the order of Melchizedek and not be called after the order of Aaron twelve For the priesthood being changed of necessity there comes also a change of law thirteen For he of whom these things are spoken pertains to a different tribe of which no one has given attendance at the altar fourteen For it is evident that our Lord has arisen out of Judah of which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priests fifteen And it is yet more abundantly manifest if after the similitude of Melchizedek there arises a different priest sixteen who has been made not after the law of a carnal commandment but after the power of an indissoluble life seventeen For it is testified of him Thou art a priest forever After the order of Melchizedek eighteen For on the one hand there is an annulling of the commandment that went before on account of its weakness and unprofitableness nineteen for the law perfected nothing and on the other the bringing in of a better hope by which we draw near to God twenty And inasmuch as it was not without an oath twenty one for they indeed were made priests without an oath but he with an oath by him who said to him The Lord swore and will not repent thou art a priest forever after the order of Melchizedek seven twenty one twenty two by so much has Jesus become a surety of a better covenant twenty three And they indeed have been many priests because they were hindered by death from continuing twenty four but he because he remains forever has an unchangeable priesthood twenty five Whence also he is able to save to the utmost those who come to God through him since he ever lives to intercede for them twenty six For such a high priest became us holy harmless undefiled separated from sinners and made higher than the heavens twenty seven who has not necessity daily as the high priests to offer up sacrifices first for his own sins and then for those of the people for this he did once for all in offering up himself twenty eight For the law makes men high priests who have infirmity but the word of the oath which was since the law makes the Son who is perfected forever VIII NOW of the things which we are saying this is the chief We have such a high priest who sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty of the heavens two a minister of the holy places and of the true tabernacle which the Lord pitched and not man three For every high priest is appointed to offer gifts and sacrifices wherefore it is necessary that this one have something which he may offer four For if he were on earth he would not be a priest since there are those who offer gifts according to the law five who minister after an outline and a shadow of the heavenly things as Moses was admonished by God when he was about to make the tabernacle for See says he that thou make all things according to the pattern which was showed thee in the mount six But now he has obtained a more excellent ministry by so much as he is also mediator of a better covenant which has been established upon better promises seven For if that first had been faultless a place would not have been sought for the second eight For finding fault with them he says eight eight Behold the days are coming saith the Lord When I will make with the house of Israel And with the house of Judah a new covenant nine Not according to the covenant that I made for their fathers In the day when I took hold of their hand To bring them out of the land of Egypt Because they continued not in my covenant And I regarded them not saith the Lord ten For this is the covenant that I will establish for the house of Israel After those days saith the Lord Putting my laws into their mind And on their hearts I will write them And I will be to them a God And they shall be to me a people eleven And they shall not teach Each one his neighbor and each one his brother Saying Know the Lord Because all shall know me from the least to the greatest twelve Because I will be merciful to their unrighteousness And their sins and their iniquities I will remember no more thirteen In that he says A new he has made the first old Now that which is grown old and worn out with age is ready to vanish away IX NOW the first had indeed also ordinances of service and the worldly sanctuary two For a tabernacle was prepared the first wherein is the lamp stand and the table and the show bread which is called holy three And after the second vail the tabernacle which is called most holy four having a golden altar of incense and the ark of the covenant overlaid on
