every side with gold wherein was the golden pot containing the manna and the rod of Aaron which budded and the tables of the covenant five and above it the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat of which we can not now speak particularly six Now these things being thus prepared into the first tabernacle the priests enter at all times performing the services seven but into the second the high priest alone once every year not without blood which he offers for himself and for the errors of the people eight the Holy Spirit signifying this that the way into the holy places has not yet been made manifest while the first tabernacle is yet standing nine which is a figure for the time present under which are offered both gifts and sacrifices unable as to the conscience to perfect the worshiper ten only with meats and drinks nine ten and divers immersions ordinances of the flesh imposed until the time of reformation eleven But Christ having come as a high priest of the good things to come through the greater and more perfect tabernacle not made with hands that is not of this creation twelve and not through the blood of goats and calves but through his own blood entered once for all into the holy places obtaining eternal redemption thirteen For if the blood of goats and bulls and ashes of a heifer sprinkling those who have been defiled sanctifies to the purity of the flesh fourteen how much more shall the blood of Christ who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without spot to God cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God fifteen And for this cause he is mediator of a new covenant in order that death having taken place for the redemption of the transgressions under the first covenant they who have been called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance sixteen For where there is a testament nine sixteen there must also of necessity be brought in the death of the testator seventeen For a testament is of force after men are dead since it is of no strength at all while the testator lives eighteen Wherefore neither has the first been dedicated without blood nineteen For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law he took the blood of the calves and of the goats with water and scarlet wool and hyssop and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people saying twenty This is the blood of the covenant which God enjoined in respect to you twenty one And moreover the tabernacle and all the vessels of the service he in like manner sprinkled with blood twenty two And nearly all things are cleansed according to the law with blood and without shedding of blood there is no remission twenty three It was therefore necessary that the outlines of things in the heavens should be cleansed with these but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these twenty four For Christ entered not into holy places made with hands figures of the true but into heaven itself now to appear in the presence of God for us twenty five nor yet that he should many times offer himself as the high priest enters into the holy places every year with blood of others twenty six for then must he many times have suffered since the foundation of the world but now once in the end of the ages he has been manifested for the putting away of sin by the sacrifice of himself nine twenty six twenty seven And inasmuch as it is appointed to men once to die but after this the judgment twenty eight so also the Christ having been once offered to bear the sins of many will to those who look for him appear a second time without sin unto salvation X FOR the law having a shadow of the good things to come not the very image of the things can never with the same sacrifices which they offer year by year continually make those who come to them ten one perfect two For then would they not have ceased to be offered because the worshipers would have had no more consciousness of sins having once been cleansed three But in them there is a remembrance of sins year by year four For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins five Wherefore when he comes into the world he says Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not But a body didst thou prepare for me six In whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hadst no pleasure seven Then said I Lo I come In the volume of the book it is written of me To do thy will O God eight Saying above Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou wouldest not nor hadst pleasure therein which are offered by the law nine then has he said Lo I come to do thy will O God He takes away the first that he may establish the second ten In which will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all eleven And every priest ten eleven indeed stands daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices which can never take away sins twelve but he having offered one sacrifice for sins for ever sat down on the right hand of God thirteen from henceforth expecting until his enemies be made his footstool fourteen For by one offering he has perfected forever those who are sanctified fifteen Moreover the Holy Spirit also is a witness to us for after he had said sixteen This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days saith the Lord putting my laws upon their hearts and on their minds I will write them he further says seventeen and their sins and iniquities I will remember no more eighteen But where there is remission of these there is no longer offering for sin nineteen Having therefore brethren boldness as to the entrance into the holy places by the blood of Jesus which entrance he instituted for us twenty a new and living way through the vail that is to say his flesh twenty one and having a great priest over the house of God twenty two Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith having had our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience and having had our body washed with pure water twenty three let us hold fast the profession of the hope without wavering for he is faithful who promised twenty four and let us consider one another to incite to love and to good works twenty five not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together as is the custom of some but exhorting and so much the more as ye see the day approaching twenty six For if we willingly sin after having received the knowledge of the truth there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins twenty seven but a certain fearful looking for of judgment and a fiery indignation which will devour the adversaries twenty eight He that despised Moses law died without mercy under two or three witnesses twenty nine Of how much worse punishment suppose ye will he be thought worthy who has trodden under foot the Son of God and has accounted the blood of the covenant wherewith he was sanctified an unholy thing and has done despite to the Spirit of grace thirty For we know him who said To me belongs vengeance I will recompense saith the Lord and again The Lord will judge his people thirty one It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God thirty two But call to remembrance the former days in which after ye were enlightened ye endured a great contest of sufferings thirty three partly whilst ye were made a spectacle both by reproaches and afflictions and partly whilst ye became partakers with those who were so used thirty four For ye sympathized with those in bonds and ye took joyfully the plundering of your goods knowing that ye have for yourselves a better and an enduring substance thirty five Cast not away therefore your confidence which has great recompense of reward thirty six For ye have need of patience that having done the will of God ye may receive the promise thirty seven For yet a little while he that is to come will come and will not delay thirty eight Now the just shall live by faith but if he draw back my soul has no pleasure in him thirty nine But we are not of those who draw back unto perdition but of those who believe to the saving of the soul XI NOW faith is the assurance of things hoped for eleven one the conviction of things not seen two For in this the elders obtained a good report three Through faith we perceive that the worlds were framed by the word of God so that what is seen has not arisen eleven three out of things which appear four By faith Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain by which he received testimony that he was righteous God testifying of his gifts and through it being dead he yet speaks five By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death and he was not found because God translated him for before his translation he has had the testimony that he pleased God six But without faith it is impossible to please him for he who comes to God must believe that he is and that he is a rewarder to those who seek after him seven By faith Noah being warned by God concerning things not yet seen moved with fear prepared an ark for the saving of his house by which he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness which is according to faith eight By faith Abraham when called obeyed to go forth into a place which he should afterward receive for an inheritance and went forth not knowing whither he went nine By faith he sojourned in the land of promise as a foreign land dwelling in tents with Isaac and Jacob heirs with him of the same promise ten for he looked for the city which has the foundations whose builder and maker is God eleven By faith Sarah herself also received power to conceive seed even when she was past age because she accounted him faithful who had promised twelve Wherefore also there sprang from one and him become as dead even as the stars of heaven in multitude and as the sand which is by the sea shore innumerable thirteen These all died in faith not having received the promises but having seen them from afar and greeted them and professed that they were strangers and sojourners on the earth fourteen For they that say such things declare plainly that they are seeking a country fifteen And if indeed they had in mind that from which they came out they would have had opportunity to return sixteen But now eleven sixteen they desire a better that is a heavenly wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God for he prepared for them a city seventeen By faith Abraham when tried has offered up Isaac and he who had accepted the promises offered up his only begotten eighteen of whom it was said In Isaac shall thy seed be called nineteen accounting that God is able even to raise from the dead whence he also received him back in a figure twenty By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come twenty one By faith Jacob when dying blessed each of the sons of Joseph and he worshiped leaning on the top of his staff twenty two By faith Joseph when dying made mention of the departure of the sons of Israel and gave commandment concerning his bones twenty three By faith Moses when born was hidden three months by his parents because they saw that the child was fair and they feared not the king s commandment twenty four By faith Moses when grown up refused to be called son of a daughter of Pharaoh twenty five choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season twenty six esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures of Egypt for he looked for the reward twenty seven By faith he forsook Egypt not fearing the wrath of the king for he endured as seeing him who is invisible twenty eight Through faith he has kept the passover and the affusion of the blood that he who destroyed the first born might not touch them twenty nine By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry land which the Egyptians attempting were swallowed up thirty By faith the walls of Jericho fell after they had been encompassed during seven days thirty one By faith Rahab the harlot did not perish with those who believed not eleven thirty one after having received the spies with peace thirty two And why say I more For the time would fail me to tell of Gideon of Barak and Samson and Jephthah of David and Samuel and the prophets thirty three who through faith subdued kingdoms wrought righteousness obtained promises stopped the mouths of lions thirty four quenched the power of fire escaped the edge of the sword from weakness were made strong became mighty in war turned to flight the armies of the aliens thirty five Women received their dead by resurrection to life and others were tortured not accepting deliverance that they might obtain a better resurrection thirty six And others had trial of mockings and scourgings and moreover of bonds and imprisonment thirty seven They were stoned they were sawn asunder they were tempted they were slain with the sword they went about in sheep skins and goats skins being destitute afflicted tormented thirty eight of whom the world was not worthy wandering in deserts and mountains and caves and the clefts of the earth thirty nine And all these having obtained a good report through faith did not receive the promise forty God having provided something better concerning us that they should not without us be made perfect XII THEREFORE let us also having so great a cloud of witnesses surrounding us lay aside every weight and the easily besetting sin and with patience run the race that is set before us two looking away to the author and finisher of the faith Jesus who for the joy set before him endured the cross despising the shame and has sat down on the right hand of the throne of God three For consider him who has endured such contradiction by sinners against him that ye become not weary fainting in your souls four Not yet did ye resist unto blood contending against sin five and ye have forgotten the exhortation which discourses with you as with sons My son despise not the chastening of the Lord Nor faint when reproved by him six For whom the Lord loves he chastens And scourges every son whom he receives seven If ye endure chastening God deals with you as with sons for what son is there whom his father chastens not eight But if ye are without chastening of which all have been made partakers then are ye bastards and not sons nine Furthermore we had fathers of our flesh who chastened us and we gave them reverence shall we not much rather be in subjection to the Father of spirits and live ten For they indeed for a few days chastened us as seemed good to them but he for our profit that we might be partakers of his holiness eleven Now all chastening for the present indeed seems not joyous but grievous but afterward it yields the peaceable fruit of righteousness to those who have been exercised thereby twelve Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down and the feeble knees thirteen and make straight paths for your feet that the lame be not turned out of the way but rather be healed fourteen Follow peace with all and holiness without which no one shall see the Lord fifteen looking diligently lest any one come short of the grace of God lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you and the many be thereby defiled sixteen lest there be any fornicator or profane person as Esau who for one meal sold his birthright seventeen For ye know that he also afterward when he wished to inherit the blessing was rejected for he found no place of repentance though he sought after it with tears eighteen For ye have not come to a mount that is touched and burning with fire nor to blackness and darkness and tempest nineteen and the sound of a trumpet and the voice of words which voice they who heard refused that more should be spoken to them twenty for they could not bear that which was commanded Even if a beast touch the mountain it shall be stoned twenty one and so terrible was the sight that Moses said I fear and tremble twenty two But ye have come to mount Zion and to the city of the living God the heavenly Jerusalem and to myriads of angels twenty three to the general assembly and church of the first born who are enrolled in heaven and to God the Judge of all and to the spirits of just ones made perfect twenty four and to Jesus the mediator of the new covenant and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks better than Abel twenty five See that ye refuse not him who speaks for if they did not escape refusing him who declared the divine will on earth much more shall not we who turn away from him who speaks from heaven twenty six whose voice then shook the earth but now he has promised saying Yet once more I shake not the earth only but also heaven twenty seven And this Yet once more signifies the removing of the things shaken as of things that have been made that the things which are not shaken may remain twenty eight Wherefore receiving a kingdom which can not be shaken let us have grace whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear twenty nine for our God is a consuming fire XIII LET brotherly love continue two Be not forgetful to entertain strangers for thereby some entertained angels unawares three Remember those in bonds as bound with them those in adversity as being yourselves also in the body four Marriage is honorable in all and the bed undefiled thirteen four but fornicators and adulterers God will judge five Let your disposition be without covetousness and be content with what ye have for he has said I will never leave thee nor forsake thee six So that we boldly say The Lord is my helper and I will not fear What shall man do to me seven Remember those who were your leaders who spoke to you the word of God considering the end of whose manner of life imitate their faith eight Jesus Christ is yesterday and to day the same and forever nine Be not carried away with various and strange teachings for it is good that the heart be established with grace not with meats which did not profit those who walked therein ten We have an altar whereof they have no right to eat who serve the tabernacle eleven For the bodies of those beasts whose blood is brought into the holy places by the high priest for sin are burned without the camp twelve Wherefore Jesus also that he might sanctify the people through his own blood suffered without the gate thirteen So then let us go forth to him without the camp bearing his reproach fourteen For here we have not an abiding city but are seeking for that which is to come fifteen Through him therefore let us offer up the sacrifice of praise to God continually that is the fruit of lips giving thanks to his name sixteen But to do good and to communicate forget not for with such sacrifices God is well pleased seventeen Obey those who are your leaders and submit for they watch for your souls as those who shall give account that they may do this with joy and not with sighing for that is unprofitable for you eighteen Pray for us for we are persuaded that we have a good conscience in all things desiring to deport ourselves well nineteen But I the more earnestly beseech you to do this that I may the sooner be restored to you twenty Now the God of peace who brought up from the dead our Lord Jesus the great Shepherd of the sheep in virtue of the blood of an eternal covenant twenty one make you perfect in every good work to do his will doing in you that which is well pleasing in his sight through Jesus Christ to whom be the glory forever and ever Amen twenty two But I beseech you brethren bear with the word of exhortation for I wrote to you in few words twenty three Know that the brother Timothy has been set at liberty with whom if he come shortly I will see you twenty four Salute all that are your leaders and all the saints Those of Italy salute you twenty five Grace be with you all Amen THE GENERAL LETTER OF JAMES I JAMES a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ to the twelve tribes which are scattered abroad one one greeting two Count it all joy my brethren when ye fall into various temptations three knowing that the proving of your faith works patience four But let patience have a perfect work that ye may be perfect and entire lacking in nothing five But if any one of you is lacking in wisdom let him ask of God who gives to all liberally and upbraids not and it will be given him six But let him ask in faith nothing wavering for he that wavers is like a wave of the sea driven by the wind and tossed seven For let not that man suppose that he shall receive anything from the Lord eight a double minded man unstable in all his ways nine Let the brother of low degree glory in that he is exalted ten but the rich in that he is made low because as the flower of the grass he will pass away eleven For the sun rose with the burning heat and withered the grass and its flower fell off and the grace of its fashion perished so also will the rich man fade away in his ways twelve Happy is the man that endures temptation because when he is approved he will receive the crown of life which He promised to those who love him thirteen Let no one say when he is tempted I am tempted by God for God can not be tempted with evil and himself tempts no one fourteen But each one is tempted when by his own lust he is drawn away and enticed fifteen Then lust having conceived brings forth sin and sin when completed brings forth death sixteen Do not err my beloved brethren seventeen Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above coming down from the Father of the lights with whom there is no variableness or shadow of turning eighteen Of his own will he begot us with the word of truth that we should be a kind of first fruits of his creatures nineteen So that my beloved brethren let every man be swift to hear slow to speak slow to wrath twenty for the wrath of man works not the righteousness of God twenty one Wherefore putting off all filthiness and excess of wickedness receive with meekness the implanted word which is able to save your souls twenty two But be doers of the word and not hearers only deceiving yourselves twenty three For if any one is a hearer of the word and not a doer he is like to a man beholding his natural face in a mirror twenty four For he beheld himself and has gone away and immediately he forgot what manner of man he was twenty five But he who looked into the perfect law the law of liberty and remained thereby being not a forgetful hearer but a doer of work this man shall be happy in his doing twenty six If any one thinks that he is religious and bridles not his tongue but deceives his own heart this man s religion is vain twenty seven Religion pure and undefiled before God and the Father is this To visit the orphans and widows in their affliction to keep himself unspotted from the world II MY brethren hold not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ the Lord of glory with respect of persons two For if there have come into your assembly a man with a gold ring in gay clothing and there have come in also a poor man in mean clothing three and ye have respect to him that wears the gay clothing and say Sit thou here in a good place and say to the poor man Stand thou there or Sit under my footstool four were ye not partial in yourselves and become judges with evil thoughts five Hearken my beloved brethren Did not God choose the poor as to this world two five to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom which he promised to those who love him six But ye dishonored the poor man Do not the rich oppress you and do not they drag you before the judgment seats seven Do not they blaspheme the worthy name by which ye are called eight If indeed ye fulfill the royal law according to the scripture Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself ye do well nine But if ye have respect to persons ye commit sin being convicted by the law as transgressors ten For whoever shall keep the whole law and yet offend in one point he is guilty of all eleven For he who said Do not commit adultery said also Do not kill Now if thou commit not adultery yet if thou kill thou art become a transgressor of the law twelve So speak and so do as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty thirteen For the judgment shall be without mercy to him that showed no mercy Mercy glories over judgment fourteen What does it profit my brethren if any one say that he has faith and have not works Can the faith save him fifteen But if a brother or a sister be naked and destitute of daily food sixteen and one of you say to them Depart in peace be warmed and be filled but ye give them not the things needful for the body what does it profit seventeen So also faith if it has not works is dead in itself eighteen But some will say Thou hast faith and I have works show me thy faith without the works and I will show thee the faith by my works nineteen Thou believest that God is one Thou doest well the demons also believe and tremble twenty But wilt thou know O vain man that faith without works is dead twenty one Was not Abraham our father justified by works when he offered Isaac his son upon the altar twenty two Thou seest that faith wrought with his works and by works was faith made complete twenty three And the scripture was fulfilled which says Abraham believed God and it was reckoned to him for righteousness and he was called Friend of God twenty four Ye see that by works a man is justified and not by faith only twenty five And in like manner was not also Rahab the harlot justified by works when she received the messengers and sent them out by another way twenty six For as the body without the spirit is dead so also faith without works is dead III MY brethren be not many teachers knowing that we shall receive greater condemnation two For in many things we all offend If any one offends not in word the same is a perfect man able to bridle also the whole body three Now if we put the bits into the horses mouths three three that they may obey us we turn about also their whole body four Behold also the ships though they are so great and driven by fierce winds are turned about by a very small helm whithersoever the steersman may desire five So also the tongue is a little member and boasts great things Behold how great a forest a little fire kindles six And the tongue is a fire that world of iniquity The tongue among our members is that which defiles the whole body and sets on fire the course of life and is set on fire by hell seven For every nature of beasts and birds of reptiles and things in the sea is tamed and has been tamed by the nature of man eight But the tongue no man can tame a restless evil full of deadly poison nine Therewith we bless the Lord and Father and therewith we curse men who have been made after the likeness of God ten Out of the same mouth comes forth blessing and cursing My brethren these things ought not so to be eleven Does the fountain out of the same opening send forth the sweet and the bitter twelve Can a fig tree my brethren bear olives or a vine figs Neither can salt water yield fresh thirteen Who is wise and endued with knowledge among you Let him show out of his good deportment his works in meekness of wisdom fourteen But if ye have bitter envying and strife in your hearts do not glory and lie against the truth fifteen This wisdom is not one that comes down from above but earthly sensual three sixteen devilish sixteen For where there is emulation and strife there is confusion and every evil work seventeen But the wisdom from above is first pure then peaceable forbearing easily persuaded full of mercy and good fruits without partiality and without hypocrisy eighteen And the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace by those who work peace IV FROM whence are wars and from whence are fightings among you Are they not from hence from your lusts that war in your members two Ye desire and have not ye kill and envy and can not obtain ye fight and war Ye have not because ye ask not three ye ask and receive not because ye ask amiss that ye may consume it upon your lusts four Ye adulteresses know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God Whoever therefore desires to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God five Do ye think that the Scripture says in vain the spirit he made to dwell in us has jealous longings six But he gives the more grace Wherefore he says God resists the proud But gives grace to the humble seven Submit yourselves therefore to God Resist the Devil and he will flee from you eight Draw nigh to God and he will draw nigh to you Cleanse your hands ye sinners and purify your hearts ye double minded nine Be afflicted and mourn and weep let your laughter be turned into mourning and your joy into heaviness ten Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord and he will exalt you eleven Do not speak against one another brethren He that speaks against his brother or judges his brother speaks against the law and judges the law But if thou judge the law thou art not a doer of the law but a judge twelve One is the lawgiver and judge he who is able to save and to destroy Who art thou that judgest thy neighbor thirteen Come now ye that say To day and to morrow we will go into this city and spend one year there and buy and sell and get gain fourteen whereas ye know not what belongs to the morrow for what is your life for ye are a vapor that appears for a little time and then vanishes away fifteen instead of saying If the Lord will we shall both live and do this or that sixteen But now ye glory in your boastings All such glorying is evil seventeen Therefore to him that knows to do good and does it not to him it is sin V COME now ye rich weep wailing for your miseries that are coming upon you two Your riches are corrupted and your garments are become moth eaten three Your gold and silver is rusted and the rust of them will be a witness against you and will eat your flesh as fire Ye heaped up treasure in the last days four Behold the hire of the laborers who reaped your fields which is fraudulently kept back by you cries out and the cries of those who reaped have entered into the ears of the Lord of Sabaoth five four five Ye have been luxurious on the earth and lived in pleasure ye have nourished your hearts in the day of slaughter six Ye have condemned ye have killed the just he does not resist you seven Be patient therefore brethren until the coming of the Lord Behold the husbandman waits for the precious fruit of the earth being patient over it till it shall have received the early and latter rain eight Be ye also patient establish your hearts because the coming of the Lord draws nigh nine Murmur not against one another brethren that ye be not judged Behold the judge stands before the door ten Take my brethren the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord for an example of affliction and of patience eleven Behold we count those happy who endure Ye heard of the patience of Job and saw the end of the Lord five eleven that the Lord is very pitiful and of tender mercy twelve But above all things my brethren swear not neither by heaven nor by the earth nor by any other oath but let your yea be yea and your nay nay that ye fall not under condemnation thirteen Is any afflicted among you let him pray Is any cheerful let him sing praise fourteen Is any sick among you let him call for the elders of the church and let them pray over him anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord fifteen And the prayer of faith will save the sick and the Lord will raise him up and even if he have committed sins it will be forgiven him sixteen Confess therefore your trespasses to one another and pray for one another that ye may be healed The earnest prayer of a righteous man avails much seventeen Elijah was a man of like nature with us and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain and it rained not on the earth for three years and six months eighteen And again he prayed and the heaven gave rain and the earth brought forth her fruit nineteen Brethren if any one among you be led astray from the truth and one convert him twenty let him know that he who converts a sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death and will hide a multitude of sins THE FIRST GENERAL LETTER OF PETER I PETER an apostle of Jesus Christ to the strangers scattered one one through Pontus Galatia Cappadocia Asia and Bithynia two chosen according to the foreknowledge of God the Father in sanctification of the Spirit unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ Grace and peace be multiplied to you three Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ who according to his abundant mercy begot us again unto a living hope one three through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead four unto an inheritance imperishable and undefiled and unfading reserved in heaven for you five who by the power of God are kept through faith unto a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time six Wherein ye greatly rejoice though now for a little time if need be made sorrowful by manifold trials seven that the proof of your faith much more precious than gold that perishes but is proved by fire may be found unto praise and glory and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ eight whom having not seen ye love in whom though now ye see him not yet believing ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory nine receiving the end of your faith the salvation of your souls ten Concerning which salvation the prophets diligently sought and searched who prophesied of the grace toward you eleven searching as to what or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them signified when it testified beforehand the sufferings destined for Christ and the glories that should follow twelve to whom it was revealed that not to themselves but to you they were ministering them which now have been announced to you through those who brought you the good news by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven which things angels desire to look into thirteen Wherefore girding up the loins of your mind be sober and hope perfectly for the grace that is to be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ fourteen as children of obedience not conforming yourselves to the former lusts in your ignorance fifteen but as he who called you is holy be ye yourselves holy in all your deportment sixteen because it is written Ye shall be holy for I am holy seventeen And if ye call him Father one seventeen who without respect of persons judges according to each one s work pass the time of your sojourning in fear eighteen knowing that not with perishable things silver and gold ye were redeemed from your vain course of life received by tradition from your fathers nineteen but with the precious blood of Christ as of a lamb without blemish and without spot twenty who was foreknown indeed before the foundation of the world but manifested in these last times for you twenty one who through him believe on God who raised him from the dead and gave him glory so that your faith and hope are on God twenty two Having purified your souls in obeying the truth unto unfeigned brotherly love love one another from the heart fervently twenty three being born again not of perishable seed but of imperishable through the word of God which lives and abides forever twenty four Because All flesh is as grass And all its glory as the flower of grass The grass withered and its flower fell off twenty five But the word of the Lord abides forever And this is the word which was preached to you II LAYING aside therefore all malice and all guile and hypocrisies and envyings and all backbitings two as newborn babes long for the spiritual unadulterated milk that ye thereby may grow unto salvation three if indeed ye tasted that the Lord is gracious four to whom coming a living stone disallowed indeed by men but with God chosen honored five ye yourselves also as living stones are built up two five a spiritual house a holy priesthood to offer up spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ six Because it is contained in the Scripture Behold I lay in Zion a chief corner stone chosen honored and he that believes on him shall not be put to shame seven To you therefore who believe is the honor but to the disobedient the stone which the builders disallowed the same is become the head of the corner eight and a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense who stumble being disobedient to the word to which they were also appointed nine But ye are a chosen generation a royal priesthood a holy nation a people for a possession that ye should show forth the excellencies of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light ten who once were not a people but are now the people of God who had not obtained mercy but now have obtained mercy eleven Beloved I exhort you as sojourners and strangers to abstain from fleshly lusts which war against the soul twelve having your deportment honorable among the Gentiles that wherein they speak against you as evil doers they may from your good works beholding them glorify God in the day of visitation thirteen Submit yourselves to every human institution for the Lord s sake whether to the king as pre eminent fourteen or to governors as being sent by him for the punishment of evil doers and the praise of those who do well fifteen For so is the will of God that with well doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of the foolish men sixteen as free and as not having your freedom for a vail of wickedness but as God s servants seventeen Honor all men love the brotherhood fear God honor the king eighteen ye servants being in subjection to your masters with all fear not only to the good and reasonable but also to the perverse nineteen For this is acceptable if a man for conscience toward God two nineteen endures griefs suffering wrongfully twenty For what glory is it if when ye are beaten for your faults ye shall take it patiently But if when ye do well and suffer for it ye take it patiently this is acceptable with God twenty one For to this ye were called because Christ also suffered for you leaving you an example that ye should follow his steps twenty two who committed no sin neither was guile found in his mouth twenty three who when he was reviled reviled not again when he suffered threatened not but committed it to him who judges righteously twenty four who himself bore our sins in his own body on the tree that we having died to our sins should live to righteousness by whose stripes ye were healed twenty five For ye were going astray like sheep but have returned now unto the Shepherd and Overseer of your souls III IN like manner ye wives being in subjection to your own husbands that even if any obey not the word they may without the word be won by the deportment of their wives two when they behold your chaste deportment coupled with fear three Whose adorning let it not be the outward one of braiding the hair and of wearing golden ornaments or of putting on apparel four but the hidden man of the heart in that which is imperishable of the meek and quiet spirit which in the sight of God is of great price five For so in the old time the holy women also who hoped in God adorned themselves being in subjection to their own husbands six as Sarah obeyed Abraham calling him lord of whom ye became children doing good and fearing no alarm seven Ye husbands in like manner dwelling with them according to knowledge giving honor to the female as the weaker vessel as also heirs together of the grace of life that your prayers be not hindered eight Finally all being of one mind sympathizing loving the brethren tender hearted humble minded nine not rendering evil for evil or railing for railing but on the contrary blessing because to this end ye were called that ye might inherit blessing ten For he who desires to love life and to see good days let him refrain his tongue from evil and his lips from speaking guile eleven let him turn away from evil and do good let him seek peace and pursue it twelve Because the eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous and his ears are toward their supplications but the face of the Lord is against those who do evil thirteen And who is he that shall harm you if ye are followers of that which is good fourteen But if ye even suffer for righteousness sake happy are ye but fear not with their fear nor be troubled fifteen but sanctify Christ as Lord in your hearts ready always to give an answer to every one that asks you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear sixteen having a good conscience that wherein they speak against you as evil doers they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good deportment in Christ seventeen For it is better if it be the will of God that ye suffer for well doing than for evil doing eighteen Because Christ also suffered once for sins the just for the unjust that he might bring us to God being put to death in the flesh but made alive by the Spirit nineteen in which also he went and preached to the spirits in prison twenty who were disobedient in times past when the long suffering of God waited in the days of Noah while the ark was preparing wherein a few that is eight souls were saved through water twenty one which in an antitype immersion now saves us also not the putting away of the filth of the flesh but the requirement of a good conscience toward God by the resurrection of Jesus Christ twenty two who is on the right hand of God having gone into heaven angels and authorities and powers being made subject to him IV CHRIST then having suffered for us in the flesh do ye also arm yourselves with the same mind because he who suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin two that ye no longer may live the remaining time in the flesh by the lusts of men but by the will of God three For the time past suffices us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles when we walked in wantonness lusts excess of wine revelings carousings and unhallowed idolatries four at which thing they are astonished as ye run not with them to the same excess of riot speaking evil of you five who shall give account to him who is ready to judge the living and the dead six For to this end was the good news preached also to those who are dead that they might indeed be judged according to men in the flesh but may live according to God in the spirit seven But the end of all things is at hand Be therefore sober and watch unto prayer eight but above all things having your love toward one another fervent because love covers a multitude of sins nine hospitable to one another without grudging ten according as each received a gift ministering the same to one another as good stewards of the manifold grace of God eleven if any one speaks as uttering God s oracles if any one ministers as of the ability which God bestows that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ to whom is the glory and the dominion forever and ever Amen twelve Beloved be not astonished at the fiery test taking place among you to prove you as though a strange thing were befalling you thirteen but in so far as ye share in Christ s sufferings rejoice that also at the revelation of his glory ye may rejoice with exceeding joy fourteen If ye are reproached for the name of Christ happy are ye because the spirit of glory and of God rests upon you on their part he is evil spoken of but on your part he is glorified four fourteen fifteen For let none of you suffer as a murderer or a thief or an evil doer or as a busy body in other men s matters sixteen but if as a Christian let him not be ashamed but let him glorify God in this name seventeen Because the time is come that judgment should begin from the house of God but if it begin first from us what shall be the end of those who obey not the gospel of God eighteen And if the righteous is with difficulty saved where shall the ungodly and the sinner appear nineteen Wherefore let those also who suffer according to the will of God commit the keeping of their souls to him in well doing as to a faithful Creator V THE elders among you I exhort who am a fellow elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ who am also a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed two tend the flock of God which is among you overseeing it not by constraint but willingly not for base gain but with good will three neither as being lords over the heritage but being examples to the flock four And when the chief Shepherd is manifested ye shall receive the unfading crown of glory five In like manner ye younger submit yourselves to the elder Yea all of you submitting to one another gird yourselves with humility because God resists the proud but gives grace to the humble six Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God that he may exalt you in due time seven casting all your care upon him because he cares for you eight Be sober be watchful Your adversary the Devil as a roaring lion walks about seeking whom he may devour nine whom resist steadfast in the faith knowing that the same sufferings are being accomplished in your brethren that are in the world ten But the God of all grace who called you to his eternal glory in Christ Jesus after ye have suffered a little while make you perfect establish strengthen settle you eleven To him be the glory and the dominion forever and ever Amen twelve By Silvanus the faithful brother as I consider I wrote to you in few words exhorting and testifying that this is the true grace of God wherein ye stand thirteen The church that is in Babylon chosen with you salutes you five thirteen and Mark my son fourteen Salute one another with a kiss of love Peace to you all that are in Christ THE SECOND GENERAL LETTER OF PETER I SIMON PETER a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ to those who have obtained like precious faith with us in the righteousness of our God and Savior Jesus Christ two Grace and peace be multiplied to you in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord three Seeing that his divine power has given us all things that pertain to life and godliness through the knowledge of him who called us by his own glory and might four through which he has given us exceeding great and precious promises that by these ye may become partakers of the divine nature having escaped from the corruption that is in the world through lust five yea for this very reason giving all diligence add to your faith fortitude and to fortitude knowledge one five six and to knowledge self control and to self control patience and to patience godliness seven and to godliness brotherly kindness and to brotherly kindness love eight For if these things are in you and abound they cause that ye shall not be inactive nor unfruitful in attaining to the full knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ nine But he that lacks these things is blind not seeing afar off having forgotten the cleansing away of his old sins ten Wherefore the rather brethren give diligence to make your calling and election sure for if ye do these things ye shall never fall eleven For so shall be richly ministered to you the entrance into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ twelve Wherefore I will not neglect to put you always in remembrance of these things though ye know them and are established in the truth that is with you thirteen But I think it right so long as I am in this tabernacle to stir you up by putting you in remembrance fourteen knowing that I must soon put off my tabernacle one fourteen as also our Lord Jesus Christ showed me fifteen Moreover I will endeavor that at all times ye may be able after my departure to call these things to mind sixteen For we did not follow cunningly devised fables when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ but had been eye witnesses of his majesty seventeen For he received from God the Father honor and glory when such a voice was borne to him from the excellent glory This is my beloved Son in whom I am well pleased eighteen and this voice we heard borne from heaven being with him in the holy mount nineteen And we have more sure the prophetic word to which ye do well that ye take heed as to a lamp shining in a dark place until the day dawn and the day star arise in your hearts twenty knowing this first that no prophecy of the Scripture comes of private interpretation twenty one for prophecy was never brought by the will of man but moved by the Holy Spirit men spoke from God II BUT there were false prophets also among the people as there will be false teachers among you also who stealthily will bring in destructive factions even denying as Master him who bought them bringing upon themselves swift destruction two And many will follow their dissolute ways by reason of whom the way of truth will be evil spoken of three And in covetousness will they with feigned words make merchandise of you for whom the judgment from of old lingers not and their destruction slumbers not four For if God spared not angels having sinned but casting them down to hell delivered them over to chains of darkness two four reserved unto judgment five and spared not the old world but kept Noah the eighth person a preacher of righteousness bringing the flood on the world of ungodly men six and turning to ashes the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah condemned them to overthrow having made them an example of those who should afterward live ungodly seven and delivered righteous Lot wearied out with the lewd conduct of the lawless eight for that righteous man dwelling among them with seeing and hearing vexed his righteous soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds nine the Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptation and to reserve the unjust under punishment to the day of judgment ten but chiefly those who walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness and despise dominion Presumptuous self willed they are not afraid to rail at dignities eleven whereas angels being greater in strength and power bring not a railing judgment against them before the Lord twelve But these as natural brute beasts born to be taken two twelve and destroyed railing at things that they understand not shall utterly perish in their own corruption thirteen receiving the wages of unrighteousness as they who account reveling for a day pleasure spots and blemishes reveling in their own deceits while feasting with you fourteen having eyes full of the adulteress and that cease not from sin alluring unstable souls having a heart exercised in covetousness children of a curse fifteen forsaking the right way they went astray following the way of Balaam the son of Bosor who loved the wages of unrighteousness sixteen but was rebuked for his iniquity the dumb ass speaking with man s voice forbade the madness of the prophet seventeen These are wells without water mists driven by a tempest to whom the blackness of darkness is reserved forever eighteen For speaking swelling words of vanity in lusts of the flesh they allure by wanton ways such as partly escape those who live in error nineteen promising them liberty while they themselves are servants of corruption for by what a man is overcome by the same he is also brought into bondage twenty For if having escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christy but having again become entangled therein they are overcome the last state is become worse with them than the first twenty one For it were better for them not to have known the way of righteousness than having known it to turn back from the holy commandment delivered to them twenty two But it has happened to them according to the true proverb A dog returned to his own vomit and A sow that was washed to the wallowing in the mire III THIS second letter beloved I now write to you in both which I stir up your pure mind by putting you in remembrance two that ye may be mindful of the words spoken before by the holy prophets and of the commandment of the Lord and Savior by your apostles three knowing this first that there shall come in the last of the days scoffers in their scoffings walking after their own lusts four and saying Where is the promise of his coming for from the day the fathers fell asleep all things so continue from the beginning of the creation five For of this they willingly are ignorant that by the word of God there were heavens of old and earth framed out of water and by means of water six whereby the world that then was being overflowed with water perished seven but the heavens that now are and the earth by his word are kept in store being reserved for fire unto the day of judgment and of perdition of ungodly men eight But beloved be not ignorant of this one thing that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years and a thousand years as one day nine The Lord is not tardy in respect to the promise as some account tardiness but is long suffering toward us three nine not wishing that any should perish but that all should come to repentance ten But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in which the heavens will pass away with a rushing noise and the elements will be dissolved with burning heat and the earth and the works therein will be burned up eleven Seeing then that all these things are dissolving what manner of men ought ye to be in all holy deportment and godliness twelve looking for and hastening the coming of the day of God because of which the heavens being on fire will be dissolved and the elements will melt with burning heat thirteen But according to his promise we look for new heavens and a new earth wherein dwells righteousness fourteen Wherefore beloved seeing that ye look for these things be diligent that ye may be found without spot and blameless in his sight in peace fifteen And the long suffering of our Lord account salvation as also our beloved brother Paul according to the wisdom given him wrote to you sixteen as also in all his letters speaking in them of these things in which things are some that are hard to be understood which they that are unlearned and unstable wrest as also the other Scriptures unto their own destruction seventeen Ye therefore beloved seeing ye know beforehand beware lest being carried away with the error of the lawless ye fall from your own steadfastness eighteen But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ To him be the glory both now and forever Amen THE FIRST GENERAL LETTER OF JOHN I THAT which was from the beginning that which we have heard that which we have seen with our eyes that which we looked upon and our hands handled concerning the Word of life two and the life was manifested and we have seen and bear witness and report to you the eternal life which was with the Father and was manifested to us three that which we have seen and have heard we report to you also that ye also may have fellowship with us and indeed our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ four And these things we write to you that your joy may be full five And this is the message which we have heard from him and announce to you That God is light and in him there is no darkness six If we say that we have fellowship with him and walk in the darkness we lie and do not the truth seven but if we walk in the light as he is in the light we have fellowship with one another and the blood of Jesus Christ one seven his Son cleanses us from all sin eight If we say that we have not sin we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us nine If we confess our sins he is faithful and righteous that he may forgive us our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness ten If we say that we have not sinned we make him a liar and his word is not in us II MY little children these things I write to you that ye may not sin And if any one have sinned we have an advocate with the Father Jesus Christ the righteous two And he is a propitiation for our sins and not for ours only but also for the whole world three And in this we know that we know him if we keep his commandments four He that says I know him and keeps not his commandments is a liar and the truth is not in him five But whoever keeps his word of a truth in him the love of God is perfected In this we know that we are in him six He that says he abides in him ought as he walked himself also so to walk seven Beloved I write not to you a new commandment but an old commandment which ye had from the beginning The old commandment is the word which ye heard from the beginning two seven eight Again a new commandment I write to you which thing is true in him and in you because the darkness is passing away and the true light now shines nine He that says he is in the light and hates his brother is in the darkness until now ten He that loves his brother abides in the light and there is no occasion of stumbling in him eleven But he that hates his brother is in the darkness and walks in the darkness and knows not where he goes because the darkness blinded his eyes twelve I write to you little children because your sins have been forgiven you for his name s sake thirteen I write to you fathers because ye know him that was from the beginning I write to you young men because ye have overcome the evil one I wrote to you little children because ye know the Father fourteen I wrote to you fathers because ye know him that was from the beginning I wrote to you young men because ye are strong and the word of God abides in you and ye have overcome the evil one fifteen Love not the world neither the things in the world If any one loves the world the love of the Father is not in him sixteen Because all that is in the world the lust of the flesh and the lust of the eyes and the empty pomp of life is not of the Father but is of the world seventeen And the world is passing away and the lust thereof but he that does the will of God abides forever eighteen Little children it is the last time and as ye heard that antichrist should come even now many antichrists have arisen from whence we know that it is the last time nineteen They went out from among us but they were not of us for if they had been of us they would have remained with us but it was in order that they might be made manifest that all are not of us twenty And ye have an anointing from the Holy One and know all things twenty one I wrote not to you because ye do not know the truth but because ye know it and because no lie is of the truth twenty two Who is the liar but he that denies that Jesus is the Christ This is the antichrist who denies the Father and the Son twenty three Every one that denies the Son the same has not the Father he that acknowledges the Son has also the Father twenty four What ye heard from the beginning let it abide in you If what ye heard from the beginning shall abide in you ye also will abide in the Son and in the Father twenty five And this is the promise which he himself promised to us the life eternal twenty six These things I wrote to you concerning those who seduce you twenty seven And the anointing which ye received from him abides in you and ye have no need that any one teach you but as the same anointing teaches you concerning all things and is truth and is not a lie and even as it taught you abide in him twenty eight And now little children abide in him that if he should be manifested we may have confidence and not turn away from him with shame at his coming twenty nine If ye know that he is righteous ye know that every one that does righteousness has been begotten of him III BEHOLD what manner of love the Father has given to us that we should be called children of God For this cause the world knows not us because it knew not him two Beloved now are we the children of God and it was never yet manifested what we shall be We know that if it shall be manifested we shall be like him because we shall see him as he is three And every one that has this hope on him purifies himself even as he is pure four Every one that commits sin also commits transgression of law and sin is transgression of law five And ye know that he was manifested that he might take away our three five sins and in him is no sin six Every one that abides in him sins not whoever sins has not seen him neither has known him seven Little children let no one deceive you He that does righteousness is righteous even as he is righteous eight He that commits sin is of the Devil because the Devil sins from the beginning To this end the Son of God was manifested that he might destroy the works of the Devil nine Whoever has been begotten of God does not commit sin because his seed abides in him and he can not sin because he has been begotten of God ten In this are manifest the children of God and the children of the Devil Every one that does not righteousness is not of God neither he that loves not his brother eleven because this is the message that ye heard from the beginning that we should love one another twelve Not as Cain was of the evil one and slew his brother And wherefore did he slay him Because his own works were evil and his brother s righteous thirteen Wonder not brethren if the world hates you fourteen We know that we have passed out of death into life because we love the brethren He that loves not his brother three fourteen abides in death fifteen Every one that hates his brother is a murderer three fifteen and ye know that no murderer has eternal life abiding in him sixteen In this we know love that he laid down his life for us and we ought to lay down our lives for the brethren seventeen But whoever has the world s sustenance and sees his brother having need and shuts up his pity from him how abides the love of God in him eighteen Little children let us not love in word neither in tongue but in deed and in truth nineteen And in this we shall know that we are of the truth and shall assure our hearts before him twenty Because if our heart accuse us God is greater than our heart and knows all things three twenty twenty one Beloved if our heart accuse us not we have confidence toward God twenty two And whatever we ask we receive of him because we keep his commandments and do the things that are pleasing in his sight twenty three And this is his commandment that we should believe on the name of his Son Jesus Christ and should love one another as he gave us commandment twenty four And he that keeps his commandments abides in him and he in him And in this we know that he abides in us from the Spirit which he gave us IV BELOVED believe not every spirit but try the spirits whether they are of God because many false prophets have gone forth into the world two In this ye know the Spirit of God three Every spirit that acknowledges that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God and every spirit that does not acknowledge Jesus is not of God and this is that of the antichrist of which ye have heard that it should come and now it is already in the world four Ye are of God little children and have overcome them because greater is he who is in you than he who is in the world five They are of the world for this cause they speak of the world and the world hears them six We are of God he that knows God hears us he that is not of God hears us not From this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error seven Beloved let us love one another because love is of God and every one that loves has been begotten of God and knows God eight He that loves not knew not God because God is love nine In this was manifested the love of God in respect to us that God has sent his only begotten Son into the world that we might live through him ten Herein is love not that we loved God but that he loved us and sent his Son a propitiation for our sins eleven Beloved if God so loved us we also ought to love one another twelve No man has ever seen God If we love one another God abides in us and the love of him is perfected in us thirteen In this we know that we abide in him and he in us because he has given us of his Spirit fourteen And we have seen and bear witness that the Father has sent forth the Son a Savior of the world fifteen Whoever acknowledges that Jesus is the Son of God God abides in him and he in God sixteen And we have known and have believed the love that God has in respect to us God is love and he that abides in love abides in God and God in him seventeen In this has love been perfected with us four seventeen that we have confidence in the day of judgment because as he is we also are in this world eighteen There is no fear in love but perfect love casts out fear because fear has torment four eighteen and he that fears is not made perfect in love nineteen We love because he first loved us twenty If any one say I love God and hates his brother he is a liar for he that loves not his brother whom he has seen how can he love God whom he has not seen twenty one And this commandment we have from him that he who loves God love also his brother V EVERY one who believes that Jesus is the Christ has been begotten of God and every one that loves him who begot loves also him that has been begotten of him two In this we know that we love the children of God when we love God and do his commandments three For this is the love of God that we keep his commandments And his commandments are not burdensome four because all that is begotten of God overcomes the world and this is the victory that overcomes the world our faith five Who is he that overcomes the world but he that believes that Jesus is the Son of God six This is he who came by water and blood Jesus the Christ not in the water only but in the water and in the blood And the Spirit is that which bears witness because the Spirit is the truth seven For there are three who bear witness the Spirit and the water and the blood eight and the three agree in the one five eight nine If we receive the witness of men the witness of God is greater for this is the witness of God that he has borne witness concerning his Son ten He that believes on the Son of God has the witness in himself he that believes not God has made him a liar because he has not believed in the witness which God has borne concerning his Son eleven And this is the witness that God gave to us eternal life and this life is in his Son twelve He that has the Son has the life he that has not the Son of God has not the life thirteen These things I wrote to you that ye may know that ye have eternal life who believe on the name of the Son of God fourteen And this is the confidence that we have toward him that if we ask anything according to his will he hears us fifteen And if we know that he hears us whatever we ask we know that we have the petitions which we have asked of him sixteen If any one see his brother sin a sin not unto death he shall ask and he will give him life to those who sin not unto death There is a sin unto death for that I do not say that he shall pray seventeen All unrighteousness is sin and there is a sin not unto death eighteen We know that every one who has been begotten of God sins not but he that was begotten of God keeps himself and the evil one touches him not nineteen We know that we are of God and the whole world is lying in the evil one twenty And we know that the Son of God is come and has given us understanding that we may know the True one and we are in the True One in his Son Jesus Christ This is the true God and eternal life twenty one Little children keep yourselves from the idols THE SECOND LETTER OF JOHN THE elder to the elect lady and to her children whom I love in truth and not I alone but also all that know the truth two for the sake of the truth which abides in us and will be with us forever three Grace mercy peace shall be with you from God the Father and from Jesus Christ the Son of the Father in truth and love four I rejoiced greatly that I have found of thy children walking in truth as we received commandment from the Father five And now I beseech thee lady not as writing to thee a new commandment but that which we had from the beginning that we love one another six And this is love that we walk according to his commandment and this is the
